Text

[Most people in [this world]691-this world]690-most people in this world seem to live " in character "[690-most people in this world] ; [they]690-most people in this world have a beginning , a middle and an end , and [the three]692-the three are congruous one with another and true to the rules of [their]690-most people in this world type . [You]693-you can speak of [them]690-most people in this world as being of [this sort of people]694-this sort of people or that . [They]690-most people in this world are , as [theatrical people]695-theatrical people say , no more ( and no less ) than " [character actors]4304-character actors . "[695-theatrical people] [They]690-most people in this world have a class , [they]690-most people in this world have a place , [they]690-most people in this world know what is becoming in [them]690-most people in this world and what is due to [them]690-most people in this world , and [their]690-most people in this world proper size of tombstone tells at last how properly [they]690-most people in this world have played the part . But there is also another kind of life that is not so much living as a miscellaneous tasting of life . [One]696-one gets hit by some unusual transverse force , [one]696-one is jerked out of one 's stratum and lives crosswise for the rest of the time , and , as it were , in a succession of samples . That has been [my]0-i lot , and that is what has set [me]0-i at last writing something in the nature of a novel . [I]0-i have got an unusual series of impressions that [I]0-i want very urgently to tell . [I]0-i have seen life at very different levels , and at all these levels [I]0-i have seen it with a sort of intimacy and in good faith . [I]0-i have been [a native in [many social countries]699-many social countries]698-a native in many social countries . [I]0-i have been [the unwelcome guest of [a working baker]701-a working baker]700-the unwelcome guest of a working baker , [[my]0-i cousin , who has since died in [the Chatham infirmary]703-the chatham infirmary]702-my cousin , who has since died in the chatham infirmary ; [I]0-i have eaten illegal snacks — the unjustifiable gifts of [footmen]704-footmen — in pantries , and been despised for [my]0-i want of style ( and subsequently married and divorced ) by [the daughter of [a gasworks clerk]706-a gasworks clerk]705-the daughter of a gasworks clerk ; and — to go to [my]0-i other extreme — [I]0-i was once — oh , glittering days!—an item in [the house]707-the house — party of [a countess]708-a countess . [She]708-a countess was , [I]0-i admit , [a countess with a financial aspect]709-a countess with a financial aspect , but still , [you]710-you know , [a countess]708-a countess . [I]0-i 've seen [these people]712-these people at various angles . At the dinner - table [I]0-i 've met not simply [the titled]713-the titled but [the great]714-the great . On one occasion — it is [my]0-i brightest memory — [I]0-i upset [my]0-i champagne over the trousers of [the greatest statesman in the empire]715-the greatest statesman in the empire — Heaven forbid [I]0-i should be so invidious as to name [him!—in]716-him!—in the warmth of [our]717-our mutual admiration . And once ( though it is the most incidental thing in [my]0-i life ) [I]0-i murdered [a man]718-a man .... Yes , [I]0-i 've seen a curious variety of people and ways of living altogether . [Odd people]719-odd people [they]719-odd people all are great and small , very much alike at bottom and curiously different on [their]719-odd people surfaces . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had ranged just a little further both up and down , seeing [I]0-i have ranged so far . [Royalty]720-royalty must be worth knowing and very great fun . But [my]0-i contacts with [princes]721-princes have been limited to quite public occasions , nor at the other end of the scale have [I]0-i had what [I]0-i should call an inside acquaintance with [that dusty but attractive class of people who go about on the high - roads drunk but enfamille ( so redeeming the minor lapse]722-that dusty but attractive class of people who go about on the high - roads drunk but enfamille ( so redeeming the minor lapse ) , in the summertime , with [a perambulator , lavender to sell , sun - brown children]723-a perambulator , lavender to sell , sun - brown children , a smell , and ambiguous bundles that fire the imagination . [Navvies]350-navvies , [farm - labourers]724-farm - labourers , [sailormen]725-sailormen and [stokers]726-stokers , all such as sit in [1834 beer - houses]727-1834 beer - houses , are beyond [me]0-i also , and [I]0-i suppose must remain so now for ever . [My]0-i intercourse with the ducal rank too has been negligible ; [I]0-i once went shooting with [a duke]728-a duke , and in an outburst of what was no doubt snobbishness , did [my]0-i best to get [him]728-a duke in the legs . But that failed . [I]0-i 'm sorry [I]0-i have n't done the whole lot though .... [You]729-you will ask by what merit [I]0-i achieved this remarkable social range , this extensive cross - section of the British social organism . It was the Accident of Birth . It always is in [England]1-england . Indeed , if [I]0-i may make the remark so cosmic , everything is . But that is by the way . [I]0-i was [[my]0-i uncle 's nephew]730-my uncle 's nephew , and [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle was no less [a person than [Edward Ponderevo]351-ponderevo , whose comet - like transit of the financial heavens]732-a person than edward ponderevo , whose comet - like transit of the financial heavens happened — it is now ten years ago ! Do [you]729-you remember the days of [Ponderevo]351-ponderevo , the great days , [I]0-i mean , of [Ponderevo]351-ponderevo ? Perhaps [you]729-you had a trifle in some world - shaking enterprise ! Then [you]729-you know [him]351-ponderevo only too well . Astraddle on [Tono - Bungay]352-tono - bungay , [he]351-ponderevo flashed athwart the empty heavens — like a comet — rather , like a stupendous rocket!—and overawed investors spoke of [his]351-ponderevo star . At [his]351-ponderevo zenith [he]351-ponderevo burst into a cloud of the most magnificent promotions . What a time that was ! [The Napoleon of domestic conveniences]733-the napoleon of domestic conveniences ! [I]0-i was [[his]351-ponderevo nephew]734-his nephew , [[his]351-ponderevo peculiar and intimate nephew]735-his peculiar and intimate nephew . [I]0-i was hanging on to [his]351-ponderevo coat - tails all the way through . [I]0-i made pills with [him]351-ponderevo in [[the chemist]736-the chemist 's shop at [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst]737-the chemist 's shop at wimblehurst before [he]351-ponderevo began . [I]0-i was , [you]738-you might say , the stick of [his]351-ponderevo rocket ; and after [our]739-our tremendous soar , after [he]351-ponderevo had played with [millions]740-millions , a golden rain in the sky , after [my]0-i bird's - eye view of [the modern world]741-the modern world , [I]0-i fell again , a little scarred and blistered perhaps , two and twenty years older , with [my]0-i youth gone , [my]0-i manhood eaten in upon , but greatly edified , into [this Thames - side yard]742-this thames - side yard , into these white heats and hammerings , amidst the fine realites of steel — to think it all over in [my]0-i leisure and jot down the notes and inconsecutive observations that make this book . It was more , [you]738-you know , than a figurative soar . The zenith of that career was surely [our]739-our flight across [the channel]743-the channel in [the Lord Roberts B]353-lord roberts b .... [I]0-i warn [you]738-you this book is going to be something of an agglomeration . [I]0-i want to trace [my]0-i social trajectory ( and [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle 's ) as the main line of [my]0-i story , but as this is [my]0-i first novel and almost certainly [my]0-i last , [I]0-i want to get in , too , all sorts of things that struck [me]0-i , things that amused [me]0-i and impressions [I]0-i got — even although they do n't minister directly to [my]0-i narrative at all . [I]0-i want to set out [my]0-i own queer love experiences too , such as they are , for they troubled and distressed and swayed [me]0-i hugely , and they still seem to [me]0-i to contain all sorts of irrational and debatable elements that [I]0-i shall be the clearer - headed for getting on paper . And possibly [I]0-i may even flow into descriptions of people who are really no more than [people seen in transit]745-people seen in transit , just because it amuses [me]0-i to recall what [they]745-people seen in transit said and did to [us]746-us , and more particularly how [they]745-people seen in transit behaved in the brief but splendid glare of [Tono - Bungay]352-tono - bungay and [its still more glaring offspring]747-its still more glaring offspring . It lit some of [them]745-people seen in transit up , [I]0-i can assure [you]748-you ! Indeed , [I]0-i want to get in all sorts of things . [My]0-i ideas of a novel all through are comprehensive rather than austere .... [Tono - Bungay]352-tono - bungay still figures on the hoardings , it stands in rows in [[every chemist]749-every chemist 's storeroom]750-every chemist 's storeroom , it still assuages the coughs of age and brightens the elderly eye and loosens the elderly tongue ; but its social glory , its financial illumination , have faded from [the world]751-the world for ever . And [I]0-i , [sole scorched survivor from the blaze]752-sole scorched survivor from the blaze , sit writing of it here in an air that is never still for the clang and thunder of machines , on a table littered with working drawings , and amid fragments of models and notes about velocities and air and water pressures and trajectories — of an altogether different sort from that of [Tono - Bungay]352-tono - bungay . [I]0-i write that much and look at it , and wonder whether , after all , this is any fair statement of what [I]0-i am attempting in this book . [I]0-i 've given , [I]0-i see , an impression that [I]0-i want to make simply a hotch - potch of anecdotes and experiences with [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle swimming in the middle as the largest lump of victual . [I]0-i 'll own that here , with the pen already started , [I]0-i realise what a fermenting mass of things learnt and emotions experienced and theories formed [I]0-i 've got to deal with , and how , in a sense , hopeless [my]0-i book must be from the very outset . [I]0-i suppose what [I]0-i 'm really trying to render is nothing more nor less than Life — as [one man]754-one man has found it . [I]0-i want to tell — [MYSELF]0-i , and [my]0-i impressions of the thing as a whole , to say things [I]0-i have come to feel intensely of the laws , traditions , usages , and ideas [we]755-we call society , and how [we]755-we [poor individuals]756-poor individuals get driven and lured and stranded among these windy , perplexing shoals and channels . [I]0-i 've got , [I]0-i suppose , to a time of life when things begin to take on shapes that have an air of reality , and become no longer material for dreaming , but interesting in themselves . [I]0-i 've reached the criticising , novel - writing age , and here [I]0-i am writing [mine]0-i — [my]0-i one novel — without having any of the discipline to refrain and omit that [I]0-i suppose [the regular novel - writer]757-the regular novel - writer acquires . [I]0-i 've read an average share of novels and made some starts before this beginning , and [I]0-i 've found the restraints and rules of the art ( as [I]0-i made them out ) impossible for [me]0-i . [I]0-i like to write , [I]0-i am keenly interested in writing , but it is not [my]0-i technique . [I]0-i 'm [an engineer with a patent or two and a set of ideas]758-an engineer with a patent or two and a set of ideas ; [most of whatever artist there is in [me]0-i]759-most of whatever artist there is in me has been given to turbine machines and [boat]760-boat building and the problem of flying , and do what [I]0-i will [I]0-i fail to see how [I]0-i can be other than [a lax , undisciplined story - teller]761-a lax , undisciplined story - teller . [I]0-i must sprawl and flounder , comment and theorise , if [I]0-i am to get the thing out [I]0-i have in mind . And it is n't a constructed tale [I]0-i have to tell , but unmanageable realities . [My]0-i love - story — and if only [I]0-i can keep up the spirit of truth - telling all through as strongly as [I]0-i have now , [you]762-you shall have it all — falls into no sort of neat scheme of telling . It involves [three separate feminine persons]763-three separate feminine persons . It 's all mixed up with the other things .... But [I]0-i 've said enough , [I]0-i hope , to excuse [myself]0-i for the method or want of method in what follows , and [I]0-i think [I]0-i had better tell without further delay of [my]0-i boyhood and [my]0-i early impressions in the shadow of [Bladesover House]3-bladesover house . There came a time when [I]0-i realised that [Bladesover House]3-bladesover house was not all it seemed , but when [I]0-i was [a little boy]764-a little boy [I]0-i took the place with the entirest faith as a complete authentic microcosm . [I]0-i believed that the Bladesover system was a little working - model — and not so very little either — of [the whole world]765-the whole world . Let [me]0-i try and give [you]762-you the effect of it . [Bladesover]4-bladesover lies up on [the Kentish Downs]766-the kentish downs , eight miles perhaps from [Ashborough]5-ashborough ; and [[its]4-bladesover old pavilion]767-its old pavilion , [a little wooden parody of [the temple of Vesta at [Tibur]6-tibur]769-the temple of vesta at tibur]768-a little wooden parody of the temple of vesta at tibur , upon [the hill crest behind [the house]707-the house]770-the hill crest behind the house , commands in theory at least a view of [either sea]772-either sea , of [the Channel]743-the channel southward and [the Thames]7-the thames to the northeast . [The park]774-the park is [the second largest in [Kent]8-kent]775-the second largest in kent , [finely wooded with well - placed beeches , many elms and some sweet chestnuts]776-finely wooded with well - placed beeches , many elms and some sweet chestnuts , abounding in little valleys and hollows of bracken , with springs and [a stream]777-a stream and three fine ponds and multitudes of fallow deer . [The house]707-the house was built in the eighteenth century , [it]707-the house is of pale red brick in the style of [a French chateau]779-a french chateau , and save for one pass among the crests which opens to blue distances , to minute , remote , oast - set [farm - houses]780-farm - houses and copses and [wheat fields]781-wheat fields and the occasional gleam of water , [its]707-the house hundred and seventeen windows look on nothing but [its]707-the house own wide and handsome territories . A semi - circular screen of great beeches masks [the church]782-the church and [village]783-village , which cluster picturesquely about [the high road along the skirts of [the great park]785-the great park]784-the high road along the skirts of the great park . Northward , at the remotest corner of that enclosure , is [a second dependent village , [Ropedean]354-ropedean]786-a second dependent village , ropedean , less fortunate in [its]786-a second dependent village , ropedean greater distance and also on account of [a rector]787-a rector . [This divine]788-this divine was indeed rich , but [he]788-this divine was vindictively economical because of some shrinkage of [his]788-this divine tithes ; and by reason of [his]788-this divine use of the word Eucharist for [the Lord]789-the lord 's Supper [he]788-this divine had become altogether estranged from [the great ladies of [Bladesover]4-bladesover]790-the great ladies of bladesover . So that [Ropedean]354-ropedean was in the shadows through all that youthful time . Now the unavoidable suggestion of [that wide park]791-that wide park and [that fair large house , dominating [church]793-church , [village]783-village and [the country side]795-the country side]792-that fair large house , dominating church , village and the country side , was that [they]796-they represented the thing that mattered supremely in [the world]751-the world , and that all other things had significance only in relation to [them]796-they . [They]796-they represented [the Gentry]798-the gentry , the Quality , by and through and for whom the rest of [the world]751-the world , [the farming folk]800-the farming folk and [the labouring folk]801-the labouring folk , [the trades - people of [Ashborough]5-ashborough]802-the trades - people of ashborough , and [the upper servants]803-the upper servants and [the lower servants]804-the lower servants and [the servants of [the estate]806-the estate]805-the servants of the estate , breathed and lived and were permitted . And [the Quality]355-the quality did it so quietly and thoroughly , [the great house]807-the great house mingled so solidly and effectually earth and sky , the contrast of [[its]807-the great house spacious hall]808-its spacious hall and [saloon and galleries]809-saloon and galleries , [[[its]807-the great house airy housekeeper]810-its airy housekeeper 's room]811-its airy housekeeper 's room and [warren of offices]812-warren of offices with the meagre dignities of [the vicar]813-the vicar , and [the pinched and stuffy rooms of even [the post - office people]815-the post - office people and [the grocer]816-the grocer]814-the pinched and stuffy rooms of even the post - office people and the grocer , so enforced these suggestions , that it was only when [I]0-i was [a boy of thirteen or fourteen and some queer inherited strain of scepticism]817-a boy of thirteen or fourteen and some queer inherited strain of scepticism had set [me]0-i doubting whether [Mr. Bartlett]356-mr. bartlett , [the vicar]813-the vicar , did really know with certainty all about [God]357-god , that as a further and deeper step in doubting [I]0-i began to question the final rightness of [the gentlefolks]819-the gentlefolks , [their]819-the gentlefolks primary necessity in the scheme of things . But once that scepticism had awakened it took [me]0-i fast and far . By fourteen [I]0-i had achieved terrible blasphemies and sacrilege ; [I]0-i had resolved to marry [[a viscount]820-a viscount 's daughter]821-a viscount 's daughter , and [I]0-i had blacked the left eye — [I]0-i think it was the left — of [[her]821-a viscount 's daughter half - brother]822-her half - brother , in open and declared rebellion . But of that in its place . [The great house]807-the great house , [the church]782-the church , [the village]825-the village , and [the labourers]826-the labourers and [the servants]827-the servants in [their]827-the servants stations and degrees , seemed to [me]0-i , [I]0-i say , to be a closed and complete social system . About [us]828-us were [other villages]829-other villages and [great estates]830-great estates , and from [house]831-house to [house]831-house , interlacing , [correlated]833-correlated , [the Gentry]798-the gentry , [the fine Olympians]835-the fine olympians , came and went . [The country towns]836-the country towns seemed mere collections of [ships]837-ships , [marketing places for [the tenantry]839-the tenantry]838-marketing places for the tenantry , centres for such education as [they]836-the country towns needed , as entirely dependent on [the gentry]798-the gentry as [the village]825-the village and scarcely less directly so . [I]0-i thought this was the order of [the whole world]765-the whole world . [I]0-i thought [London]9-london was only [a greater country town]843-a greater country town where [the gentle - folk]844-the gentle - folk kept [town - houses]845-town - houses and did [[their]844-the gentle - folk greater shopping]846-their greater shopping under the magnificent shadow of [the greatest of [all fine gentlewomen]848-all fine gentlewomen]847-the greatest of all fine gentlewomen , [the Queen]849-the queen . It seemed to be in the divine order . That all this fine appearance was already sapped , that there were forces at work that might presently carry all this elaborate social system in which [[my]0-i mother]850-my mother instructed [me]0-i so carefully that [I]0-i might understand [my]0-i " place , "[849-the queen] to Limbo , had scarcely dawned upon [me]0-i even by the time that [Tono - Bungay]352-tono - bungay was fairly launched upon [the world]751-the world . There are [many people in [England]1-england]852-many people in england to - day upon whom it has not yet dawned . There are times when [I]0-i doubt whether [any but a very inconsiderable minority of English people]853-any but a very inconsiderable minority of english people realise how extensively this ostensible order has even now passed away . [The great houses]854-the great houses stand in [the parks]855-the parks still , [the cottages]856-the cottages cluster respectfully on [their]856-the cottages borders , touching [their]856-the cottages eaves with [their]856-the cottages creepers , [the English countryside]857-the english countryside — [you]858-you can range through [Kent]8-kent from [Bladesover]4-bladesover northward and see persists obstinately in looking what it was . It is like an early day in a fine October . The hand of change rests on it all , unfelt , unseen ; resting for awhile , as it were half reluctantly , before it grips and ends the thing for ever . One frost and the whole face of things will be bare , links snap , patience end , [our]859-our fine foliage of pretences lie glowing in the mire . For that [we]859-our have still to wait a little while . The new order may have gone far towards shaping itself , but just as in that sort of lantern show that used to be known in [the village]825-the village as the " Dissolving Views , "[862-our children 's children] the scene that is going remains upon the mind , traceable and evident , and the newer picture is yet enigmatical long after the lines that are to replace those former ones have grown bright and strong , so that [the new [England]1-england of [[our]859-our children 's children]862-our children 's children]861-the new england of our children 's children is still a riddle to [me]0-i . The ideas of democracy , of equality , and above all of promiscuous fraternity have certainly never really entered into the English mind . But what IS coming into it ? All this book , [I]0-i hope , will bear a little on that . [[Our]859-our people]863-our people never formulates ; it keeps words for jests and ironies . In the meanwhile the old shapes , the old attitudes remain , subtly changed and changing still , sheltering [strange tenants]864-strange tenants . On the whole [I]0-i am glad that [I]0-i saw so much as [I]0-i did of [Bladesover]4-bladesover — if for no other reason than because seeing it when [I]0-i did , quite naively , believing in it thoroughly , and then coming to analyse it , has enabled [me]0-i to understand much that would be absolutely incomprehensible in the structure of English society . [Bladesover]4-bladesover is , [I]0-i am convinced , the clue to almost all that is distinctively British and perplexing to the foreign inquirer in [England]1-england and [the English - speaking peoples]1022-the english - speaking peoples . Grasp firmly that [England]1-england was all [Bladesover]4-bladesover two hundred years ago ; that it has had Reform Acts indeed , and such - like changes of formula , but no essential revolution since then ; that all that is modern and different has come in as a thing intruded or as a gloss upon this predominant formula , either impertinently or apologetically ; and [you]1023-you will perceive at once the reasonableness , the necessity , of that snobbishness which is the distinctive quality of English thought . [Everybody who is not actually in the shadow of a Bladesover]1024-everybody who is not actually in the shadow of a bladesover is as it were perpetually seeking after lost orientations . [We]1025-we have never broken with [our]1025-we tradition , never even symbolically hewed it to pieces , as [the French]369-french did in quivering fact in [the Terror]14-the terror . But all the organizing ideas have slackened , the old habitual bonds have relaxed or altogether come undone . [Mrs. Mackridge]372-mrs. mackridge was large and dark ; there was a marvel about [her]372-mrs. mackridge head , inasmuch as [she]372-mrs. mackridge was bald . When [she]372-mrs. mackridge told [you]1049-you it was a fine morning , [she]372-mrs. mackridge seemed also to be telling [you]1049-you [you]1049-you were [a fool]1050-a fool and [a low fool to boot]1051-a low fool to boot ; when [she]372-mrs. mackridge was spoken to , [she]372-mrs. mackridge had a way of acknowledging [your]1049-you poor tinkle of utterance with a voluminous , scornful " Haw ! "[372-mrs. mackridge] that made [you]1049-you want to burn [her]372-mrs. mackridge alive . [She]372-mrs. mackridge also had a way of saying " [Indade]377-indade ! [[My]1086-queer fellows father]1013-my father , [I]1086-queer fellows believe , was [a sceptic]4330-a sceptic ; [[my]1086-queer fellows mother]850-my mother was certainly [a hard woman]4332-a hard woman . Do n't imagine [I]1086-queer fellows deny that was a fine thing for [me]1086-queer fellows . [Bladesover]4-bladesover , in absorbing [the whole countryside]4347-the whole countryside , had not altogether missed greatness . The Bladesover system has at least done one good thing for [England]1-england , it has abolished the peasant habit of mind . If many of [us]4348-us still live and breathe [pantry]4349-pantry and [[housekeeper]868-housekeeper 's room]4351-housekeeper 's room , [we]4348-us are quit of the dream of living by economising parasitically on hens and pigs .... About [that park]4352-that park there were some elements of a liberal education ; there was [a great space of greensward]4353-a great space of greensward not given over to manure and food grubbing ; there was mystery , there was matter for the imagination . [It]4352-that park was still [a park of deer]4354-a park of deer . [I]1086-queer fellows saw something of the life of these dappled creatures , heard the belling of stags , came upon young fawns among the bracken , found bones , skulls , and antlers in [lonely places]4355-lonely places . There were corners that gave a gleam of meaning to [the word forest]4356-the word forest , glimpses of unstudied natural splendour . There was a slope of bluebells in the broken sunlight under the newly green beeches in [the west wood]4357-the west wood that is now precious sapphire in [my]1086-queer fellows memory ; it was the first time that [I]1086-queer fellows knowingly met [Beauty]380-beauty . And in [the house]707-the house there were books . The rubbish old Lady Drew read [I]1086-queer fellows never saw ; stuff of the Maria Monk type , [I]1086-queer fellows have since gathered , had a fascination for [her]380-beauty ; but back in the past there had been [a Drew of intellectual enterprise]4359-a drew of intellectual enterprise , [Sir Cuthbert]381-sir cuthbert , [the son of [Sir Matthew who built [the house]707-the house]4361-sir matthew who built the house]4360-the son of sir matthew who built the house ; and thrust away , neglected and despised , in [an old room]4363-an old room [upstairs]942-upstairs , were books and treasures of [his]4359-a drew of intellectual enterprise that [[my]1086-queer fellows mother]850-my mother let [me]1086-queer fellows rout among during a spell of wintry wet . " There were Terrae Incognitae in [every continent]4372-every continent then , [Poland]26-poland , [Sarmatia]27-sarmatia , lands since lost ; and many a voyage [I]1086-queer fellows made with a blunted pin about that large , incorrect and dignified world . So [I]1086-queer fellows read and understood the good sound rhetoric of [Tom Paine]385-tom paine 's "[1086-queer fellows] Rights of [Man]1088-man , " and [his]385-tom paine "[1088-man] Common Sense , " excellent books , once praised by [bishops]4377-bishops and since sedulously lied about . [Gulliver]386-gulliver was there unexpurgated , strong meat for [a boy]905-a boy perhaps but not too strong [I]1088-man hold — [I]1088-man have never regretted that [I]1088-man escaped niceness in these affairs . These readings whetted [my]1088-man taste for more , and surreptitiously [I]1088-man raided the bookcases in [the big saloon]4379-the big saloon . [I]1088-man got through quite a number of books before [my]1088-man sacrilegious temerity was discovered by [Ann]393-ann , [the old head - housemaid]4380-the old head - housemaid . The thought of " Vathek "[1086-queer fellows] always brings back with it [my]0-i boyish memory of [the big saloon at [Bladesover]4-bladesover]1090-the big saloon at bladesover . It was [a huge long room with many windows opening upon [the park]774-the park]1091-a huge long room with many windows opening upon the park , and each window — there were a dozen or more reaching from the floor up — had [its]1090-the big saloon at bladesover elaborate silk or satin curtains , heavily fringed , a canopy ( is it ? ) above , [its]1090-the big saloon at bladesover completely white shutters folding into the deep thickness of the wall . At either end of [that great still place]1093-that great still place was an immense marble chimney - piece ; the end by the bookcase showed the wolf and [Romulus]394-romulus and [Remus]395-remus , with [Homer]396-homer and [Virgil]397-virgil for [supporters]1094-supporters ; the design of the other end [I]0-i have forgotten . [Frederick]398-frederick , [Prince of [Wales]28-wales]1095-prince of wales , swaggered flatly over the one , twice life - size , but mellowed by the surface gleam of oil ; and over the other was an equally colossal group of departed Drews as sylvan deities , scantily clad , against a storm - rent sky . Down the centre of the elaborate ceiling were three chandeliers , each bearing some hundreds of dangling glass lustres , and over the interminable carpet — it impressed [me]0-i as about as big as [Sarmatia]27-sarmatia in [the store - room Atlas]1096-the store - room atlas — were islands and archipelagoes of chintz - covered chairs and couches , tables , great Sevres vases on pedestals , [a bronze man]1097-a bronze man and horse . Somewhere in [this wilderness]1098-this wilderness [one]696-one came , [I]0-i remember , upon — a big harp beside a lyre - shaped music stand , and a grand piano .... The book - borrowing raid was one of extraordinary dash and danger . [One]696-one came down [the main service stairs]1101-the main service stairs — that was legal , and illegality began in a little landing when , very cautiously , [one]696-one went through a red baize door . [A little passage]1103-a little passage led to [the hall]1104-the hall , and here one reconnoitered for [Ann]393-ann , [the old head - housemaid]4380-the old head - housemaid — [the younger housemaids]1106-the younger housemaids were friendly and did not count . [Ann]393-ann located , came a dash across the open space at the foot of that great staircase that has never been properly descended since powder went out of fashion , and so to [the saloon]4374-the saloon door . A beast of an oscillating Chinaman in china , as large as life , grimaced and quivered to one 's lightest steps . That door was [the perilous place]1108-the perilous place ; [it]1108-the perilous place was double with the thickness of the wall between , so that [one]696-one could not listen beforehand for the whisk of the feather - brush on the other side . Oddly rat - like , is it not , this darting into enormous places in pursuit of the abandoned crumbs of thought ? And [I]0-i found [Langhorne]400-langhorne 's " Plutarch "[400-langhorne] too , [I]0-i remember , on those shelves . It seems queer to [me]0-i now to think that [I]0-i acquired pride and self - respect , the idea of a state and the germ of public spirit , in such a furtive fashion ; queer , too , that it should rest with [an old Greek]1110-an old greek , dead these eighteen hundred years to teach that . [The school [I]0-i went to]1111-the school i went to was [the sort of school the Bladesover system permitted]1112-the sort of school the bladesover system permitted . [The public schools that add comic]1113-the public schools that add comic into existence in the brief glow of the Renascence had been taken possession of by [the ruling class]1114-the ruling class ; [the lower classes]1115-the lower classes were not supposed to stand in need of [schools]1116-schools , and [[our]1117-we middle stratum]1118-our middle stratum got [the schools [it]1118-our middle stratum deserved]1119-the schools it deserved , [private schools]1120-private schools , schools [any unqualified pretender]1121-any unqualified pretender was free to establish . [The building]1125-the building was [a dingy yellow - brick residence outside [the village]825-the village]1126-a dingy yellow - brick residence outside the village , with [the schoolroom]1128-the schoolroom as an outbuilding of lath and plaster . [I]0-i do not remember that [my]0-i school - days were unhappy - indeed [I]0-i recall a good lot of fine mixed fun in them — but [I]0-i can not without grave risk of misinterpretation declare that [we]1117-we were at all nice and refined . [We]1117-we fought much , not sound formal fighting , but " scrapping "[1117-we] of a sincere and murderous kind , into which one might bring [one]696-one 's boots — it made [us]1117-we tough at any rate — and [several of [us]1117-we]1130-several of us were [the sons of [London]9-london publicans]1131-the sons of london publicans , who distinguished " scraps "[1117-we] where [one meant to hurt from ordered pugilism , practising both arts]1132-one meant to hurt from ordered pugilism , practising both arts , and having , moreover , precocious linguistic gifts . [[Our]1117-we cricket - field]1133-our cricket - field was bald about the wickets , and [we]1117-we played without style and disputed with [the umpire]1134-the umpire ; and the teaching was chiefly in the hands of [a lout of nineteen , who wore ready - made clothes and taught despicably]1135-a lout of nineteen , who wore ready - made clothes and taught despicably . [The head - master and proprietor]1136-the head - master and proprietor taught [us]1117-we arithmetic , algebra , and Euclid , and to [the older boys]1137-the older boys even trigonometry , [himself]1136-the head - master and proprietor ; [he]1136-the head - master and proprietor had a strong mathematical bias , and [I]0-i think now that by the standard of [a British public school]1138-a british public school [he]1136-the head - master and proprietor did rather well by [us]1117-we . [We]1117-we had one inestimable privilege at [that school]1139-that school , and that was spiritual neglect . [We]1117-we dealt with [one another]1140-one another with the forcible simplicity of [natural boys]1141-natural boys , [we]1117-we " cheeked , "[1117-we] and " punched "[1117-we] and " clouted "[1117-we] ; [we]1117-we thought [ourselves]1117-we [Red Indians]401-red indians and [cowboys]1142-cowboys and such - like honourable things , and not [young English gentlemen]1143-young english gentlemen ; [we]1117-we never felt the strain of " [Onward Christian soldiers]4381-onward christian soldiers , "[1117-we] nor were swayed by any premature piety in the cold oak pew of [our]1117-we Sunday devotions . All that was good . [We]1117-we spent [our]1117-we rare pennies in the uncensored reading matter of [[the village dame]1144-the village dame 's shop]1145-the village dame 's shop , on [the Boys of [England]1-england]1146-the boys of england , and honest penny dreadfuls — ripping stuff , stuff that anticipated [Haggard and Stevenson]402-haggard and stevenson , badly printed and queerly illustrated , and very very good for [us]1117-we . On [our]1117-we half - holidays [we]1117-we were allowed the unusual freedom of rambling in twos and threes wide and far about [the land]1147-the land , talking experimentally , dreaming wildly . There was much in [those walks]1148-those walks ! To this day the landscape of [the Kentish world]1149-the kentish world , with [its]1149-the kentish world low broad distances , [its]1149-the kentish world [hop gardens]1150-hop gardens and golden stretches of wheat , [its]1149-the kentish world oasts and [square church towers]1151-square church towers , [its]1149-the kentish world background of downland and hangers , has for [me]0-i a faint sense of adventure added to the pleasure of its beauty . [We]1117-we smoked on occasion , but [nobody]1152-nobody put [us]1117-we up to the proper " boyish "[1152-nobody] things to do ; [we]1117-we never " robbed [an orchard]4382-an orchard "[1152-nobody] for example , though there were orchards all about [us]1117-we , [we]1117-we thought stealing was sinful , [we]1117-we stole incidental apples and turnips and strawberries from [the fields]1153-the fields indeed , but in a criminal inglorious fashion , and afterwards [we]1117-we were ashamed . [We]1117-we had [our]1117-we days of adventure , but they were natural accidents , [our]1117-we own adventures . There was one hot day when several of [us]1117-we , walking out towards [Maidstone]29-maidstone , were incited by the devil to despise ginger beer , and [we]1117-we fuddled [ourselves]1117-we dreadfully with ale ; and a time when [our]1117-we young minds were infected to the pitch of buying pistols , by the legend of [the Wild West]30-the wild west . [Young Roots]403-young roots from [Highbury]31-highbury came back with a revolver and cartridges , and [we]1117-we went off six strong to live a free wild life one holiday afternoon . [We]1117-we fired [our]1117-we first shot deep in [the old flint mine]1154-the old flint mine at [Chiselstead]32-chiselstead , and nearly burst [our]1117-we ear drums ; then [we]1117-we fired in a primrose studded wood by [Pickthorn Green]33-pickthorn green , and [I]0-i gave a false alarm of " [keeper]4383-keeper , "[0-i] and [we]1117-we fled in disorder for a mile . After which [Roots]403-young roots suddenly shot at a pheasant in [the high road]1155-the high road by [Chiselstead]32-chiselstead , and then [young Barker]404-young barker told lies about the severity of the game laws and made [Roots]403-young roots sore afraid , and [we]1117-we hid the pistol in [a dry ditch outside [the school field]1157-the school field]1156-a dry ditch outside the school field . A day or so after [we]1117-we got in again , and ignoring a certain fouling and rusting of the barrel , tried for a rabbit at three hundred yards . [Young Roots]403-young roots blew a molehill at twenty paces into a dust cloud , burnt [his]403-young roots fingers , and scorched [his]403-young roots face ; and the weapon having once displayed this strange disposition to flame back upon [the shooter]1158-the shooter , was not subsequently fired . One main source of excitement for [us]1117-we was " cheeking "[920-people] [people]920-people in [vans and carts]1160-vans and carts upon [the Goudhurst road]1161-the goudhurst road ; and getting [myself]0-i into a monstrous white mess in [the chalk pits]1162-the chalk pits beyond [the village]825-the village , and catching yellow jaundice as a sequel to bathing stark naked with [three other Adamites]1164-three other adamites , [old Ewart]405-ewart leading that function , in [the rivulet across [Hickson]34-hickson 's meadows]1165-the rivulet across hickson 's meadows , are among [my]0-i memorabilia . Those free imaginative afternoons ! how much [they]1166-they were for [us]1117-we ! how much [they]1166-they did for [us]1117-we ! All streams came from [the then undiscovered " sources of [the Nile]35-the nile]4384-the then undiscovered " sources of the nile "[1166-they] in those days , all thickets were [Indian jungles]1167-indian jungles , and [our]1117-we best game , [I]0-i say it with pride , [I]0-i invented . [I]0-i got it out of [the Bladesover saloon]1168-the bladesover saloon . [We]1117-we found a wood where " Trespassing "[0-i] was forbidden , and did the " Retreat of the Ten Thousand "[0-i] through [it]1169-it from end to end , cutting [our]1117-we way bravely through a host of nettle beds that barred [our]1117-we path , and not forgetting to weep and kneel when at last [we]1117-we emerged within sight of [the High Road Sea]36-the high road sea . So [we]1117-we have burst at times , weeping and rejoicing , upon [startled wayfarers]1170-startled wayfarers . Usually [I]0-i took the part of [that distinguished general Xenophen]1171-that distinguished general xenophen — and please note the quantity of the o. [I]0-i have all [my]0-i classical names like that,—Socrates rhymes with [Bates]406-bates for [me]0-i , and except when the bleak eye of [some scholar]1172-some scholar warns [me]0-i of [his]1172-some scholar standards of judgment , [I]0-i use those dear old mispronunciations still . The little splash into Latin made during [my]0-i days as [a chemist]1173-a chemist washed off nothing of the habit . Well,—if [I]0-i met [those great gentlemen of the past]1174-those great gentlemen of the past with [their]1174-those great gentlemen of the past accents carelessly adjusted [I]0-i did at least meet [them]1174-those great gentlemen of the past alive , as an equal , and in a living tongue . Altogether [[my]0-i school]1175-my school might easily have been worse for [me]0-i , and among other good things it gave [me]0-i [a friend who has lasted [my]0-i life out]1176-a friend who has lasted my life out . This was [Ewart]405-ewart , who is now [a monumental artist at [Woking]37-woking]1177-a monumental artist at woking , after many vicissitudes . [Dear chap]1178-dear chap , how [he]405-ewart did stick out of [his]405-ewart clothes to be sure ! [He]405-ewart was a longlimbed lout , ridiculously tall beside [my]0-i more youth full compactness , and , except that there was no black moustache under [his]405-ewart nose blob , [he]405-ewart had the same round knobby face as [he]405-ewart has to - day , the same bright and active hazel brown eyes , the stare , the meditative moment , the insinuating reply . Surely [no boy]1179-no boy ever played [the fool]1180-the fool as [Bob Ewart]405-ewart used to play it , [no boy]1179-no boy had a readier knack of mantling [the world]751-the world with wonder . Commonness vanished before [Ewart]405-ewart , at [his]405-ewart expository touch all things became memorable and rare . From [him]405-ewart [I]0-i first heard tell of love , but only after its barbs were already sticking in [my]0-i heart . [He]405-ewart was , [I]0-i know now [the bastard of [that great improvident artist]1184-that great improvident artist , [Rickmann Ewart]481-ewart]1183-the bastard of that great improvident artist , rickmann ewart ; [he]405-ewart brought the light of a lax world that at least had not turned its back upon beauty , into the growing fermentation of [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i won [his]405-ewart heart by a version of [Vathek]408-vathek , and after that [we]1185-we were [inseparable yarning friends]1186-inseparable yarning friends . [We]1185-we merged [our]1185-we intellectual stock so completely that [I]0-i wonder sometimes how much [I]0-i did not become [Ewart]481-ewart , how much [Ewart]481-ewart is not vicariously and derivatively [me]0-i . And then when [I]0-i had newly passed [my]0-i fourteenth birthday , came [my]0-i tragic disgrace . It was in [my]0-i midsummer holidays that the thing happened , and it was through [the Honourable Beatrice Normandy]409-beatrice . [She]409-beatrice had " come into [my]409-beatrice life , "[409-beatrice] as [they]1187-they say , before [I]0-i was twelve . [She]409-beatrice descended unexpectedly into a peaceful interlude that followed the annual going of [those Three Great Women]1188-those three great women . [She]409-beatrice came into [the old nursery]1189-the old nursery [upstairs]942-upstairs , and every day [she]409-beatrice had tea with [us]1191-us in [[the housekeeper]904-the housekeeper 's room]916-the housekeeper 's room . [She]409-beatrice was eight , and [she]409-beatrice came with [a nurse]1194-a nurse called [Nannie]410-nannie ; and to begin with , [I]0-i did not like [her]409-beatrice at all . [Nobody]1152-nobody liked this irruption into the [downstairs rooms]1196-downstairs rooms ; [the two]1197-the two " gave trouble,"-a[1197-the two] dire offence ; [Nannie]410-nannie 's sense of duty to [her]410-nannie charge led to requests and demands that took [[my]0-i mother]850-my mother 's breath away . Eggs at unusual times , the reboiling of milk , the rejection of an excellent milk pudding - not negotiated respectfully but dictated as of right . [Nannie]410-nannie was [a dark , longfeatured , taciturn woman in a grey dress]1199-a dark , longfeatured , taciturn woman in a grey dress ; [she]410-nannie had a furtive inflexibility of manner that finally dismayed and crushed and overcame . [She]410-nannie conveyed [she]410-nannie was " under orders"-like[410-nannie] a Greek tragedy . [She]410-nannie was [that strange product of the old time]1200-that strange product of the old time , [a devoted , trusted servant]1201-a devoted , trusted servant ; [she]410-nannie had , as it were , banked all [her]410-nannie pride and will with [the greater , more powerful people who employed [her]410-nannie , in return for a life - long security of servitude]1202-the greater , more powerful people who employed her , in return for a life - long security of servitude - the bargain was nonetheless binding for being implicit . Finally [they]1203-they were to pension [her]410-nannie , and [she]410-nannie would die the hated treasure of [a boarding - house]1204-a boarding - house . [She]410-nannie had built up in [herself]410-nannie an enormous habit of reference to [these upstairs people]1205-these upstairs people , [she]410-nannie had curbed down all discordant murmurings of [her]410-nannie soul , [her]410-nannie very instincts were perverted or surrendered . [She]410-nannie was sexless , [her]410-nannie personal pride was all transferred , [she]410-nannie mothered [[another woman]1206-another woman 's child]1207-another woman 's child with a hard , joyless devotion that was at least entirely compatible with a stoical separation . [She]410-nannie treated [us]1208-us all as things that counted for nothing save to fetch and carry for [her]410-nannie charge . But [the Honourable Beatrice]409-beatrice could condescend . The queer chances of later years come between [me]0-i and a distinctly separated memory of that childish face . When [I]0-i think of [Beatrice]409-beatrice , [I]0-i think of [her]409-beatrice as [I]0-i came to know [her]409-beatrice at a later time , when at last [I]0-i came to know [her]409-beatrice so well that indeed now [I]0-i could draw [her]409-beatrice , and show a hundred little delicate things [you]1209-you would miss in looking at [her]409-beatrice . But even then [I]0-i remember how [I]0-i noted the infinite delicacy of [her]409-beatrice childish skin and the fine eyebrow , finer than the finest feather that ever one felt on the breast of a bird . [She]409-beatrice was one of [those elfin , rather precocious little girls , quick coloured , with dark hair , naturally curling dusky hair that was sometimes astray over [her]409-beatrice eyes , and eyes that were sometimes impishly dark , and sometimes a clear brown yellow . So [our]1218-our acquaintance began , and presently was deepened by a whim of [hers]409-beatrice . [She]409-beatrice had a cold and was kept [indoors]1219-indoors , and confronted [Nannie]410-nannie suddenly with the alternative of being hopelessly naughty , which in [her]409-beatrice case involved a generous amount of screaming unsuitable for the ears of [an elderly , shaky , rich aunt]1220-an elderly , shaky , rich aunt , or having [me]0-i up to [the nursery]1221-the nursery to play with [her]409-beatrice all the afternoon . [Nannie]410-nannie came [downstairs]874-downstairs and borrowed [me]0-i in a careworn manner ; and [I]0-i was handed over to the little creature as if [I]0-i was some large variety of kitten . [I]0-i had never had anything to do with [a little girl]1223-a little girl before , [I]0-i thought [she]1223-a little girl was more beautiful and wonderful and bright than anything else could possibly be in life , and [she]410-nannie found [me]0-i the gentlest of [slaves]1224-slaves - though at the same time , as [I]0-i made evident , fairly strong . And [Nannie]410-nannie was amazed to find the afternoon slip cheerfully and rapidly away . [She]410-nannie praised [my]0-i manners to [Lady Drew]359-lady drew and to [[my]0-i mother]850-my mother , who said [she]850-my mother was glad to hear well of [me]0-i , and after that [I]0-i played with [Beatrice]409-beatrice several times . The toys [she]409-beatrice had remain in [my]0-i memory still as great splendid things , gigantic to all [my]0-i previous experience of toys , and [we]1226-we even went to [the great doll 's house on [the nursery landing]1228-the nursery landing]1227-the great doll 's house on the nursery landing to play discreetly with that , [the great doll 's house]1229-the great doll 's house that [the Prince Regent]1230-the prince regent had given [Sir Harry Drew]411-sir harry drew 's first - born ( who died at five ) , that was a not ineffectual model of [Bladesover]4-bladesover itself , and contained eighty - five dolls and had cost hundreds of pounds . Now [I]0-i sit down to write [my]0-i story and tell over again things in [their]1234-their order , [I]0-i find for the first time how inconsecutive and irrational a thing the memory can be . [One]696-one recalls acts and can not recall motives ; one recalls quite vividly moments that stand out inexplicably - things adrift , joining on to nothing , leading nowhere . [This halfbrother]1237-this halfbrother , [Archie Garvell]363-archie , was a new factor in the affair . [I]0-i remember [him]363-archie clearly as [a fair - haired , supercilious looking , weedily - lank boy]1238-a fair - haired , supercilious looking , weedily - lank boy , much taller than [I]0-i , but [I]0-i should imagine very little heavier , and that [we]1239-we hated [each other]1240-each other by a sort of instinct from the beginning ; and yet [I]0-i can not remember [my]0-i first meeting with [him]363-archie at all . Looking back into these past things - it is like rummaging in [a neglected attic]1241-a neglected attic that has experienced the attentions of [some whimsical robber]1242-some whimsical robber - [I]0-i can not even account for the presence of [these children]1243-these children at [Bladesover]4-bladesover . [I]0-i am certain [I]0-i knew quite a lot about love at fourteen and that [I]0-i was quite as much in love with [Beatrice]409-beatrice then as [any impassioned adult]1258-any impassioned adult could be , and that [Beatrice]409-beatrice was , in [her]409-beatrice way , in love with [me]0-i . " What will [you]363-archie be ? "[1265-the sweet imp] said [she]1265-the sweet imp . [I]0-i ran [my]0-i mind hastily over the professions . " Will [you]363-archie be [a soldier]4391-a soldier ? "[0-i] " But [an officer]4394-an officer ? "[1265-the sweet imp] " [I]0-i do n't know , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , evading a shameful difficulty . " [I]0-i 'd rather go into [the navy]4395-the navy . "[0-i] " Would n't [you]1265-the sweet imp like to fight ? "[1265-the sweet imp] " [I]0-i 'd like to fight , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " But [a common soldier]4396-a common soldier it 's no honour to have to be told to fight and to be looked down upon while [you]1265-the sweet imp do it , and how could [I]0-i be [an officer]4394-an officer ? "[0-i] " Could n't [you]0-i be ? "[1265-the sweet imp] [she]1265-the sweet imp said , and looked at [me]0-i doubtfully ; and the spaces of the social system opened between [us]1268-us . Then , as became [a male of spirit]1269-a male of spirit , [I]0-i took upon [myself]0-i to brag and lie [my]0-i way through this trouble . [I]0-i said [I]0-i was [a poor man]1270-a poor man , and [poor men]1271-poor men went into [the navy]4395-the navy ; that [I]0-i " knew "[0-i] mathematics , which [no army officer]1273-no army officer did ; and [I]0-i claimed [Nelson]413-nelson for an exemplar , and spoke very highly of [my]0-i outlook upon blue water . " [He]413-nelson loved [Lady Hamilton]414-lady hamilton , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " although [she]414-lady hamilton was [a lady]4398-a lady - and [I]0-i will love [you]1276-my lady . "[0-i] [We]1274-we were somewhere near that when [the egregious governess]1275-the egregious governess became audible , calling " [Beeee]415-beeee - atrice ! Beeee - e - atrice ! "[1276-my lady] said [[my]0-i lady]1276-my lady suddenly , holding out a grubby hand ; and [I]0-i went very close to [her]1276-my lady , and [she]1276-my lady put [her]1276-my lady little head down upon the wall until [her]1276-my lady black fog of hair tickled [my]0-i cheek . " [You]0-i are [[my]1276-my lady humble , [faithful lover]4400-faithful lover]4399-my humble , faithful lover , "[1276-my lady] [she]1276-my lady demanded in a whisper , [her]1276-my lady warm flushed face near touching [mine]0-i , and [her]1276-my lady eyes very dark and lustrous . " [I]0-i am [[your]1276-my lady humble , faithful lover]4401-your humble , faithful lover , "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered back . And [she]1276-my lady put [her]1276-my lady arm about [my]0-i head and put out [her]1276-my lady lips and [we]1279-we kissed , and boy though [I]0-i was , [I]0-i was all atremble . So [we]1279-we two kissed for the first time . " Beeee - e - e - a - trice ! "[1279-we] fearfully close . [[My]0-i lady]1276-my lady had vanished , with one wild kick of [her]1276-my lady black - stocking leg . A moment after , [I]0-i heard [her]1276-my lady sustaining the reproaches of [[her]1276-my lady governess]1281-her governess , and explaining [her]1276-my lady failure to answer with an admirable lucidity and disingenuousness . [I]0-i felt it was unnecessary for [me]0-i to be seen just then , and [I]0-i vanished guiltily round the corner into [the West Wood]38-the west wood , and so to love - dreams and single - handed play , wandering along one of [those meandering bracken valleys that varied [Bladesover park]1283-bladesover park]1282-those meandering bracken valleys that varied bladesover park . And that day and for many days that kiss upon [my]0-i lips was a seal , and by night the seed of dreams . Then [I]0-i remember an expedition [we]1279-we made - [she]1276-my lady , [I]0-i , and [[her]1276-my lady half - brother]822-her half - brother - into [those West Woods]1285-those west woods - [they]1286-they two were supposed to be playing in [the shrubbery]1287-the shrubbery - and how [we]1279-we were [Indians there]1288-indians there , and made a wigwam out of a pile of beech logs , and how [we]1279-we stalked deer , crept near and watched rabbits feeding in a glade , and almost got a squirrel . It was play seasoned with plentiful disputing between [me]0-i and [young Garvell]363-archie , for each firmly insisted upon the leading roles , and only [my]0-i wider reading - [I]0-i had read ten stories to [his]363-archie one - gave [me]0-i the ascendency over [him]363-archie . Also [I]0-i scored over [him]363-archie by knowing how to find the eagle in a bracken stem . And somehow - [I]0-i do n't remember what led to it at all - [I]0-i and [Beatrice]409-beatrice , [two hot and ruffled creatures]1289-two hot and ruffled creatures , crept in among the tall bracken and hid from [him]363-archie . The great fronds rose above [us]1279-we , five feet or more , and as [I]0-i had learnt how to wriggle through that undergrowth with the minimum of betrayal by tossing greenery above , [I]0-i led the way . The ground under bracken is beautifully clear and faintly scented in warm weather ; the stems come up black and then green ; if [you]1290-you crawl flat , [it]1291-it is [a tropical forest]1292-a tropical forest in miniature . [I]0-i led the way and [Beatrice]409-beatrice crawled behind , and then as the green of [the further glade]1293-the further glade opened before [us]1279-we , stopped . [She]409-beatrice crawled up to [me]0-i , [her]409-beatrice hot little face came close to [mine]0-i ; once more [she]409-beatrice looked and breathed close to [me]0-i , and suddenly [she]409-beatrice flung [her]409-beatrice arm about [my]0-i neck and dragged [me]0-i to earth beside [her]409-beatrice , and kissed [me]0-i and kissed [me]0-i again . [We]1279-we kissed , [we]1279-we embraced and kissed again , all without a word ; [we]1279-we desisted , [we]1279-we stared and hesitated - then in a suddenly damped mood and a little perplexed at [ourselves]1279-we , crawled out , to be presently run down and caught in the tamest way by [Archie]363-archie . That comes back very clearly to [me]0-i , and other vague memories - [I]0-i know [old Hall]416-old hall and [his]416-old hall gun , out shooting at jackdaws , came into [our]1279-we common experiences , but [I]0-i do n't remember how ; and then at last , abruptly , [our]1279-we fight in [the Warren]39-the warren stands out . [The Warren]1294-the warren , like [most places in [England]1-england]1295-most places in england that have that name , was not particularly [a warren]1296-a warren , [it]1294-the warren was [a long slope of thorns and beeches]1297-a long slope of thorns and beeches through which a path ran , and made an alternative route to [the downhill carriage road between [Bladesover]4-bladesover and [Ropedean]354-ropedean]1298-the downhill carriage road between bladesover and ropedean . [I]0-i do n't know how [we]1279-we three got [there]865-there , but [I]0-i have an uncertain fancy it was connected with a visit paid by [the governess]1300-the governess to [the Ropedean vicarage people]1301-the ropedean vicarage people . But suddenly [Archie]363-archie and [I]0-i , in discussing a game , fell into a dispute for [Beatrice]409-beatrice . [I]0-i had made [him]363-archie the fairest offer : [I]0-i was to be [a Spanish nobleman]1302-a spanish nobleman , [she]409-beatrice was to be [[my]0-i wife]1303-my wife , and [he]363-archie was to be [a tribe of Indians]1304-a tribe of indians trying to carry [her]409-beatrice off . It seems to [me]0-i a fairly attractive offer to [a boy]905-a boy to be [a whole tribe of Indians with a chance of such a booty]1306-a whole tribe of indians with a chance of such a booty . But [Archie]363-archie suddenly took offence . " No , "[363-archie] [he]363-archie said ; " [we]4402-we ca n't have that ! "[363-archie] " Ca n't have what ? "[363-archie] [He]363-archie pointed a finger at [me]0-i . [He]363-archie had struck to the heart of [my]0-i shame . [I]0-i made the only possible reply by a rush at [him]363-archie . " Hello ! "[363-archie] [he]363-archie cried , at [my]0-i blackavised attack . [He]363-archie dropped back into an attitude that had some style in it , parried [my]0-i blow , got back at [my]0-i cheek , and laughed with surprise and relief at [his]363-archie own success . [Whereupon]417-whereupon [I]0-i became a thing of murderous rage . [He]363-archie could box as well or better than [I]0-i - [he]363-archie had yet to realise [I]0-i knew anything of that at all - but [I]0-i had fought once or twice to a finish with bare fists . [I]0-i was used to inflicting and enduring savage hurting , and [I]0-i doubt if [he]363-archie had ever fought . [I]0-i had n't fought ten seconds before [I]0-i felt this softness in [him]363-archie , realised all that quality of modern upper - class [England]1-england that never goes to the quick , that hedges about rules and those petty points of honour that are the ultimate comminution of honour , that claims credit for things demonstrably half done . [He]363-archie seemed to think that first hit of [his]363-archie and one or two others were going to matter , that [I]0-i ought to give in when presently [my]0-i lip bled and dripped blood upon [my]0-i clothes . So before [we]1309-we had been at it a minute [he]363-archie had ceased to be aggressive except in momentary spurts , and [I]0-i was knocking [him]363-archie about almost as [I]0-i wanted to do ; and demanding breathlessly and fiercely , after [our]1309-we school manner , whether [he]363-archie had had enough , not knowing that by [his]363-archie high code and [his]363-archie soft training it was equally impossible for [him]363-archie to either buck - up and beat [me]0-i , or give in . [I]0-i have a very distinct impression of [Beatrice]409-beatrice dancing about [us]1309-we during the affair in a state of unladylike appreciation , but [I]0-i was too preoccupied to hear much of what [she]409-beatrice was saying . But [she]409-beatrice certainly backed [us]1309-we both , and [I]0-i am inclined to think now - it may be the disillusionment of [my]0-i ripened years - whichever [she]409-beatrice thought was winning . Then [young Garvell]363-archie , giving way before [my]0-i slogging , stumbled and fell over a big flint , and [I]0-i , still following the tradition of [[my]0-i class]1310-my class and [school]1231-school , promptly flung [myself]0-i on [him]363-archie to finish [him]363-archie . The powers of justice in [Bladesover]4-bladesover made an extraordinary mess of [my]0-i case . [I]0-i have regretfully to admit that [the Honourable Beatrice Normandy]409-beatrice did , at the age of ten , betray [me]0-i , abandon [me]0-i , and lie most abominably about [me]0-i . [I]0-i felt [I]0-i had much to embitter [me]0-i ; the game had and the beginnings of fairness by any standards [I]0-i knew .... [She]409-beatrice might have done that anyhow ! Supposing [I]0-i had told on [her]409-beatrice ! But [the son of a servant]1332-the son of a servant counts as [a servant]1267-a servant . [She]409-beatrice had forgotten and now remembered . [I]0-i solaced [myself]0-i with some extraordinary dream of coming back to [Bladesover]4-bladesover , stern , powerful , after the fashion of [Coriolanus]422-coriolanus . [I]0-i do not recall the details , but [I]0-i have no doubt [I]0-i displayed great magnanimity ... Well , anyhow [I]0-i never said [I]0-i was sorry for [pounding young Garvell]419-young mr. garvell , and [I]0-i am not sorry to this day . When [I]0-i was thus banished from [Bladesover House]3-bladesover house , as it was then thought for good and all , [I]0-i was sent by [[my]0-i mother]850-my mother in a vindictive spirit , first to [[her]850-my mother cousin]895-her cousin [Nicodemus Frapp]420-nicodemus frapp , and then , as [a fully indentured apprentice]1336-a fully indentured apprentice , to [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle [Ponderevo]418-mrs. ponderevo . [I]0-i ran away from the care of [[my]0-i cousin]1338-my cousin [Nicodemus]420-nicodemus frapp back to [Bladesover House]3-bladesover house . [[My]0-i cousin]1338-my cousin [Nicodemus Frapp]420-nicodemus frapp was [a baker in [a back street]1341-a back street — [a slum rather — just off that miserable narrow mean high road that threads those exquisite beads , [Rochester and Chatham]44-rochester and chatham]1342-a slum rather — just off that miserable narrow mean high road that threads those exquisite beads , rochester and chatham]1340-a baker in a back street — a slum rather — just off that miserable narrow mean high road that threads those exquisite beads , rochester and chatham . [He]420-nicodemus frapp was , [I]0-i must admit , a shock to [me]0-i , much dominated by [a young , plump , prolific , malingering wife]1343-a young , plump , prolific , malingering wife ; [a bent , slow - moving , unwilling dark man with flour in [his]420-nicodemus frapp hair and eyelashes , in the lines of [his]420-nicodemus frapp face and the seams of [his]420-nicodemus frapp coat]1344-a bent , slow - moving , unwilling dark man with flour in his hair and eyelashes , in the lines of his face and the seams of his coat . [I]0-i 've never had a chance to correct [my]0-i early impression of [him]420-nicodemus frapp , and [he]420-nicodemus frapp still remains an almost dreadful memory , a sort of caricature of incompetent simplicity . As [I]0-i remember [him]420-nicodemus frapp , indeed , [he]420-nicodemus frapp presented the servile tradition perfected . [He]420-nicodemus frapp had no pride in [his]420-nicodemus frapp person ; fine clothes and dressing up was n't " for the likes of "[1346-no artist at it] [him]420-nicodemus frapp , so that [he]420-nicodemus frapp got [[his]420-nicodemus frapp wife]1345-his wife , who was [no artist at it]1346-no artist at it , to cut [his]420-nicodemus frapp black hair at irregular intervals , and let [his]420-nicodemus frapp nails become disagreeable to the fastidious eye ; [he]420-nicodemus frapp had no pride in [his]420-nicodemus frapp business nor any initiative ; [his]420-nicodemus frapp only virtues were not doing certain things and hard work . " [[Your]0-i uncle]4406-your uncle , "[850-my mother] said [[my]0-i mother]850-my mother — [all grown - up cousins]1348-all grown - up cousins were [uncles]1349-uncles by courtesy among [the Victorian middle - class—"isn't]4408-the victorian middle - class—"isn't much to look at or talk to , but [he]4406-your uncle 's [a Good Hard - Working Man]4409-a good hard - working man . "[850-my mother] There was a sort of base honourableness about toil , however needless , in that system of inversion . Another point of honour was to rise at or before dawn , and then laboriously muddle about . It was very distinctly impressed on [my]0-i mind that [the Good Hard - Working Man]1350-the good hard - working man would have thought it " fal - lallish "[1350-the good hard - working man] to own a pocket handkerchief . [Poor old Frapp]420-nicodemus frapp — dirty and crushed by , product of , [Bladesover]4-bladesover 's magnificence ! [He]420-nicodemus frapp made no fight against [the world]751-the world at all , [he]420-nicodemus frapp was floundering in small debts that were not so small but that finally they overwhelmed [him]420-nicodemus frapp , whenever there was occasion for any exertion [[his]420-nicodemus frapp wife]1345-his wife fell back upon pains and [her]1345-his wife " condition , "[1345-his wife] and [God]357-god sent [them]1353-they [many children]1354-many children , most of [whom]1354-many children died , and so , by [their]1354-many children coming and going , gave a double exercise in the virtues of submission . Resignation to [God]357-god 's will was the common device of [these people]712-these people in the face of every duty and every emergency . There were no books in [the house]707-the house ; [I]0-i doubt if [either of [them]712-these people]1357-either of them had retained the capacity for reading consecutively for more than a minute or so , and it was with amazement that day after day , over and above stale bread , [one]696-one beheld food and again more food amidst the litter that held permanent session on the living - room table . [One]696-one might have doubted if [either of [them]712-these people]1357-either of them felt discomfort in this dusty darkness of existence , if it was not that [they]712-these people did visibly seek consolation . [They]1353-they sought this and found it of a Sunday , not in strong drink and raving , but in imaginary draughts of blood . [They]1353-they met with [twenty or thirty other darkened and unclean people]1361-twenty or thirty other darkened and unclean people , [all dressed in dingy colours that would not show the dirt]1362-all dressed in dingy colours that would not show the dirt , in [a little brick - built chapel equipped with a spavined roarer of a harmonium]1363-a little brick - built chapel equipped with a spavined roarer of a harmonium , and there solaced [their]1353-they minds on the thought that all that was fair and free in life , all that struggled , all that planned and made , all pride and beauty and honour , all fine and enjoyable things , were irrevocably damned to everlasting torments . [They]1353-they were [the self - appointed confidants of [God]357-god 's mockery of [his]357-god own creation]1364-the self - appointed confidants of god 's mockery of his own creation . So at any rate [they]1353-they stick in [my]0-i mind . Vaguer , and yet hardly less agreeable than this cosmic jest , this coming " Yah , clever ! "[1353-they] and general serving out and " showing up "[1365-the lucky] of [the lucky]1365-the lucky , the bold , and the cheerful , was [their]1353-they own predestination to Glory . so [they]1353-they sang . [I]0-i hear the drone and wheeze of that hymn now . [I]0-i hated [them]1353-they with the bitter uncharitable condemnation of boyhood , and a twinge of that hate comes back to [me]0-i . As [I]0-i write the words , the sounds and then the scene return , [these obscure , undignified people]1366-these obscure , undignified people , [a fat woman with asthma]1367-a fat woman with asthma , [an old Welsh milk - seller]1368-an old welsh milk - seller with a tumour on [his]1368-an old welsh milk - seller bald head , who was [the intellectual leader of [the sect]1370-the sect]1369-the intellectual leader of the sect , [a huge - voiced haberdasher with a big black beard]1371-a huge - voiced haberdasher with a big black beard , [a white - faced , extraordinarily pregnant woman]1372-a white - faced , extraordinarily pregnant woman , [[his]1368-an old welsh milk - seller wife]1345-his wife , [a spectacled rate collector with a bent back]1374-a spectacled rate collector with a bent back .... [I]0-i , as [a boy]905-a boy , did not matter , and might overhear . If [Bladesover]4-bladesover is [my]0-i key for the explanation of [England]1-england , [I]0-i think [my]0-i invincible persuasion that [I]0-i understand [Russia]24-russia was engendered by the circle of [Uncle Frapp]423-uncle frapp . [I]0-i slept in a dingy sheeted bed with [the two elder survivors of Frapp]1381-the two elder survivors of frapp fecundity , and spent [my]0-i week days in helping in the laborious disorder of [the shop]1382-the shop and [bakehouse]1383-bakehouse , in incidental deliveries of bread and so forth , and in parrying the probings of [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle into [my]0-i relations with [the Blood]424-the blood , and [his]731-my uncle confidential explanations that ten shillings a week — which was what [[my]0-i mother]850-my mother paid [him]731-my uncle — was not enough to cover [my]0-i accommodation . [He]731-my uncle was very anxious to keep that , but also [he]731-my uncle wanted more . There were neither books nor any seat nor corner in [that house]1386-that house where reading was possible , no newspaper ever brought the clash of worldly things into its heavenward seclusion ; horror of it all grew in [me]0-i daily , and whenever [I]0-i could [I]0-i escaped into [the streets]1387-the streets and tramped about [Chatham]42-chatham . [The news shops]1388-the news shops appealed to [me]0-i particularly . [One]696-one saw there smudgy illustrated sheets , the Police News in particular , in which vilely drawn pictures brought [home]1390-home to the dullest intelligence an interminable succession of squalid crimes , [women]1391-women murdered and put into boxes , buried under floors , [old men]1392-old men bludgeoned at midnight by [robbers]1393-robbers , [people]920-people thrust suddenly out of trains , [happy lovers]1395-happy lovers shot , vitrioled and so forth by [rivals]1396-rivals . [I]0-i got [my]0-i first glimpse of the life of pleasure in foully drawn pictures of " police raids "[1396-rivals] on this and that . Interspersed with these sheets were others in which [Sloper]425-sloper , [the urban John Bull]1397-the urban john bull , had [his]425-sloper fling with gin bottle and obese umbrella , or the kindly empty faces of [the Royal Family]1398-the royal family appeared and reappeared , visiting this , opening that , getting married , getting [offspring]1399-offspring , lying in state , doing everything but anything , a wonderful , good - meaning , impenetrable race apart . [I]0-i have never revisited [Chatham]42-chatham ; the impression it has left on [my]0-i mind is one of squalid compression , unlit by any gleam of a maturer charity . All its effects arranged themselves as antithetical to the Bladesover effects . [They]1400-they confirmed and intensified all that [Bladesover]4-bladesover suggested . [Bladesover]4-bladesover declared itself to be [the land]1147-the land , to be essentially [England]1-england ; [I]0-i have already told how [its]4-bladesover airy spaciousness , [its]4-bladesover wide dignity , seemed to thrust [village]783-village , [church]793-church , and [vicarage]1404-vicarage into corners , into a secondary and conditional significance . Here one gathered the corollary of that . Since [the whole wide country of [Kent]8-kent]1405-the whole wide country of kent was made up of [contiguous Bladesovers]47-contiguous bladesovers and for [the gentlefolk]1028-the gentlefolk , the surplus of population , [all who were [not good tenants]1408-not good tenants nor [good labourers]1409-good labourers , Church of [England]1-england]1407-all who were not good tenants nor good labourers , church of england , submissive and respectful , were necessarily thrust together , jostled out of sight , to fester as [they]1400-they might in this place that had the colours and even the smells of a well - packed dustbin . [They]1400-they should be grateful even for that ; that , [one]696-one felt , was the theory of it all . And [I]0-i loafed about [this wilderness of crowded dinginess]1411-this wilderness of crowded dinginess , with young , receptive , wide - open eyes , and through the blessing ( or curse ) of [some fairy godmother of mine]1412-some fairy godmother of mine , asking and asking again : " But after all , WHY — "[0-i] [I]0-i wandered up through [Rochester]48-rochester once , and had a glimpse of [the Stour valley]1413-the stour valley above [the town]1414-the town , all horrible with [cement works]1415-cement works and foully smoking chimneys and rows of [[workmen]1416-workmen 's cottages]1417-workmen 's cottages , minute , ugly , uncomfortable , and grimy . But [I]0-i saw [barges]1423-barges and [ships]837-ships stripped of magic and mostly devoted to cement , ice , timber , and coal . [The sailors]1425-the sailors looked to [me]0-i gross and [slovenly men]1426-slovenly men , and the shipping struck [me]0-i as clumsy , ugly , old , and dirty . And [I]0-i had imagined great things of [the sea]1422-the sea ! Well , anyhow , for a time that vocation was stilled . "[1441-poor woman] Serious trouble came suddenly out of a conversation [we]1442-we held in bed one night . The following week made life quite intolerable for [me]0-i ; [these people]712-these people forced [me]0-i at last into an Atheism that terrified [me]0-i . [I]0-i happened upon a map of [Kent]8-kent in [a stationer]1484-a stationer 's window on Saturday , and that set [me]0-i thinking of one form of release . [I]0-i remember something , but not so much of it as [I]0-i should like to recall , of [my]0-i long tramp to [Bladesover House]3-bladesover house . The distance from [Chatham]42-chatham is almost exactly seventeen miles , and it took [me]0-i until nearly one . It was very interesting and [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i was very fatigued , though [I]0-i got rather pinched by one boot . The morning must have been very clear , because [I]0-i remember that near [Itchinstow Hall]1486-itchinstow hall [I]0-i looked back and saw [the estuary of [the Thames]7-the thames]1487-the estuary of the thames , [that river that has since played so large a part in [my]0-i life]1488-that river that has since played so large a part in my life . [I]0-i stood for a long time watching these and thinking whether after all [I]0-i should not have done better to have run away to [sea]1495-sea . The nearer [I]0-i drew to [Bladesover]4-bladesover , the more doubtful [I]0-i grew of the duality of [my]0-i reception , and the more [I]0-i regretted that alternative . [I]0-i suppose it was the dirty clumsiness of the shipping [I]0-i had seen nearly , that put [me]0-i out of mind of that . [I]0-i took a short cut through [the Warren]39-the warren across the corner of [the main park]1496-the main park to intercept [the people]1497-the people from [the church]782-the church . [I]0-i wanted to avoid meeting [any one]1444-any one before [I]0-i met [[my]0-i mother]850-my mother , and so [I]0-i went to a place where [the path]1501-the path passed between banks , and without exactly hiding , stood up among the bushes . This place among other advantages eliminated any chance of seeing [Lady Drew]359-lady drew , who would drive round by [the carriage road]1502-the carriage road . Standing up to [waylay]1503-waylay in this fashion [I]0-i had a queer feeling of brigandage , as though [I]0-i was some intrusive sort of bandit among these orderly things . It is the first time [I]0-i remember having that outlaw feeling distinctly , a feeling that has played a large part in [my]0-i subsequent life . "[1658-the old vicar] Never die ! The day was a high and glorious morning in spring , and all the trees were budding and bursting into green . Everywhere there were blossoms and flowers ; the pear trees and cherry trees in [the sexton 's garden]1659-the sexton 's garden were sunlit snow , there were nodding daffodils and early tulips in [the graveyard beds]1660-the graveyard beds , great multitudes of daisies , and everywhere the birds seemed singing . And in the middle was the brown coffin end , tilting on [men]1661-men 's shoulders and half occluded by [the vicar]813-the vicar 's Oxford hood . And so [we]1663-we came to [[[my]0-i mother]850-my mother 's waiting grave]1665-my mother 's waiting grave . For a time [I]0-i was very observant , watching the coffin lowered , hearing the words of the ritual . It seemed a very curious business altogether . Suddenly as the service drew to its end , [I]0-i felt something had still to be said which had not been said , realised that [she]850-my mother had withdrawn in silence , neither forgiving [me]0-i nor hearing from [me]0-i — those now lost assurances . Suddenly [I]0-i knew [I]0-i had not understood . Surprisingly [I]0-i realised that behind all [her]850-my mother hardness and severity [she]850-my mother had loved [me]0-i , that [I]0-i was the only thing [she]850-my mother had ever loved and that until this moment [I]0-i had never loved [her]850-my mother . [The old vicar]1658-the old vicar read on , there came a mumbled response — and so on to the end .
