"[1670-the sexton and undertaker] That is the last [I]0-i shall tell of [Bladesover]4-bladesover . The dropscene falls on that , and it comes no more as an actual presence into this novel . [I]0-i did indeed go back there once again , but under circumstances quite immaterial to [my]0-i story . But in a sense [Bladesover]4-bladesover has never left [me]0-i ; it is , as [I]0-i said at the outset , one of those dominant explanatory impressions that make the framework of [my]0-i mind . [Bladesover]4-bladesover illuminates [England]1-england ; it has become all that is spacious , dignified pretentious , and truly conservative in English life . It is [my]0-i social datum . That is why [I]0-i have drawn it here on so large a scale . When [I]0-i came back at last to the real [Bladesover]4-bladesover on an inconsequent visit , everything was far smaller than [I]0-i could have supposed possible . It was as though everything had shivered and shrivelled a little at the Lichtenstein touch . The harp was still in [the saloon]4374-the saloon , but there was a different grand piano with a painted lid and a metrostyle pianola , and an extraordinary quantity of artistic litter and bric - a - brac scattered about . There was the trail of [the Bond Street showroom]1672-the bond street showroom over it all . The furniture was still under chintz , but it was n't the same sort of chintz although it pretended to be , and the lustre - dangling chandeliers had passed away . [Lady Lichtenstein]441-lady lichtenstein 's books replaced the brown volumes [I]0-i had browsed among — they were mostly presentation copies of contemporary novels and the National Review and the Empire Review , and the Nineteenth Century and after jostled current books on the tables — English new books in gaudy catchpenny " artistic "[441-lady lichtenstein] covers , French and Italian novels in yellow , German art handbooks of almost incredible ugliness . It is nonsense to pretend that finance makes [any better aristocrats]1674-any better aristocrats than rent . Nothing can make [an aristocrat]1675-an aristocrat but pride , knowledge , training , and the sword . [These people]712-these people were no improvement on [the Drews]442-the drews , none whatever . There was no effect of a beneficial replacement of [passive unintelligent people]1677-passive unintelligent people by [active intelligent ones]1678-active intelligent ones . [One]696-one felt that a smaller but more enterprising and intensely undignified variety of stupidity had replaced the large dullness of [the old gentry]1680-the old gentry , and that was all . [Bladesover]4-bladesover , [I]0-i thought , had undergone just the same change between the seventies and the new century that had overtaken the dear old Times , and heaven knows how much more of the decorous British fabric . [These Lichtensteins]443-these lichtensteins and [their]443-these lichtensteins like seem to have no promise in them at all of any fresh vitality for [the kingdom]1681-the kingdom . " [He]2-wimblehurst passed into a rapt dream , from which escaped such fragments as : "[1728-millionaire] Fifty per cent . advance sir ; security - to - morrow . Zzzz . " The idea of cornering a drug struck upon [my]1732-i mind then as a sort of irresponsible monkey trick that [no one]4418-no one would ever be permitted to do in reality . It was the sort of nonsense one would talk to make [Ewart]481-ewart laugh and set [him]2-wimblehurst going on to still odder possibilities . [I]1732-i thought it was part of [[my]1732-i uncle]731-my uncle 's way of talking . But [I]1732-i 've learnt differently since . The whole trend of modern money - making is to foresee something that will presently be needed and put it out of reach , and then to haggle [yourself]1720-you wealthy . [You]1720-you buy up land upon which [people]920-people will presently want to build [houses]4480-houses , [you]1720-you secure rights that will bar vitally important developments , and so on , and so on . Of course the naive intelligence of [a boy]905-a boy does not grasp the subtler developments of human inadequacy . [He]2-wimblehurst begins life with a disposition to believe in the wisdom of [grown - up people]4482-grown - up people , [he]2-wimblehurst does not realise how casual and disingenuous has been the development of law and custom , and [he]2-wimblehurst thinks that somewhere in [the state]4483-the state there is a power as irresistible as [a head master]4484-a head master 's to check mischievous and foolish enterprises of every sort . [I]1732-i will confess that when [[my]1732-i uncle]731-my uncle talked of cornering quinine , [I]1732-i had a clear impression that [any one who contrived to do that]4486-any one who contrived to do that would pretty certainly go to [jail]4487-jail . Now [I]1732-i know that [any one who could really bring it off]4488-any one who could really bring it off would be much more likely to go to [the House of Lords]4489-the house of lords ! [[My]1732-i uncle]731-my uncle ranged over the gilt labels of [his]731-my uncle bottles and drawers for a while , dreaming of corners in this and that . But at last [he]1733-he reverted to [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst again . "[1732-i] [You]1732-i got to be in [London]9-london when these things are in hand . Down here- ! " Jee - rusalem ! "[1733-he] [he]1733-he cried . " Why did [I]1733-he plant [myself]1733-he [here]4451-here ? Everything 's done . The game 's over . [HE]446-lord eastry does n't want anything more to happen . Why should [he]446-lord eastry ? Any chance ' ud be a loss to [him]446-lord eastry . [He]446-lord eastry wants everything to burble along and burble along and go on as it 's going for the next ten thousand years , [Eastry]51-eastry after [Eastry]51-eastry , [one parson]4493-one parson down another come , [one grocer dead]4494-one grocer dead , get another ! " So [I]1737-i remember [[my]1737-i uncle]731-my uncle in that first phase , young , but already a little fat , restless , fretful , garrulous , putting in [my]1737-i fermenting head all sorts of discrepant ideas . Certainly [he]731-my uncle was educational .... For [me]1737-i the years at [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst were years of pretty active growth . Most of [my]1737-i leisure and much of [my]1737-i time in [the shop]1382-the shop [I]1737-i spent in study . [I]1737-i speedily mastered the modicum of Latin necessary for [my]1737-i qualifying examinations , and - a little assisted by [the Government Science]4503-the government science and Art Department classes that were held in [the Grammar School]4463-the grammar school - went on with [my]1737-i mathematics . There were classes in physics , in chemistry , in mathematics and machine drawing , and [I]1737-i took up these subjects with considerable avidity . Exercise [I]1737-i got chiefly in the form of walks . There was some cricket in the summer and football in the winter sustained by [young men]4505-young men 's clubs that levied a parasitic blackmail of [the big people]4506-the big people and [the sitting member]4507-the sitting member , but [I]1737-i was never very keen at these games . [I]1737-i did n't find [any very close companions]4508-any very close companions among [the youths of [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst]4509-the youths of wimblehurst . And even then [they]4509-the youths of wimblehurst were n't much in the way of thoughts . No , [I]1737-i did n't like [those young countrymen]4515-those young countrymen , and [I]1737-i 'm no believer in [the English countryside]857-the english countryside under the Bladesover system as [a breeding ground for [honourable men]4518-honourable men]4517-a breeding ground for honourable men . [One]696-one hears a frightful lot of nonsense about the Rural Exodus and the degeneration wrought by [town]4520-town life upon [[our]4511-we population]4521-our population . [We]4511-we had read [the Boys of [England]1-england]1146-the boys of england , and told [each other]1240-each other stories . In [the English countryside]857-the english countryside there are no books at all , no songs , no drama , no valiant sin even ; all these things have never come or they were taken away and hidden generations ago , and the imagination aborts and bestialises . That , [I]1737-i think , is where the real difference against [the English rural man]4532-the english rural man lies . In all [my]1737-i early enterprises in the war of the sexes , [I]1737-i was torn between the urgency of the body and a habit of romantic fantasy that wanted every phase of the adventure to be generous and beautiful . And [I]1737-i had a curiously haunting memory of [Beatrice]409-beatrice , of [her]409-beatrice kisses in the bracken and [her]409-beatrice kiss upon the wall , that somehow pitched the standard too high for [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst 's opportunities . If [I]1737-i fell in love with [any one in [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst]4560-any one in wimblehurst it was with [[my]1737-i aunt]1458-my aunt . [My]1737-i adolescent years at [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst were on the whole laborious , uneventful years that began in short jackets and left [me]1737-i in many ways nearly [a man]718-a man , years so uneventful that the Calculus of Variations is associated with one winter , and an examination in Physics for Science and Art department Honours marks an epoch . Many divergent impulses stirred within [me]1737-i , but the master impulse was a grave young disposition to work and learn and thereby in some not very clearly defined way get out of [the [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst world into which [I]1737-i had fallen]4563-the wimblehurst world into which i had fallen . [I]1737-i wrote with some frequency to [Ewart]481-ewart , self - conscious , but , as [I]1737-i remember them , not intelligent letters , dated in Latin and with lapses into Latin quotation that roused [Ewart]481-ewart to parody . There was something about [me]1737-i in those days more than a little priggish . But it was , to do [myself]1737-i justice , something more than the petty pride of learning . [I]1737-i had a very grave sense of discipline and preparation that [I]1737-i am not ashamed at all to remember . [I]1737-i was serious . More serious than [I]1737-i am at the present time . [I]1737-i do n't see why , at forty , [I]1737-i should n't confess [I]1737-i respect [my]1737-i own youth . [I]1737-i had dropped being [a boy]905-a boy quite abruptly . [I]0-i remember [him]2-wimblehurst now as talking , always talking , in those days . [[My]0-i uncle]731-my uncle 's laugh when it did come , [I]0-i must admit was , as [Baedeker]455-baedeker says , " rewarding . "[731-my uncle] It began with gusty blowings and snortings , and opened into a clear " Ha ha ! "[731-my uncle] but in fullest development it included , in those youthful days , falling about anyhow and doubling up tightly , and whackings of the stomach , and tears and cries of anguish . [I]0-i never in [my]0-i life heard [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle laugh to [his]731-my uncle maximum except at [her]1458-my aunt ; [he]731-my uncle was commonly too much in earnest for that , and [he]731-my uncle did n't laugh much at all , to [my]0-i knowledge , after those early years . Sometimes [she]1458-my aunt would shy things at [me]0-i - but not often . There seemed always laughter round and about [her]1458-my aunt - [all three of [us]1758-all three of us]1758-all three of us would share hysterics at times - and on one occasion [the two of [them]1759-the two of them]1759-the two of them came [home]1390-home from [church]793-church shockingly ashamed of [themselves]1759-the two of them , because of a storm of mirth during the sermon . [The vicar]813-the vicar , it seems , had tried to blow [his]813-the vicar nose with a black glove as well as the customary pocket - handkerchief . And afterwards [she]1458-my aunt had picked up [her]1458-my aunt own glove by the finger , and looking innocently but intently sideways , had suddenly by this simple expedient exploded [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle altogether . [We]1758-all three of us had it all over again at dinner . " But it shows [you]0-i , "[731-my uncle] cried [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle , suddenly becoming grave , " what [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst is , to have [us]1758-all three of us all laughing at a little thing like that ! "[731-my uncle] Socially , [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle and [aunt]1766-aunt were almost completely isolated . [I]1829-i was left , [I]1829-i say , as part of the lock , stock , and barrel , at [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst with [[my]1829-i new master]4641-my new master , [a Mr. Mantell]468-mr. mantell ; who plays no part in the progress of this story except in so far as [he]4641-my new master effaced [[my]1829-i uncle]731-my uncle 's traces . So soon as the freshness of this new personality faded , [I]1829-i began to find [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst not only [a dull but a lonely place]4643-a dull but a lonely place , and to miss [my]1829-i aunt [Susan]433-susan immensely . The advertisements of the summer terms for [Cough Linctus]469-cough linctus were removed ; the bottles of coloured water - red , green , and yellow - restored to their places ; the horse announcing veterinary medicine , which [[my]1829-i uncle]731-my uncle , sizzling all the while , had coloured in careful portraiture of a Goodwood favourite , rewhitened ; and [I]1829-i turned [myself]1829-i even more resolutely than before to Latin ( until the passing of [my]1829-i preliminary examination enabled [me]1829-i to drop that ) , and then to mathematics and science . There were classes in Electricity and Magnetism at [the Grammar School]4463-the grammar school . [I]1829-i took a little "[1829-i] elementary " prize in that in [my]1831-lord first year and a medal in [my]1831-lord third ; and in Chemistry and Human Physiology and Sound , Light and Heat , [I]1831-lord did well . There was also a lighter , more discursive subject called Physiography , in which one ranged among the sciences and encountered Geology as a process of evolution from [Eozoon]61-eozoon to [Eastry House]50-eastry house , and Astronomy as a record of celestial movements of the most austere and invariable integrity . [I]1831-lord learnt out of badly - written , condensed little text - books , and with the minimum of experiment , but still [I]1831-lord learnt . Only thirty years ago it was , and [I]1831-lord remember [I]1831-lord learnt of the electric light as an expensive , impracticable toy , the telephone as a curiosity , electric traction as a practical absurdity . There was no argon , no radium , no phagocytes - at least to [my]1831-lord knowledge , and aluminium was a dear , infrequent metal . [The fastest ships]4646-the fastest ships in [the world]751-the world went then at nineteen knots , and [no one]4418-no one but [a lunatic here and there]4649-a lunatic here and there ever thought it possible that [men]1661-men might fly . Many things have happened since then , but the last glance [I]1831-lord had of [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst two years ago remarked no change whatever in [its]2-wimblehurst pleasant tranquillity . [They]4651-they had not even built [any fresh houses]4652-any fresh houses - at least not actually in [the town]1414-the town , though about [the station]4654-the station there had been [some building]4655-some building . But [it]2-wimblehurst was [a good place to do work in , for all [its]2-wimblehurst quiescence]4656-a good place to do work in , for all its quiescence . [I]1831-lord was soon beyond the small requirements of [the Pharmaceutical Society]4657-the pharmaceutical society 's examination , and as [they]4651-they do not permit [candidates]4658-candidates to sit for that until one and twenty , [I]1831-lord was presently filling up [my]1831-lord time and preventing [my]1831-lord studies becoming too desultory by making an attack upon the [London]9-london University degree of Bachelor of Science , which impressed [me]1831-lord then as a very splendid but almost impossible achievement . The degree in mathematics and chemistry appealed to [me]1831-lord as particularly congenial - albeit giddily inaccessible . [I]1831-lord set to work . [I]1831-lord had presently to arrange a holiday and go to [London]9-london to matriculate , and so it was [I]1831-lord came upon [[my]1831-lord aunt]1458-my aunt and [uncle]1823-uncle again . In many ways that visit marked an epoch . It was [my]1831-lord first impression of [London]9-london at all . [I]1831-lord was then nineteen , and by a conspiracy of chances [my]1831-lord nearest approach to [that human wilderness]4661-that human wilderness had been [my]1831-lord brief visit to [Chatham]42-chatham . [Chatham]42-chatham too had been [[my]1831-lord largest town]4662-my largest town . So that [I]1831-lord got [London]9-london at last with an exceptional freshness of effect , as the sudden revelation of a whole unsuspected other side to life . [I]1831-lord came to [it]9-london on a dull and smoky day by [the South Eastern Railway]4663-the south eastern railway , and [[our]4664-our train]4665-our train was half an hour late , stopping and going on and stopping again . [I]1831-lord marked beyond Chiselhurst the growing multitude of [villas]4666-villas , and so came stage by stage through multiplying [houses]4480-houses and diminishing interspaces of [market garden]4668-market garden and dingy grass to [regions of interlacing railway lines]4669-regions of interlacing railway lines , [big factories]4670-big factories , [gasometers]4671-gasometers and [wide reeking swamps of dingy little homes]4672-wide reeking swamps of dingy little homes , more of [them]4480-houses and more and more . The congestion of [houses]4480-houses intensified and piled up presently into [tenements]4679-tenements ; [I]1831-lord marveled more and more at this boundless world of [dingy people]4680-dingy people ; whiffs of industrial smell , of leather , of brewing , drifted into [the carriage]4681-the carriage ; the sky darkened , [I]1831-lord rumbled thunderously over [bridges]4682-bridges , [van - crowded streets]4683-van - crowded streets , peered down on and crossed [the Thames]7-the thames with an abrupt eclat of sound . " [My]1872-i feelings towards [[my]1872-i uncle]731-my uncle were extraordinarily mixed . And then [I]1872-i tried to dismiss [him]731-my uncle from [my]1872-i mind and went on working . Yes , that first raid upon [London]9-london under the moist and chilly depression of January had an immense effect upon [me]1872-i . It was for [me]1872-i an epoch - making disappointment . [I]1872-i had thought of [London]9-london as [a large , free , welcoming , adventurous place]4841-a large , free , welcoming , adventurous place , and [I]1872-i saw [it]9-london slovenly and harsh and irresponsive . It is the constant error of youth to over - estimate the Will in things . [I]1872-i find [myself]1872-i with a certain comprehensive perception of [London]9-london , complete indeed , incurably indistinct in places and yet in some way a whole that began with [my]1872-i first visit and is still being mellowed and enriched . [London]9-london ! At first , no doubt , it was a chaos of [streets]4851-streets and [people]920-people and [buildings]4853-buildings and reasonless going to and fro . [London]9-london ! [I]381-sir cuthbert came up to it , [young and without advisers]4963-young and without advisers , rather priggish , rather dangerously open - minded and very open - eyed , and with something - it is , [I]381-sir cuthbert think , the common gift of imaginative youth , and [I]381-sir cuthbert claim it unblushingly - fine in [me]381-sir cuthbert , finer than [the world]751-the world and seeking fine responses . [I]381-sir cuthbert did not want simply to live or simply to live happily or well ; [I]381-sir cuthbert wanted to serve and do and make - with [some nobility]4965-some nobility . It was in [me]381-sir cuthbert . It is in half the youth of [the world]751-the world . [I]381-sir cuthbert had come to [London]9-london as [a scholar]4967-a scholar . [I]381-sir cuthbert had taken the [Vincent Bradley]473-vincent bradley scholarship of [the Pharmaceutical Society]4657-the pharmaceutical society , but [I]381-sir cuthbert threw this up when [I]381-sir cuthbert found that [my]381-sir cuthbert work of the Science and Art Department in mathematics , physics and chemistry had given [me]381-sir cuthbert one of the minor Technical Board Scholarships at [the Consolidated Technical Schools]4969-the consolidated technical schools at [South Kensington]101-south kensington . This latter was in mechanics and metallurgy ; and [I]381-sir cuthbert hesitated between the two . [The Vincent Bradley]473-vincent bradley gave [me]381-sir cuthbert L70 a year and quite the best start - off [a pharmaceutical chemist]4970-a pharmaceutical chemist could have ; the South Kensington thing was worth about twenty - two shillings a week , and the prospects it opened were vague . But it meant far more scientific work than the former , and [I]381-sir cuthbert was still under the impulse of that great intellectual appetite that is part of the adolescence of [men of]4971-men of [my]381-sir cuthbert type . Moreover it seemed to lead towards engineering , in which [I]381-sir cuthbert imagined - [I]381-sir cuthbert imagine to this day - [my]381-sir cuthbert particular use is to be found . [I]381-sir cuthbert took its greater uncertainty as a fair risk . [I]381-sir cuthbert came up very keen , not doubting that the really hard and steady industry that had carried [me]381-sir cuthbert through [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst would go on still in [the new surroundings]4972-the new surroundings . Only from the very first it did n't .... When [I]381-sir cuthbert look back now at [my]381-sir cuthbert [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst days , [I]381-sir cuthbert still find [myself]381-sir cuthbert surprised at the amount of steady grinding study , of strenuous self - discipline that [I]381-sir cuthbert maintained throughout [my]381-sir cuthbert apprenticeship . In many ways [I]381-sir cuthbert think that time was the most honourable period in [my]381-sir cuthbert life . [I]381-sir cuthbert wish [I]381-sir cuthbert could say with a certain mind that [my]381-sir cuthbert motives in working so well were large and honourable too . To a certain extent they were so ; there was a fine sincere curiosity , a desire for the strength and power of scientific knowledge and a passion for intellectual exercise ; but [I]381-sir cuthbert do not think those forces alone would have kept [me]381-sir cuthbert at it so grimly and closely if [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst had not been so dull , so limited and so observant . Directly [I]381-sir cuthbert came into the [London]9-london atmosphere , tasting freedom , tasting irresponsibility and the pull of new forces altogether , [my]381-sir cuthbert discipline fell from [me]381-sir cuthbert like a garment . [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst to [a youngster in [my]381-sir cuthbert position]4973-a youngster in my position offered no temptations worth counting , no interests to conflict with study , no vices - such vices as it offered were coarsely stripped of any imaginative glamourfull drunkenness , clumsy leering shameful lust , no social intercourse even to waste [one]696-one 's time , and on the other hand it would minister greatly to the self - esteem of [a conspicuously industrious student]4975-a conspicuously industrious student . [One]696-one was marked as "[381-sir cuthbert] clever , " [one]696-one played up to the part , and [one]696-one 's little accomplishment stood out finely in [one]696-one 's private reckoning against the sunlit small ignorance of [that agreeable place]4980-that agreeable place . [One]696-one went with an intent rush across [the market square]4982-the market square , [one]696-one took [one]696-one 's exercise with as dramatic a sense of an ordered day as [an Oxford don]4985-an oxford don , one burnt the midnight oil quite consciously at [the rare respectful , benighted passer - by]4986-the rare respectful , benighted passer - by . And [one]696-one stood out finely in the local paper with [one]696-one 's unapproachable yearly harvest of certificates . Thus [I]476-jove was not only [a genuinely keen student]4989-a genuinely keen student , but also a little of [a prig and poseur]4990-a prig and poseur in those days - and [the latter]4991-the latter kept the former at [it]4992-it , as [London]9-london made clear . [Moreover Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst had given [me]476-jove no outlet in any other direction . But [I]476-jove did not realise all this when [I]476-jove came to [London]9-london , did not perceive how the change of atmosphere began at once to warp and distribute [my]476-jove energies . In the first place [I]476-jove became invisible . If [I]476-jove idled for a day , [no one]4418-no one except [[my]476-jove fellow - students]4994-my fellow - students ( who evidently had no awe for [me]476-jove ) remarked it . [No one]4418-no one saw [my]476-jove midnight taper ; [no one]4418-no one pointed [me]476-jove out as [I]476-jove crossed [the street]4997-the street as an astonishing intellectual phenomenon . In the next place [I]476-jove became inconsiderable . In [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst [I]476-jove felt [I]476-jove stood for Science ; [nobody there]4998-nobody there seemed to have so much as [I]476-jove and to have it so fully and completely . In [London]9-london [I]476-jove walked ignorant in an immensity , and it was clear that among [[my]476-jove fellow - students from [the midlands]5000-the midlands]4999-my fellow - students from the midlands and [the north]5001-the north [I]476-jove was ill - equipped and under - trained . With the utmost exertion [I]476-jove should only take a secondary position among [them]4999-my fellow - students from the midlands . And finally , in the third place , [I]476-jove was distracted by voluminous new interests ; [London]9-london took hold of [me]476-jove , and Science , which had been [the universe]5002-the universe , shrank back to the dimensions of tiresome little formulae compacted in a book . [I]476-jove came to [London]9-london in late September , and it was [a very different London]5003-a very different london from [that great greyly - overcast , smoke - stained house - wilderness of [my]476-jove first impressions]5004-that great greyly - overcast , smoke - stained house - wilderness of my first impressions . [I]476-jove reached [it]9-london by [Victoria]69-victoria and not by [Cannon Street]103-cannon street , and [its]9-london centre was now in [Exhibition Road]84-exhibition road . [It]9-london shone , pale amber , blue - grey and tenderly spacious and fine under clear autumnal skies , [a London of [hugely handsome buildings]5006-hugely handsome buildings and vistas and distances]5005-a london of hugely handsome buildings and vistas and distances , [a London]5007-a london of [gardens]5008-gardens and [labyrinthine tall museums]5009-labyrinthine tall museums , of old trees and [remote palaces]5010-remote palaces and [artificial waters]5011-artificial waters . [I]476-jove lodged near by in [West Brompton]104-west brompton at [a house in [a little square]5013-a little square]5012-a house in a little square . So [London]9-london faced [me]476-jove the second time , making [me]476-jove forget altogether for a while the grey , drizzling city visage that had first looked upon [me]476-jove . [I]476-jove settled down and went to and fro to [my]476-jove lectures and laboratory ; in the beginning [I]476-jove worked hard , and only slowly did the curiosity that presently possessed [me]476-jove to know more of [this huge urban province]5014-this huge urban province arise , the desire to find something beyond mechanism that [I]476-jove could serve , some use other than learning . With this was a growing sense of loneliness , a desire for adventure and intercourse . [I]476-jove found [myself]476-jove in the evenings poring over a map of [London]9-london [I]476-jove had bought , instead of copying out lecture notes - and on Sundays [I]476-jove made explorations , taking omnibus rides east and west and north and south , and to enlarging and broadening the sense of [great swarming hinterlands of humanity]5015-great swarming hinterlands of humanity with whom [I]476-jove had no dealings , of whom [I]476-jove knew nothing .... [The whole illimitable place]5016-the whole illimitable place teemed with suggestions of indefinite and sometimes outrageous possibility , of hidden but magnificent meanings . It was n't simply that [I]476-jove received a vast impression of space and multitude and opportunity ; intimate things also were suddenly dragged from neglected , veiled and darkened corners into an acute vividness of perception . Close at hand in [the big art museum]5017-the big art museum [I]476-jove came for the first time upon the beauty of nudity , which [I]476-jove had hitherto held to be a shameful secret , flaunted and gloried in ; [I]476-jove was made aware of beauty as not only permissible , but desirable and frequent and of a thousand hitherto unsuspected rich aspects of life . One night in a real rapture , [I]476-jove walked round [the upper gallery of [the Albert Hall]5019-the albert hall]5018-the upper gallery of the albert hall and listened for the first time to great music ; [I]476-jove believe now that it was a rendering of [Beethoven]474-beethoven 's Ninth Symphony .... [My]476-jove apprehension of [spaces]5020-spaces and places was reinforced by a quickened apprehension of [persons]5021-persons . A constant stream of [people]920-people passed by [me]476-jove , eyes met and challenged [mine]476-jove and passed - more and more [I]476-jove wanted then to stay - if [I]476-jove went eastward towards [Piccadilly]80-piccadilly , women who seemed then to [my]476-jove boyish inexperience softly splendid and alluring , murmured to [me]476-jove as [they]5023-they passed . Extraordinarily life unveiled . The very hoardings clamoured strangely at [one]696-one 's senses and curiosities . [One]696-one bought pamphlets and papers full of strange and daring ideas transcending [one]696-one 's boldest ; in [the parks]855-the parks [one]696-one heard [men]1661-men discussing the very existence of [God]357-god , denying the rights of property , debating a hundred things that [one]696-one dared not think about in [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst . And after the ordinary overcast day , after dull mornings , came twilight , and [London]9-london lit up and became a thing of white and yellow and red jewels of light and wonderful floods of golden illumination and stupendous and unfathomable shadows - and there were no longer any mean or [shabby people]5030-shabby people - but a great mysterious movement of unaccountable beings .... Always [I]476-jove was coming on the queerest new aspects . Late one Saturday night [I]476-jove found [myself]476-jove [one of a great slow - moving crowd between [the blazing shops]5032-the blazing shops and [the flaring barrows in [the Harrow Road]105-the harrow road]5033-the flaring barrows in the harrow road]5031-one of a great slow - moving crowd between the blazing shops and the flaring barrows in the harrow road ; [I]476-jove got into conversation with [two bold - eyed girls]5034-two bold - eyed girls , bought [them]5034-two bold - eyed girls boxes of chocolate , made the acquaintance of [father]4414-father and [mother]4421-mother and [various younger brothers]5037-various younger brothers and [sisters]5038-sisters , sat in [a public - house]1777-a public - house hilariously with [them]5034-two bold - eyed girls all , standing and being stood drinks , and left [them]5034-two bold - eyed girls in the small hours at the door of "[476-jove] [home]1390-home , " never to see [them]5034-two bold - eyed girls again . Then on [the remote hill of [this boundless city]5050-this boundless city - world]5049-the remote hill of this boundless city - world [I]476-jove found [Ewart]481-ewart . How well [I]476-jove remember the first morning , a bright Sunday morning in early October , when [I]476-jove raided in upon [Ewart]481-ewart ! [I]476-jove found [[my]476-jove old schoolfellow]5051-my old schoolfellow in bed in [a room over [an oil - shop]5053-an oil - shop in [a back street at the foot of [Highgate Hill]107-highgate hill]5054-a back street at the foot of highgate hill]5052-a room over an oil - shop in a back street at the foot of highgate hill . [[His]481-ewart landlady]5055-his landlady , [a pleasant , dirty young woman with soft - brown eyes]5056-a pleasant , dirty young woman with soft - brown eyes , brought down [his]481-ewart message for [me]476-jove to come up ; and up [I]476-jove went . [The room]1559-the room presented [itself]1559-the room as ample and interesting in detail and shabby with a quite commendable shabbiness . [I]476-jove had an impression of brown walls - they were papered with brown paper - of a long shelf along one side of [the room]1559-the room , with dusty plaster casts and a small cheap lay figure of a horse , of a table and something of grey wax partially covered with a cloth , and of scattered drawings . There was a gas stove in one corner , and some enameled ware that had been used for overnight cooking . The oilcloth on the floor was streaked with a peculiar white dust . [Ewart]481-ewart [himself]481-ewart was not in the first instance visible , but only a fourfold canvas screen at the end of [the room]1559-the room from which shouts proceeded of "[476-jove] Come on ! [He]481-ewart was lying on a small wooden fold - up bed , the scanty covering of which was supplemented by an overcoat and an elderly but still cheerful pair of check trousers , and [he]481-ewart was wearing pajamas of a virulent pink and green . " So in the first five minutes of [our]1917-we talk , as [I]479-cockroach seem to remember it now , [old Ewart]481-ewart struck the note that ran through all that morning 's intercourse .... To [me]479-cockroach it was a most memorable talk because it opened out quite new horizons of thought . [I]479-cockroach 'd been working rather close and out of touch with [Ewart]481-ewart 's free gesticulating way . [He]481-ewart was pessimistic that day and sceptical to the very root of things . [He]481-ewart made [me]479-cockroach feel clearly , what [I]479-cockroach had not felt at all before , the general adventurousness of life , particularly of life at the stage [we]1917-we had reached , and also the absence of definite objects , of any concerted purpose in the lives that were going on all round [us]1917-we . [He]481-ewart made [me]479-cockroach feel , too , how ready [I]479-cockroach was to take up commonplace assumptions . Just as [I]479-cockroach had always imagined that somewhere in social arrangements there was certainly [a Head - Master who would intervene if one went too far]5062-a head - master who would intervene if one went too far , so [I]479-cockroach had always had a sort of implicit belief that in [[our]1917-we [England]1-england]5063-our england there were [somewhere people who understood what [we]1917-we were all]5064-somewhere people who understood what we were all , as [a nation]5065-a nation , about . That crumpled into [his]481-ewart pit of doubt and vanished . [He]481-ewart brought out , sharply cut and certain , the immense effect of purposelessness in [London]9-london that [I]479-cockroach was already indistinctly feeling . [We]1917-we found [ourselves]1917-we at last returning through [Highgate Cemetery]111-highgate cemetery and [Waterlow Park]112-waterlow park - and [Ewart]481-ewart was talking . "[479-cockroach] Look at it there , " [he]481-ewart said , stopping and pointing to [the great vale of [London]9-london]5066-the great vale of london spreading wide and far . " [He]481-ewart swung [his]481-ewart arms to the long slopes about [us]1919-we , [tombs]5067-tombs and headstones in long perspectives , in limitless rows . [George Ponderevo]480-george , F.R.S. , [Sidney Ewart]481-ewart , R.I.P. Look at the rows of 'em ! " [He]481-ewart paused . "[1922-you] Do [you]1922-you see that hand ? The hand , [I]0-i mean , pointing upward , on the top of a blunted obelisk . Yes . Well , that 's what [I]0-i do for a living - when [I]0-i 'm not thinking , or drinking , or prowling , or making love , or pretending [I]0-i 'm trying to be [a sculptor]1923-a sculptor without either the money or the morals for [a model]1924-a model . See ? And [I]0-i do those hearts afire and [those pensive angel guardians with the palm of peace]1925-those pensive angel guardians with the palm of peace . Damned well [I]0-i do 'em and damned cheap ! [I]0-i 'm [a sweated victim]1926-a sweated victim , Ponderevo ... " That was the way of it , anyhow . [I]0-i drank deep of talk that day ; [we]5068-we went into theology , into philosophy ; [I]0-i had [my]0-i first glimpse of socialism . [I]0-i felt as though [I]0-i had been silent in a silence since [I]0-i and [he]5069-he had parted . At the thought of socialism [Ewart]481-ewart 's moods changed for a time to a sort of energy . "[0-i] After all , all this confounded vagueness might be altered . If [you]1927-i could get [men]1661-men to work together ... " It was a good talk that rambled through all [the universe]5002-the universe . [I]1927-i thought [I]1927-i was giving [my]1927-i mind refreshment , but indeed it was dissipation . All sorts of ideas , even now , carry [me]1927-i back as it were to a fountain - head , to [Waterlow Park]112-waterlow park and [[my]1927-i resuscitated Ewart]5071-my resuscitated ewart . There stretches away south of [us]5068-we long garden slopes and white gravestones and [the wide expanse of [London]9-london]5072-the wide expanse of london , and somewhere in the picture is a red old wall , sun - warmed , and a great blaze of Michaelmas daisies set off with late golden sunflowers and a drift of mottled , blood - red , fallen leaves . It was with [me]1927-i that day as though [I]1927-i had lifted [my]1927-i head suddenly out of dull and immediate things and looked at life altogether .... But it played the very devil with the copying up of [my]1927-i arrears of notes to which [I]1927-i had vowed the latter half of that day . After that reunion [Ewart]481-ewart and [I]1927-i met much and talked much , and in [our]5068-we subsequent encounters [his]481-ewart monologue was interrupted and [I]1927-i took [my]1927-i share . [He]481-ewart had exercised [me]1927-i so greatly that [I]1927-i lay awake at nights thinking [him]481-ewart over , and discoursed and answered [him]481-ewart in [my]1927-i head as [I]1927-i went in the morning to [the College]5073-the college . "[1927-i] It 's all so pointless , " [I]1927-i said , "[1927-i] because [people]920-people are slack and because it 's in the ebb of an age . But [you]1930-you 're [a socialist]1931-a socialist . " [Ewart]481-ewart , as the embodiment of talk , was certainly a leading factor in [my]1941-i conspicuous failure to go on studying . Social theory in its first crude form of Democratic Socialism gripped [my]1941-i intelligence more and more powerfully . [Ewart]481-ewart had [his]481-ewart share in that . [I]0-i wonder how many of [my]0-i sex are as preposterous . [I]0-i was , [you]5169-you see , abandoning all [my]0-i beliefs , [my]0-i conventions unasked . The stuff was , [I]0-i perceived , a mischievous trash , slightly stimulating , aromatic and attractive , likely to become a bad habit and train [people]920-people in the habitual use of stronger tonics and insidiously dangerous to [people with defective kidneys]5331-people with defective kidneys . It would cost about sevenpence the large bottle to make , including bottling , and [we]5332-we were to sell it at half a crown plus the cost of the patent medicine stamp . A thing that [I]0-i will confess deterred [me]0-i from the outset far more than the sense of dishonesty in this affair , was the supreme silliness of the whole concern . [I]0-i still clung to the idea that the world of [men]1661-men was or should be [a sane and just organisation]5334-a sane and just organisation , and the idea that [I]0-i should set [myself]0-i gravely , just at the fine springtime of [my]0-i life , to developing a monstrous bottling and [packing warehouse]5335-packing warehouse , bottling rubbish for the consumption of [foolish , credulous and depressed people]5336-foolish , credulous and depressed people , had in it a touch of insanity . [My]0-i early beliefs still clung to [me]0-i . [I]0-i felt assured that somewhere there must be a hitch in the fine prospect of ease and wealth under such conditions ; that somewhere , a little overgrown , perhaps , but still traceable , lay a neglected , wasted path of use and honour for [me]0-i . [I]0-i stuck to that resolution for seven long years . So [I]0-i made [my]0-i peace with [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle , and [we]2099-we set out upon this bright enterprise of selling slightly injurious rubbish at one - and - three - halfpence and two - and - nine a bottle , including the Government stamp . [We]2099-we made [Tono - Bungay]352-tono - bungay hum ! It brought [us]2099-we wealth , influence , respect , the confidence of [endless people]2100-endless people . All that [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle promised [me]0-i proved truth and understatement ; [Tono - Bungay]352-tono - bungay carried [me]0-i to freedoms and powers that no life of scientific research , no passionate service of humanity could ever have given [me]0-i .... It was [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle 's genius that did it . No doubt [he]731-my uncle needed me,-I was , [I]0-i will admit , [his]731-my uncle indispensable right hand ; but [his]2103-his was the brain to conceive . [He]731-my uncle wrote every advertisement ; some of them even [he]731-my uncle sketched . [You]2104-you must remember that [his]2105-his were the days before the Time took to enterprise and the vociferous hawking of that antiquated Encyclopedia . That alluring , button - holing , let - [me]0-i -just - tell - [you]2104-you - quite - soberly - something - [you]2104-you - ought - to - know style of newspaper advertisement , with every now and then a convulsive jump of some attractive phrase into capitals , was then almost a novelty . Very early , too , was that bright little quarter column , at least it was usually a quarter column in the evening papers : " HILARITY - Tono - [Bungay]123-bungay . Like Mountain Air in [the Veins]5417-the veins . "[731-my uncle] The penetrating trio of questions : " Are [you]2104-you bored with [your]2104-you Business ? ( The second one is about eighteen months later , the germ of the well - known " Fog "[2111-his] poster ; the third was designed for an influenza epidemic , but never issued . ) These things were only incidental in [[my]0-i department]2113-my department . [I]0-i had to polish them up for [the artist]2114-the artist and arrange the business of printing and distribution , and after [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle had had a violent and needless quarrel with [the advertising manager of [the Daily Regulator]2117-the daily regulator]2116-the advertising manager of the daily regulator about the amount of display given to one of [his]731-my uncle happy thoughts , [I]0-i also took up the negotiations of advertisements for the press . [We]2109-we discussed and worked out distribution together first in [the drawing - room floor in [Gower Street]135-gower street]2118-the drawing - room floor in gower street with [[my]0-i aunt]1458-my aunt sometimes helping very shrewdly , and then , with a steadily improving type of cigar and older and older whisky , in [his]2111-his smuggery at [[their]2109-we first house]2120-their first house , [the one in [Beckenham]147-beckenham]2121-the one in beckenham . Often [we]2109-we worked far into the night sometimes until dawn . [We]2109-we really worked infernally hard , and , [I]0-i recall , [we]2109-we worked with a very decided enthusiasm , not simply on [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle 's part but [mine]0-i , It was a game , an absurd but absurdly interesting game , and the points were scored in cases of bottles . [People]920-people think a happy notion is enough to make [a man rich]2124-a man rich , that fortunes can be made without toil . It 's a dream , as [every millionaire]2125-every millionaire ( except [one or two lucky gamblers]2126-one or two lucky gamblers ) can testify ; [I]0-i doubt if [J.D. Rockefeller]506-j.d. rockefeller in the early days of [Standard Oil]148-standard oil , worked harder than [we]2109-we did . [We]2109-we worked far into the night - and [we]2109-we also worked all day . [We]2109-we made a rule to be always dropping in at [the factory]2127-the factory unannounced to keep things right - for at first [we]2109-we could afford [no properly responsible underlings]2128-no properly responsible underlings - and [we]2109-we traveled [London]9-london , pretending to be [[our]2109-we own representatives]2129-our own representatives and making all sorts of special arrangements . But none of this was [my]0-i special work , and as soon as [we]2109-we could get [other men]2130-other men in , [I]0-i dropped the traveling , though [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle found it particularly interesting and kept it up for years . " Does [me]731-my uncle good , [George]480-george , to see the chaps behind [their]2135-their counters like [I]731-my uncle was once , "[731-my uncle] [he]731-my uncle explained . [My]0-i special and distinctive duty was to give Tono - Bungay substance and an outward and visible bottle , to translate [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle 's great imaginings into the creation of case after case of labelled bottles of nonsense , and the punctual discharge of them by [railway]2133-railway , [road]2134-road and steamer towards [their]2135-their ultimate goal in [the Great Stomach of [the People]1497-the people]2136-the great stomach of the people . By all modern standards the business was , as [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle would say , " absolutely bona fide . "[2109-we] [We]2109-we sold [our]2109-we stuff and got the money , and spent the money honestly in lies and clamour to sell more stuff . Section by section [we]2109-we spread it over [the whole of [the British Isles]149-the british isles]2139-the whole of the british isles ; first working [the middle - class [London]9-london suburbs]2140-the middle - class london suburbs , then [the outer suburbs]2141-the outer suburbs , then the [home counties]2142-home counties , then going ( with new bills and a more pious style of " ad "[731-my uncle] ) into [Wales]28-wales , [a great field always for a new patent - medicine]2143-a great field always for a new patent - medicine , and then into [Lancashire]150-lancashire . Under the shadow of [our]2109-we great leading line [we]2109-we were presently taking subsidiary specialties into action ; " Tono - Bungay Hair Stimulant "[2109-we] was [our]2109-we first supplement . Then came " Concentrated Tono - Bungay "[2109-we] for the eyes . That did n't go , but [we]2109-we had a considerable success with the Hair Stimulant . [We]2109-we broached the subject , [I]0-i remember , in a little catechism beginning : " Why does the hair fall out ? Because the follicles are fagged . What are the follicles ? ... "[2109-we] So it went on to the climax that the Hair Stimulant contained all " The essential principles of that most reviving tonic , Tono - Bungay , together with an emollient and nutritious oil derived from crude Neat 's Foot Oil by a process of refinement , separation and deodorization .... It will be manifest to any one of scientific attainments that in [Neat]507-neat 's Foot Oil derived from the hoofs and horns of beasts , [we]2109-we must necessarily have a natural skin and hair lubricant . "[2109-we] These [we]2109-we urged upon [the public]2150-the public for [their]2150-the public extraordinary nutritive and recuperative value in cases of fatigue and strain . [I]0-i really do believe there was an element of " kick "[0-i] in the strychnine in these lozenges , especially in those made according to [our]2109-we earlier formula . [I]0-i never really determined whether [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle regarded [Tono - Bungay]509-tono - bungay as a fraud , or whether [he]731-my uncle did n't come to believe in it in a kind of way by the mere reiteration of [his]731-my uncle own assertions . " [You]0-i 've a hard nature , [George]480-george , "[731-my uncle] [he]731-my uncle said . " [You]0-i 're too ready to run things down . How can [one TELL]5428-one tell ? How can one venture to [TELL]153-tell ! ... "[731-my uncle] [I]0-i suppose any creative and developing game would have interested [me]0-i in those years . At any rate , [I]0-i know [I]0-i put as much zeal into this Tono - Bungay as [any young lieutenant]2187-any young lieutenant could have done who suddenly found [himself]2187-any young lieutenant in command of [a ship]2188-a ship . It was extraordinarily interesting to [me]0-i to figure out the advantage accruing from this shortening of the process or that , and to weigh it against the capital cost of the alteration . [I]0-i made a sort of machine for sticking on the labels , that [I]0-i patented ; to this day there is a little trickle of royalties to [me]0-i from that . [I]0-i also contrived to have [our]2189-our mixture made concentrated , got the bottles , which all came sliding down a guarded slant - way , nearly filled with distilled water at one tap , and dripped [our]2189-our magic ingredients in at the next . This was an immense economy of space for [the inner sanctum]2190-the inner sanctum . For the bottling [we]2189-our needed special taps , and these , too , [I]0-i invented and patented . [We]2189-our had a sort of endless band of bottles sliding along an inclined glass trough made slippery with running water . At one end [a girl]5141-a girl held them up to the light , put aside any that were imperfect and placed the others in the trough ; the filling was automatic ; at the other end [a girl]5141-a girl slipped in the cork and drove it [home]1390-home with a little mallet . Each tank , the little one for the vivifying ingredients and the big one for distilled water , had a level indicator , and inside [I]0-i had a float arrangement that stopped the slide whenever either had sunk too low . [Another girl]2194-another girl stood ready with [my]0-i machine to label the corked bottles and hand them to [the three packers]2195-the three packers , who slipped them into [their]2195-the three packers outer papers and put them , with a pad of corrugated paper between each pair , into a little groove from which they could be made to slide neatly into position in [our]2189-our standard packing - case . It sounds wild , [I]0-i know , but [I]0-i believe [I]0-i was [the first man in [the city of]2197-the city of [London]9-london]2196-the first man in the city of london to pack patent medicines through the side of the packing - case , to discover there was a better way in than by the lid . [Our]2189-our cases packed [themselves]2195-the three packers , practically ; had only to be put into position on a little wheeled tray and when full pulled to the lift that dropped them to [the men downstairs , who padded up the free space and nailed on top and side]2198-the men downstairs , who padded up the free space and nailed on top and side . [[Our]2189-our girls]2199-our girls , moreover , packed with corrugated paper and matchbook - wood box partitions when [everybody else]2200-everybody else was using [expensive young men]2201-expensive young men to pack through the top of the box with straw , many breakages and much waste and confusion . As [I]0-i look back at [them]2195-the three packers now , those energetic years seem all compacted to a year or so ; from the days of [our]2189-our first hazardous beginning in [Farringdon Street]128-farringdon street with barely a thousand pounds ' worth of stuff or credit all told - and that got by something perilously like snatching - to the days when [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle went to the public on behalf of [himself]731-my uncle and [me]0-i ( one - tenth share ) and [[our]2189-our silent partners]2203-our silent partners , [the drug wholesalers]2204-the drug wholesalers and [the printing people]2205-the printing people and [the owner of that group of magazines and newspapers]2206-the owner of that group of magazines and newspapers , to ask with honest confidence for L150,000 . [Those silent partners]2207-those silent partners were remarkably sorry , [I]0-i know , that [they]2207-those silent partners had not taken larger shares and given [us]2189-our longer credit when the subscriptions came pouring in . [[My]0-i uncle]731-my uncle had a clear half to play with ( including the one - tenth understood to be [mine]0-i ) . L150,000 - think of it!-for the goodwill in a string of lies and a trade in bottles of mitigated water ! Do [you]2209-you realise the madness of [the world]751-the world that sanctions such a thing ? Perhaps [you]2209-you do n't . At times use and wo nt certainly blinded [me]0-i . If it had not been for [Ewart]481-ewart , [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i should have had an inkling of the wonderfulness of this development of [my]0-i fortunes ; [I]0-i should have grown accustomed to it , fallen in with all its delusions as completely as [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle presently did . [He]731-my uncle was immensely proud of the flotation . " [They]5429-they 've never been given such value , "[731-my uncle] [he]731-my uncle said , " for a dozen years . "[731-my uncle] But [Ewart]481-ewart , with [his]481-ewart gesticulating hairy hands and bony wrists , [his]481-ewart single - handed chorus to all this as it played itself over again in [my]0-i memory , and [he]481-ewart kept [my]0-i fundamental absurdity illuminated for [me]0-i during all this astonishing time . " It 's just on all fours with the rest of things , "[481-ewart] [he]481-ewart remarked ; " only more so . [You]0-i need n't think [you]0-i 're anything out of the way . "[481-ewart] [I]0-i remember one disquisition very distinctly . [The old merchant]5453-the old merchant used to tote about commodities ; [the new one]5454-the new one creates values . Does n't need to tote . Talking of mustard , [sir]5447-sir , [I]731-my uncle was at [Clapham Junction]155-clapham junction the other day , and all the banks are overgrown with horse radish that 's got loose from [a garden]1854-a garden somewhere . [You]5447-sir know what horseradish is - grows like wildfire - spreads - spreads . [I]731-my uncle stood at the end of the platform looking at the stuff and thinking about it . ' Like fame , ' [I]731-my uncle thought , ' rank and wild where it is n't wanted . Why do n't the really good things in life grow like horseradish ? ' [I]731-my uncle thought . [My]731-my uncle mind went off in a peculiar way it does from that to the idea that mustard costs a penny a tin - [I]731-my uncle bought some the other day for a ham [I]731-my uncle had . It came into [my]731-my uncle head that it would be ripping good business to use horseradish to adulterate mustard . "[731-my uncle] [I]0-i may say at once that [my]0-i poster project came to nothing in the end , though [Ewart]481-ewart devoted an interesting week to the matter . As [I]0-i look back on those days in which [we]2249-we built up [the great Tono - Bungay property]2250-the great tono - bungay property out of human hope and credit for bottles and rent and printing , [I]0-i see [my]0-i life as it were arranged in two parallel columns of unequal width , a wider , more diffused , eventful and various one which continually broadens out , the business side of [my]0-i life , and a narrow , darker and darkling one shot ever and again with a gleam of happiness , [my]0-i home - life with [Marion]485-marion . For , of course , [I]0-i married [Marion]485-marion . [I]0-i did n't , as a matter of fact , marry [her]485-marion until a year after Tono - [Bungay]123-bungay was thoroughly afloat , and then only after conflicts and discussions of a quite strenuous sort . By that time [I]0-i was twenty - four . It seems the next thing to childhood now . [We]2249-we were both in certain directions unusually ignorant and simple ; [we]2249-we were temperamentally antagonistic , and [we]2249-we hadn't - [I]0-i do n't think [we]2249-we were capable of - an idea in common . [She]485-marion was young and extraordinarily conventional - [she]485-marion seemed never to have an idea of [her]485-marion own but always the idea of [her]485-marion class - and [I]0-i was young and sceptical , enterprising and passionate ; the two links that held [us]2249-we together were the intense appeal [her]485-marion physical beauty had for [me]0-i , and [her]485-marion appreciation of [her]485-marion importance in [my]0-i thoughts . There can be no doubt of [my]0-i passion for [her]485-marion . In [her]485-marion [I]0-i had discovered [woman]2251-woman desired . The nights [I]0-i have lain awake on account of [her]485-marion , writhing , biting [my]0-i wrists in a fever of longing ! ... [I]0-i have told how [I]0-i got [myself]0-i a silk hat and black coat to please [her]485-marion on Sunday - to the derision of some of [[my]0-i fellow - students who charged to meet [me]0-i]2252-my fellow - students who charged to meet me , and how [we]2253-we became engaged . But that was only the beginning of [our]2253-we difference . To [her]485-marion that meant the beginning of a not unpleasant little secrecy , an occasional use of verbal endearments , perhaps even kisses . It was something to go on indefinitely , interfering in no way with [her]485-marion gossiping spells of work at [[Smithie]488-smithie 's]2254-smithie 's . To [me]0-i it was a pledge to come together into the utmost intimacy of soul and body so soon as [we]2253-we could contrive it .... [I]0-i do n't know if it will strike [the reader]4558-the reader that [I]0-i am setting out to discuss the queer , unwise love relationship and [my]0-i bungle of a marriage with excessive solemnity . But to [me]0-i it seems to reach out to vastly wider issues than [our]2253-we little personal affair . [I]0-i 've thought over [my]0-i life . In these last few years [I]0-i 've tried to get at least a little wisdom out of it . And in particular [I]0-i 've thought over this part of [my]0-i life . [I]0-i 'm enormously impressed by the ignorant , unguided way in which [we]2253-we two entangled [ourselves]2253-we with [each other]1240-each other . It seems to [me]0-i the queerest thing in all this network of misunderstandings and misstatements and faulty and ramshackle conventions which makes up [our]2253-we social order as [the individual]2257-the individual meets it , that [we]2253-we should have come together so accidentally and so blindly . Because [we]2253-we were no more than samples of the common fate . Love is not only the cardinal fact in the individual life , but the most important concern of [the community]2258-the community ; after all , the way in which [the young people of this generation]2259-the young people of this generation pair off determines the fate of [the nation]2260-the nation ; all the other affairs of [the State]4483-the state are subsidiary to that . And [we]2253-we leave it to [flushed and blundering youth]2262-flushed and blundering youth to stumble on its own significance , with nothing to guide in but shocked looks and sentimental twaddle and base whisperings and cant - smeared examples . [I]0-i have tried to indicate something of [my]0-i own sexual development in the preceding chapter . [Nobody]1152-nobody was ever frank and decent with [me]0-i in this relation ; [nobody]1152-nobody , no book , ever came and said to [me]0-i thus and thus is [the world]751-the world made , and so and so is necessary . Everything came obscurely , indefinitely , perplexingly ; and all [I]0-i knew of law or convention in the matter had the form of threatenings and prohibitions . Except through the furtive , shameful talk of [[my]0-i coevals]2266-my coevals at [Goudhurst]55-goudhurst and [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst , [I]0-i was not even warned against quite horrible dangers . [My]0-i ideas were made partly of instinct , partly of a romantic imagination , partly woven out of a medley of scraps of suggestion that came to [me]0-i haphazard . [I]0-i had read widely and confusedly " [Vathek]408-vathek , "[516-shelley] [Shelley]516-shelley , [Tom Paine]385-tom paine , [Plutarch]371-plutarch , [Carlyle]496-carlyle , [Haeckel]517-haeckel , [William Morris]499-morris , the Bible , [the Freethinker]2267-the freethinker , the Clarion , " The Woman Who Did,"-I[517-haeckel] mention the ingredients that come first to mind . All sorts of ideas were jumbled up in [me]0-i and never a lucid explanation . But it was evident to [me]0-i that [the world]751-the world regarded [Shelley]516-shelley , for example , as [a very heroic as well as beautiful person]2269-a very heroic as well as beautiful person ; and that to defy convention and succumb magnificently to passion was the proper thing to do to gain the respect and affection of [all decent people]2270-all decent people . And the make - up of [Marion]485-marion 's mind in the matter was an equally irrational affair . [Her]485-marion training had been one , not simply of silences , but suppressions . An enormous force of suggestion had so shaped [her]485-marion that the intense natural fastidiousness of girlhood had developed into an absolute perversion of instinct . For all that is cardinal in this essential business of life [she]485-marion had one inseparable epithet-"horrid . "[2272-an impossible one] Without any such training [she]485-marion would have been [a shy lover]2271-a shy lover , but now [she]485-marion was [an impossible one]2272-an impossible one . For the rest [she]485-marion had derived , [I]0-i suppose , partly from the sort of fiction [she]485-marion got from [the Public Library]2273-the public library , and partly from the workroom talk at [[Smithie]488-smithie 's]2254-smithie 's . So far as the former origin went , [she]485-marion had an idea of love as a state of worship and service on the part of [the man]2275-the man and of condescension on the part of [the woman]2276-the woman . There was nothing " horrid "[485-marion] about it in any fiction [she]485-marion had read . [The man]2275-the man gave presents , did services , sought to be in every way delightful . [The woman]2276-the woman " went out "[2276-the woman] with [him]2275-the man , smiled at [him]2275-the man , was kissed by [him]2275-the man in decorous secrecy , and if [he]2275-the man chanced to offend , denied [her]2276-the woman countenance and presence . Usually [she]2276-the woman did something " for [his]2275-the man good "[2276-the woman] to [him]2275-the man , made [him]2275-the man go to [church]793-church , made [him]2275-the man give up smoking or gambling , smartened [him]2275-the man up . Quite at the end of the story came a marriage , and after that the interest ceased . That was the tenor of [Marion]485-marion 's fiction ; but [I]0-i think the work - table conversation at [Smithie]488-smithie 's did something to modify that . At [Smithie]488-smithie 's it was recognised , [I]0-i think , that [a " fellow]5489-a " fellow "[0-i] was a possession to be desired ; that it was better to be engaged to [a fellow]2280-a fellow than not ; that [fellows]2281-fellows had to be kept - [they]2281-fellows might be mislaid , [they]2281-fellows might even be stolen . There was a case of stealing at [Smithie]488-smithie 's , and many tears . [Smithie]488-smithie [I]0-i met before [we]2282-we were married , and afterwards [she]488-smithie became [a frequent visitor to [[our]2282-we house at [Ealing]160-ealing]2284-our house at ealing]2283-a frequent visitor to our house at ealing . [She]488-smithie was [a thin , bright - eyed , hawk - nosed girl of thirtyodd , with prominent teeth , a high - pitched , eager voice and a disposition to be urgently smart]2285-a thin , bright - eyed , hawk - nosed girl of thirtyodd , with prominent teeth , a high - pitched , eager voice and a disposition to be urgently smart in [her]488-smithie dress . [Her]488-smithie hats were startling and various , but invariably disconcerting , and [she]488-smithie talked in a rapid , nervous flow that was hilarious rather than witty , and broken by little screams of " Oh , [my]488-smithie dear ! "[488-smithie] and " [you]0-i never did ! "[488-smithie] [She]488-smithie was [the first woman [I]0-i ever met who used scent]2286-the first woman i ever met who used scent . [Poor old Smithie]488-smithie ! What [a harmless , kindly soul]2287-a harmless , kindly soul [she]488-smithie really was , and how heartily [I]0-i detested [her]488-smithie ! Out of the profits on the Persian robes [she]488-smithie supported [[a sister]1768-a sister 's family of [three children]2290-three children]2289-a sister 's family of three children , [she]488-smithie " helped "[488-smithie] [a worthless brother]2291-a worthless brother , and overflowed in help even to [[her]488-smithie workgirls]2292-her workgirls , but that did n't weigh with [me]0-i in those youthfully - narrow times . It was one of the intense minor irritations of [my]0-i married life that [Smithie]488-smithie 's whirlwind chatter seemed to [me]0-i to have far more influence with [Marion]485-marion than anything [I]0-i had to say . Before all things [I]0-i coveted [her]488-smithie grip upon [Marion]485-marion 's inaccessible mind . In [the workroom at [Smithie]488-smithie 's]2293-the workroom at smithie 's , [I]0-i gathered , [they]2294-they always spoke of [me]0-i demurely as " [A Certain Person]5490-a certain person . "[2294-they] [I]0-i was rumoured to be dreadfully " clever , "[0-i] and there were doubts - not altogether without justification - of the sweetness of [my]0-i temper . [I]0-i do n't think [she]696-one actually threw it , for as [we]2475-we drove away from [the church]782-the church [I]0-i saw [her]696-one in a dreadful , and , it seemed to [me]0-i , hopeless , struggle with [her]696-one pocket ; and afterwards [my]0-i eye caught the missile of good fortune lying , it or its fellow , most obviously mislaid , behind the umbrella - stand in [the hall]1104-the hall .... The whole business was much more absurd , more incoherent , more human than [I]0-i had anticipated , but [I]0-i was far too young and serious to let the latter quality atone for its shortcomings . [I]0-i am so remote from this phase of [my]0-i youth that [I]0-i can look back at it all as dispassionately as one looks at a picture - at some wonderful , perfect sort of picture that is inexhaustible ; but at the time these things filled [me]0-i with unspeakable resentment . One day [I]4606-your aunt came into [Raggett Street]125-raggett street at lunch time and [she]5629-one of the girls was alone , sitting at [her]5629-one of the girls desk . And [we]5653-we had a long evening alone together , with jaded nerves and hearts that fluctuated between a hard and dreary recognition of facts and , on [my]2551-i part at least , a strange unwonted tenderness ; because in some extraordinary way this crisis had destroyed [our]5653-we mutual apathy and made [us]5653-we feel [one another]1140-one another again . It was a dialogue that had discrepant parts that fell into lumps of talk that failed to join on to [their]5663-their predecessors , that began again at a different level , higher or lower , that assumed new aspects in the intervals and assimilated new considerations . [We]5653-we discussed the fact that [we]5653-we two were no longer [lovers]2502-lovers ; never before had [we]5653-we faced that . " The perplexing thing about life is the irresolvable complexity of reality , of things and relations alike . Nothing is simple . Every wrong done has a certain justice in it , and every good deed has dregs of evil . As for [us]2562-both of us , young still , and still without self - knowledge , resounded a hundred discordant notes in the harsh angle of that shock . " [I]0-i shall be alone! [... MUTNEY]530-mutney ! [Mutney]530-mutney , do n't leave [me]0-i ! Oh ! [Mutney]530-mutney ! [I]0-i did n't understand . "[0-i] [I]0-i had to harden [my]0-i heart indeed , for it seemed to [me]0-i at moments in those last hours together that at last , too late , the longed - for thing had happened and [Marion]485-marion had come alive . A new - born hunger for [me]0-i lit [her]485-marion eyes . " Do n't leave [me]485-marion ! "[485-marion] [she]485-marion said , " do n't leave [me]485-marion ! "[485-marion] [She]485-marion clung to [me]0-i ; [she]485-marion kissed [me]0-i with tear - salt lips . [I]0-i was promised now and pledged , and [I]0-i hardened [my]0-i heart against this impossible dawn . Yet it seems to [me]0-i that there were moments when it needed but a cry , but one word to have united [us]2567-we again for all [our]2567-we lives . Could [we]2567-we have united again ? Would that passage have enlightened [us]2567-we for ever or should [we]2567-we have fallen back in a week or so into the old estrangement , the old temperamental opposition ? Of that there is now no telling . [Our]2567-we own resolve carried [us]2567-we on [our]2567-we predestined way . [She]485-marion did it , [she]485-marion said , because [he]2671-a boy half her age needed nursing .... But now that [I]0-i resume the main line of [my]0-i story it may be well to describe the personal appearance of [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle as [I]0-i remember [him]731-my uncle during those magnificent years that followed [his]731-my uncle passage from trade to finance . [The little man]5103-the little man plumped up very considerably during the creation of [the Tono - Bungay property]2679-the tono - bungay property , but with the increasing excitements that followed that first flotation came dyspepsia and a certain flabbiness and falling away . [His]5103-the little man abdomen - if [the reader]4558-the reader will pardon [my]0-i taking [his]5103-the little man features in the order of their value - had at first a nice full roundness , but afterwards it lost tone without , however , losing size . [He]5103-the little man always went as though [he]5103-the little man was proud of it and would make as much of it as possible . To the last [his]5103-the little man movements remained quick and sudden , [his]5103-the little man short firm legs , as [he]5103-the little man walked , seemed to twinkle rather than display the scissors - stride of common humanity , and [he]5103-the little man never seemed to have knees , but instead , a dispersed flexibility of limb . There was , [I]0-i seem to remember , a secular intensification of [his]5103-the little man features ; [his]5103-the little man nose developed character , became aggressive , stuck out at [the world]751-the world more and more ; the obliquity of [his]5103-the little man mouth , [I]0-i think , increased . From the face that returns to [my]0-i memory projects a long cigar that is sometimes cocked jauntily up from the higher corner , that sometimes droops from the lower;-it was as eloquent as a dog 's tail , and [he]5103-the little man removed it only for the more emphatic modes of speech . [He]5103-the little man assumed a broad black ribbon for [his]5103-the little man glasses , and wore them more and more askew as time went on . [His]5103-the little man hair seemed to stiffen with success , but towards the climax it thinned greatly over the crown , and [he]5103-the little man brushed it hard back over [his]5103-the little man ears where , however , it stuck out fiercely . It always stuck out fiercely over [his]5103-the little man forehead , up and forward . [He]5103-the little man adopted an urban style of dressing with the onset of Tono - Bungay and rarely abandoned it . [He]5103-the little man preferred silk hats with ample rich brims , often a trifle large for [him]5103-the little man by modern ideas , and [he]5103-the little man wore them at various angles to [his]5103-the little man axis ; [his]5103-the little man taste in trouserings was towards fairly emphatic stripes and [his]5103-the little man trouser cut was neat ; [he]5103-the little man liked [his]5103-the little man frock - coat long and full , although that seemed to shorten [him]5103-the little man . [He]5103-the little man displayed a number of valuable rings , and [I]0-i remember one upon [his]5103-the little man left little finger with a large red stone bearing Gnostic symbols . " [Clever chaps]5687-clever chaps , [those Gnostics]5688-those gnostics , [George]480-george , "[5103-the little man] [he]5103-the little man told [me]0-i . " Means a lot . Lucky ! "[5103-the little man] [He]5103-the little man never had any but a black mohair watch - chair . In [the country]5089-the country [he]5103-the little man affected grey and a large grey cloth top - hat , except when motoring ; then [he]5103-the little man would have a brown deer - stalker cap and a fur suit of esquimaux cut with a sort of boot - end to the trousers . Of an evening [he]5103-the little man would wear white waistcoats and plain gold studs . [He]5103-the little man hated diamonds . But for other meals [he]5103-the little man remained reasonably omnivorous . [He]5103-the little man was something of a gastronome , and would eat anything [he]5103-the little man particularly liked in an audible manner , and perspire upon [his]5103-the little man forehead . [He]5103-the little man was [a studiously moderate drinker]2688-a studiously moderate drinker - except when the spirit of some public banquet or some great occasion caught [him]5103-the little man and bore [him]5103-the little man beyond [his]5103-the little man wariness - there [he]5103-the little man would , as it were , drink inadvertently and become flushed and talkative - about everything but [his]5103-the little man business projects . But that [I]0-i will tell about later . The point [I]0-i was coming to was that [I]0-i did not realise until after the crash how recklessly [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle had kept [his]731-my uncle promise of paying a dividend of over eight per cent . on the ordinary shares of that hugely over - capitalised enterprise , [Household Services]200-household services . [I]0-i drifted out of business affairs into [my]0-i research much more than either [I]0-i or [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle had contemplated . Finance was much less to [my]0-i taste than the organisation of [the Tono - Bungay factory]2779-the tono - bungay factory . In the new field of enterprise there was a great deal of bluffing and gambling , of taking chances and concealing material facts - and these are hateful things to the scientific type of mind . It was n't fear [I]0-i felt so much as an uneasy inaccuracy . [I]0-i did n't realise dangers , [I]0-i simply disliked the sloppy , relaxing quality of this new sort of work . [I]0-i was at last constantly making excuses not to come up to [him]731-my uncle in [London]9-london . The latter part of [his]731-my uncle business career recedes therefore beyond the circle of any particular life . [I]0-i lived more or less with [him]731-my uncle ; [I]0-i talked , [I]0-i advised , [I]0-i helped [him]731-my uncle at times to fight [[his]731-my uncle Sunday crowd]2780-his sunday crowd at [Crest Hill]205-crest hill , but [I]0-i did not follow nor guide [him]731-my uncle . From the Do Ut time onward [he]731-my uncle rushed up [the financial world]2781-the financial world like a bubble in water and left [me]0-i like some busy water - thing down below in [the deeps]2782-the deeps . Anyhow , [he]731-my uncle was an immense success . [The public]2150-the public was , [I]0-i think , particularly attracted by the homely familiarity of [his]731-my uncle field of work - [you]2784-you never lost sight of [your]2784-you investment [they]2150-the public felt , with the name on the house - flannel and shaving - strop - and its allegiance was secured by the Egyptian solidity of [his]731-my uncle apparent results . [Tono - Bungay]352-tono - bungay , after [its]352-tono - bungay reconstruction , paid thirteen , Moggs seven , [Domestic Utilities]2752-domestic utilities had been a safe - looking nine ; here was [Household Services]2765-household services with eight ; on such a showing [he]731-my uncle had merely to buy and sell [Roeburn]554-roeburn 's Antiseptic fluid , Razor soaks and Bath crystals in three weeks to clear twenty thousand pounds . It was a period of expansion and confidence ; much money was seeking investment and " Industrials "[731-my uncle] were the fashion . Prices were rising all round . There remained little more for [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle to do therefore , in [his]731-my uncle climb to the high unstable crest of Financial Greatness but , as [he]731-my uncle said , to " grasp the cosmic oyster , [George]480-george , while it gaped , "[731-my uncle] which , being translated , meant for [him]731-my uncle to buy [respectable businesses]2789-respectable businesses confidently and courageously at [the vendor]2013-the vendor 's estimate , add thirty or forty thousand to the price and sell [them]2789-respectable businesses again . [I]0-i think of the long procession of people who sat down before [us]2857-our and propounded this and that . Now it was a device for selling bread under a fancy name and so escaping the laws as to weight - this was afterwards floated as the Decorticated Health - Bread Company and bumped against the law - now it was a new scheme for still more strident advertisement , now it was a story of unsuspected deposits of minerals , now a cheap and nasty substitute for this or that common necessity , now the treachery of [a too well - informed employee]2862-a too well - informed employee , anxious to become [[our]2857-our partner]2728-our partner . The whole of this modern mercantile investing civilisation is indeed such stuff as dreams are made of . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm sorry [I]0-i came . But , still , now [I]0-i 'm here .... And first as to quap ; quap , [sir]5447-sir , is the most radio - active stuff in [the world]751-the world . That 's quap ! [He]5447-sir conjured up a vision of this strange forgotten kink in [[the world]751-the world 's littoral]5721-the world 's littoral , of [the long meandering channels that spread and divaricate and spend their burden of mud and silt within [the thunderbelt of Atlantic surf]5723-the thunderbelt of atlantic surf]5722-the long meandering channels that spread and divaricate and spend their burden of mud and silt within the thunderbelt of atlantic surf , of the dense tangled vegetation that creeps into the shimmering water with root and sucker . [He]5447-sir gave a sense of heat and a perpetual reek of vegetable decay , and told how at last comes a break among these things , an arena fringed with bone - white dead trees , a sight of [the hard - blue sea line beyond the dazzling surf]5724-the hard - blue sea line beyond the dazzling surf and a wide desolation of dirty shingle and mud , bleached and scarred .... And in the midst , two clumsy heaps shaped like the backs of hogs , one small , one great , sticking out under a rib of rock that cuts the space across,-quap ! "[5447-sir] There it is , " said [Gordon - Nasmyth]562-gordon - nasmyth , "[5447-sir] worth three pounds an ounce , if it 's worth a penny ; two great heaps of it , rotten stuff and soft , ready to shovel and wheel , and [you]5447-sir may get it by the ton !
