[I]5447-sir am inclined to think [Gordon - Nasmyth]562-gordon - nasmyth imagined [we]5728-we would give [him]562-gordon - nasmyth a cheque for six thousand pounds on the strength of [his]562-gordon - nasmyth talk . It was very good talk , but [we]5728-we did n't do that . [I]5447-sir stipulated for samples of [his]562-gordon - nasmyth stuff for analysis , and [he]562-gordon - nasmyth consented - reluctantly . [I]5447-sir think , on the whole , [he]562-gordon - nasmyth would rather [I]5447-sir did n't examine samples . [He]562-gordon - nasmyth made a motion pocketwards , that gave [us]5728-we an invincible persuasion that [he]562-gordon - nasmyth had a sample upon [him]562-gordon - nasmyth , and that at the last instant [he]562-gordon - nasmyth decided not to produce it prematurely . There was evidently a curious strain of secretiveness in [him]562-gordon - nasmyth . [He]562-gordon - nasmyth did n't like to give [us]5728-we samples , and [he]562-gordon - nasmyth would n't indicate within three hundred miles the position of [this Mordet Island of [his]562-gordon - nasmyth]5730-this mordet island of his . [[Our]5736-we cosy inner office]5737-our cosy inner office became a little place , and all [our]5736-we business cold and lifeless exploits beside [his]562-gordon - nasmyth glimpses of [strange minglings of [men]1661-men]5738-strange minglings of men , of slayings unavenged and curious customs , of trade where no writs run , and the dark treacheries of [eastern ports]5740-eastern ports and [uncharted channels]5741-uncharted channels . And in the end [he]562-gordon - nasmyth produced [his]562-gordon - nasmyth sample , a little lump of muddy clay speckled with brownish grains , in a glass bottle wrapped about with lead and flannel - red flannel it was , [I]5447-sir remember - a hue which is , [I]5447-sir know , popularly supposed to double all the mystical efficacies of flannel . "[5447-sir] Do n't carry it about on [you]2950-you , " said [Gordon - Nasmyth]562-gordon - nasmyth . "[5447-sir] It makes a sore . " [I]5447-sir took the stuff to [Thorold]566-thorold , and [Thorold]566-thorold had the exquisite agony of discovering two new elements in what was then a confidential analysis . [He]562-gordon - nasmyth has christened them and published since , but at the time [Gordon - Nasmyth]562-gordon - nasmyth would n't hear for a moment of [our]5736-we publication of any facts at all ; indeed , [he]562-gordon - nasmyth flew into a violent passion and abused [me]5447-sir mercilessly even for showing the stuff to [Thorold]566-thorold . "[5447-sir] [I]0-i thought [you]2950-you were going to analyse it [yourself]2950-you , " [he]562-gordon - nasmyth said with the touching persuasion of [the layman]5744-the layman that [a scientific man]5745-a scientific man knows and practises at the sciences . [I]0-i made some commercial inquiries , and there seemed even then much truth in [Gordon - Nasmyth]562-gordon - nasmyth 's estimate of the value of the stuff . It was before the days of [Capern]567-capern 's discovery of the value of canadium and [his]562-gordon - nasmyth use of it in the Capern filament , but the cerium and thorium alone were worth the money [he]562-gordon - nasmyth extracted for the gas - mantles then in vogue . There were , however , doubts . Indeed , there were numerous doubts . What were the limits of the gas - mantle trade ? How much thorium , not to speak of cerium , could [they]5746-they take at a maximum . Suppose that quantity was high enough to justify [our]5736-we shipload , came doubts in another quarter . [You]5747-you see , there were doubts of every grade and class in the way of this adventure . [[My]5447-sir uncle]731-my uncle was disposed to be altogether sceptical , but [I]5447-sir was n't so decided . [I]5447-sir think [I]5447-sir was drawn by its picturesque aspects . For the ideal filament needed five per cent . of canadium , and canadium was known to [the world]751-the world only as a newly separated constituent of a variety of the rare mineral rutile . [I]5447-sir told [[my]5447-sir uncle]731-my uncle , and [we]5736-we jumped on to the process at once . [Gordon - Nasmyth]562-gordon - nasmyth stands but only because [he]562-gordon - nasmyth played a part at last in the crisis of [our]5736-we fortunes . As [I]5447-sir look back , [I]5447-sir am still dazzled and incredulous to think of the quality of [our]5736-we opportunities . [We]5736-we did the most extraordinary things ; things that it seems absurd to [me]5447-sir to leave to [any casual man of wealth and enterprise who cares to do them]5761-any casual man of wealth and enterprise who cares to do them . [I]5447-sir had some amazing perceptions of just how modern thought and the supply of fact to [the general mind]5762-the general mind may be controlled by money . Among other things that [[my]5447-sir uncle]731-my uncle offered for , [he]731-my uncle tried very hard to buy the British Medical Journal and the Lancet , and run them on what [he]731-my uncle called modern lines , and when [they]5764-they resisted [him]731-my uncle [he]731-my uncle talked very vigorously for a time of organising a rival enterprise . That was a very magnificent idea indeed in its way ; it would have given a tremendous advantage in the handling of innumerable specialties and indeed [I]5447-sir scarcely know how far it would not have put the medical profession in [our]5736-we grip . It still amazes [me]5447-sir - [I]5447-sir shall die amazed - that such a thing can be possible in the modern state . If [[my]5447-sir uncle]731-my uncle failed to bring the thing off , [some one else]5668-some one else may succeed . [I]3003-i seem to remember [[my]3003-i uncle]731-my uncle taking to shopping quite suddenly . [I]3003-i forget now when the change came and [he]731-my uncle began to spend . [He]731-my uncle began to spend and "[3003-i] shop . " So soon as [he]731-my uncle began to shop , [he]731-my uncle began to shop violently . [He]731-my uncle began buying pictures , and then , oddly enough , old clocks . For [the Chiselhurst house]6032-the chiselhurst house [he]731-my uncle bought nearly a dozen grandfather clocks and three copper warming pans . After that [he]731-my uncle bought much furniture . Then [he]731-my uncle plunged into art patronage , and began to commission pictures and to make presents to [churches]6033-churches and [institutions]6034-institutions . [His]731-my uncle buying increased with a regular acceleration . For [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle it was a period of stupendous inflation . Each time [I]0-i met [him]731-my uncle [I]0-i found [him]731-my uncle more confident , more comprehensive , more consciously a factor in great affairs . Soon [he]731-my uncle was no longer [an associate of [merely business men]3086-merely business men]3085-an associate of merely business men ; [he]731-my uncle was big enough for the attentions of greater powers . [I]0-i grew used to discovering some item of personal news about [him]731-my uncle in [my]0-i evening paper , or to the sight of a full - page portrait of [him]731-my uncle in a sixpenny magazine . Usually the news was of some munificent act , some romantic piece of buying or giving or some fresh rumour of reconstruction . [He]731-my uncle was always imaginative , erratic , inconsistent , recklessly inexact , and [his]731-my uncle inundation of wealth merely gave [him]731-my uncle scope for these qualities . It is true , indeed , that towards the climax [he]731-my uncle became intensely irritable at times and impatient of contradiction , but that , [I]0-i think , was rather the gnawing uneasiness of sanity than any mental disturbance . [I]0-i saw too much of [him]731-my uncle ; [my]0-i memory is choked with disarranged moods and aspects . [He]3331-he had kept the truth from [his]3331-he mind a long time , but that morning it had forced its way to [him]3331-he with an aspect that brooked no denial that this time it was not just changes that were coming in [[his]3331-he world]6345-his world , but that [all [his]3331-he world]6346-all his world lay open and defenceless , conquered and surrendered , doomed so far as [he]3331-he could see , root and branch , scale and form alike , to change . For nearly all the time that [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle was incubating and hatching [Crest Hill]205-crest hill [I]0-i was busy in [a little transverse valley between that great beginning and [Lady Grove]203-lady grove]6348-a little transverse valley between that great beginning and lady grove with more and more costly and ambitious experiments in aerial navigation . This work was indeed the main substance of [my]0-i life through all the great time of the Tono - Bungay symphony . [I]0-i have told already how [I]0-i came to devote [myself]0-i to this system of inquiries , how in a sort of disgust with the common adventure of life [I]0-i took up the dropped ends of [my]0-i college studies , taking them up again with [a man]718-a man 's resolution instead of [a boy]905-a boy 's ambition . From the first [I]0-i did well at this work . It - was , [I]0-i think , largely a case of special aptitude , of a peculiar irrelevant vein of faculty running through [my]0-i mind . It is one of those things [men]1661-men seem to have by chance , that has little or nothing to do with [their]1661-men general merit , and which it is ridiculous to be either conceited or modest about . [I]0-i did get through a very big mass of work in those years , working for a time with a concentrated fierceness that left little of such energy or capacity as [I]0-i possess unused . [I]0-i worked out a series of problems connected with the stability of bodies pitching in the air and the internal movements of the wind , and [I]0-i also revolutionised one leading part at last of the theory of explosive engines . These things are to be found in the Philosophical Transactions , the Mathematical Journal , and less frequently in one or two other such publications , and [they]6352-they need n't detain [us]6353-us here . Indeed , [I]0-i doubt if [I]0-i could write about them here . [One]696-one acquires a sort of shorthand for [one]696-one 's notes and mind in relation to such special work . [I]0-i have never taught ; nor lectured , that is to say , [I]0-i have never had to express [my]0-i thoughts about mechanical things in ordinary everyday language , and [I]0-i doubt very much if [I]0-i could do so now without extreme tedium . [My]0-i work was , to begin with , very largely theoretical . [I]0-i was able to attack such early necessities of verification as arose with quite little models , using a turntable to get the motion through the air , and cane , whalebone and silk as building material . But a time came when incalculable factors crept in , factors of human capacity and factors of insufficient experimental knowledge , when [one]696-one must needs guess and try . Then [I]0-i had to enlarge the scale of [my]0-i operations , and soon [I]0-i had enlarged them very greatly . [I]0-i set to work almost concurrently on the balance and stability of [gliders]6357-gliders and upon the steering of inflated bags , the latter a particularly expensive branch of work . [I]0-i was no doubt moved by something of the same spirit of lavish expenditure that was running away with [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle in these developments . [Other men]2130-other men came and went as [I]0-i needed [them]2130-other men . [I]0-i do not know how far it is possible to convey to [any one who has not experienced it , the peculiar interest , the peculiar satisfaction that lies in a sustained research when one is not hampered by want of money]6378-any one who has not experienced it , the peculiar interest , the peculiar satisfaction that lies in a sustained research when one is not hampered by want of money . It is a different thing from any other sort of human effort . [You]6379-you are free from the exasperating conflict with [your]6379-you fellow - creatures altogether - at least so far as the essential work goes ; that for [me]0-i is its peculiar merit . Scientific truth is the remotest of [mistresses]6380-mistresses ; [she]6380-mistresses hides in strange places , [she]6380-mistresses is attained by tortuous and laborious roads , but [SHE]6380-mistresses IS ALWAYS THERE ! Things grow under [your]6379-you hands when [you]6379-you serve [her]6380-mistresses , things that are permanent as nothing else is permanent in the whole life of [man]1088-man . That , [I]0-i think , is the peculiar satisfaction of science and its enduring reward .... The taking up of experimental work produced a great change in [my]0-i personal habits . [I]0-i have told how already once in [my]0-i life at [Wimblehurst]2-wimblehurst [I]0-i had a period of discipline and continuous effort , and how , when [I]0-i came to [South Kensington]101-south kensington , [I]0-i became demoralised by the immense effect of [London]9-london , by its innumerable imperative demands upon [my]0-i attention and curiosity . And [I]0-i parted with much of [my]0-i personal pride when [I]0-i gave up science for the development of [Tono - Bungay]626-tono - bungay . But [my]0-i poverty kept [me]0-i abstinent and [my]0-i youthful romanticism kept [me]0-i chaste until [my]0-i married life was well under way . Then in all directions [I]0-i relaxed . [I]0-i did a large amount of work , but [I]0-i never troubled to think whether it was [my]0-i maximum nor whether the moods and indolences that came to [me]0-i at times were avoidable things . With the coming of plenty [I]0-i ate abundantly and foolishly , drank freely and followed [my]0-i impulses more and more carelessly . [I]0-i felt no reason why [I]0-i should do anything else . Never at any point did [I]0-i use [myself]0-i to the edge of [my]0-i capacity . The emotional crisis of [my]0-i divorce did not produce any immediate change in these matters of personal discipline . [I]0-i found some difficulty at first in concentrating [my]0-i mind upon scientific work , it was so much more exacting than business , but [I]0-i got over that difficulty by smoking . [I]0-i became [an inordinate cigar smoker]6383-an inordinate cigar smoker ; it gave [me]0-i moods of profound depression , but [I]0-i treated these usually by the homeopathic method,-by lighting another cigar . [I]0-i did n't realise at all how loose [my]0-i moral and nervous fibre had become until [I]0-i reached the practical side of [my]0-i investigations and was face to face with the necessity of finding out just how it felt to use [a glider]2772-a glider and just what [a man]718-a man could do with one . [I]0-i got into this relaxed habit of living in spite of very real tendencies in [my]0-i nature towards discipline . [I]0-i 've never been in love with self - indulgence . That philosophy of the loose lip and the lax paunch is one for which [I]0-i 've always had an instinctive distrust . [I]0-i like bare things , stripped things , plain , austere and continent things , fine lines and cold colours . But in these plethoric times when there is too much coarse stuff for [everybody]1089-everybody and the struggle for life takes the form of competitive advertisement and the effort to fill [[your]6387-your neighbour]6388-your neighbour 's eye , when there is no urgent demand either for personal courage , sound nerves or stark beauty , [we]6389-we find [ourselves]6389-we by accident . Always before these times [the bulk of [the people]1497-the people]6390-the bulk of the people did not over - eat [themselves]6390-the bulk of the people , because [they]6390-the bulk of the people could n't , whether [they]6390-the bulk of the people wanted to do so or not , and [all but a very few]6392-all but a very few were kept "[0-i] fit " by unavoidable exercise and personal danger . Now , if only [he]718-a man pitch [his]718-a man standard low enough and keep free from pride , almost [any one]1444-any one can achieve a sort of excess . [You]6387-your can go through contemporary life fudging and evading , indulging and slacking , never really hungry nor frightened nor passionately stirred , [your]6387-your highest moment a mere sentimental orgasm , and [your]6387-your first real contact with primary and elemental necessities , the sweat of [your]6387-your death - bed . So [I]351-ponderevo think it was with [[my]351-ponderevo uncle]731-my uncle ; so , very nearly , it was with [me]351-ponderevo . But [the glider]6395-the glider brought [me]351-ponderevo up smartly . [I]351-ponderevo had to find out how these things went down the air , and the only way to find out is to go down with one . And for a time [I]351-ponderevo would n't face it . There is something impersonal about a book , [I]351-ponderevo suppose . At any rate [I]351-ponderevo find [myself]351-ponderevo able to write down here just the confession [I]351-ponderevo 've never been able to make to any one face to face , the frightful trouble it was to [me]351-ponderevo to bring [myself]351-ponderevo to do what [I]351-ponderevo suppose [every other coloured boy in [the West Indies]258-the west indies]6396-every other coloured boy in the west indies could do without turning a hair , and that is to fling [myself]351-ponderevo off for [my]351-ponderevo first soar down the wind . The first trial was bound to be the worst ; it was an experiment [I]351-ponderevo made with life , and the chance of death or injury was , [I]351-ponderevo supposed , about equal to the chance of success . [I]351-ponderevo believed that with a dawn - like lucidity . [I]351-ponderevo had begun with [a glider that [I]351-ponderevo imagined was on the lines of the [Wright brothers]259-wright brothers ' aeroplane]6397-a glider that i imagined was on the lines of the wright brothers ' aeroplane , but [I]351-ponderevo could not be sure . [It]6397-a glider that i imagined was on the lines of the wright brothers ' aeroplane might turn over . [I]351-ponderevo might upset [it]6397-a glider that i imagined was on the lines of the wright brothers ' aeroplane . [It]6397-a glider that i imagined was on the lines of the wright brothers ' aeroplane might burrow its nose at the end and smash itself and [me]351-ponderevo . The conditions of the flight necessitated alert attention ; it was n't a thing to be done by jumping off and shutting [one]696-one 's eyes or getting angry or drunk to do it . [One]696-one had to use [one]696-one 's weight to balance . And when at last [I]351-ponderevo did it it was horrible - for ten seconds . For ten seconds or so , as [I]351-ponderevo swept down the air flattened on [my]351-ponderevo infernal framework and with the wind in [my]351-ponderevo eyes , the rush of the ground beneath [me]351-ponderevo filled [me]351-ponderevo with sick and helpless terror ; [I]351-ponderevo felt as though some violent oscillatory current was throbbing in brain and back bone , and [I]351-ponderevo groaned aloud . [I]351-ponderevo set [my]351-ponderevo teeth and groaned . It was a groan wrung out of [me]351-ponderevo in spite of [myself]351-ponderevo . [My]351-ponderevo sensations of terror swooped to a climax . And then , [you]6401-you know , they ended ! Suddenly [my]351-ponderevo terror was over and done with . [I]351-ponderevo was soaring through the air right way up , steadily , and no mischance had happened . [I]351-ponderevo felt intensely alive and [my]351-ponderevo nerves were strung like a bow . [I]351-ponderevo shifted a limb , swerved and shouted between fear and triumph as [I]351-ponderevo recovered from the swerve and heeled the other way and steadied [myself]351-ponderevo . [I]351-ponderevo thought [I]351-ponderevo was going to hit a rook that was flying athwart [me,-it]6402-me,-it was queer with what projectile silence that jumped upon [me]351-ponderevo out of nothingness , and [I]351-ponderevo yelled helplessly , "[351-ponderevo] Get out of the way ! " The bird doubled itself up like a partly inverted V , flapped , went up to the right abruptly and vanished from [my]351-ponderevo circle of interest . Then [I]351-ponderevo saw the shadow of [[my]351-ponderevo aeroplane]2776-my aeroplane keeping a fixed distance before [me]351-ponderevo and very steady , and the turf as it seemed streaming out behind it . The turf!-it was n't after all streaming so impossibly fast . When [I]351-ponderevo came gliding down to [the safe spread of level green [I]351-ponderevo had chosen]6404-the safe spread of level green i had chosen , [I]351-ponderevo was as cool and ready as [a city clerk who drops off an omnibus in motion]6405-a city clerk who drops off an omnibus in motion , and [I]351-ponderevo had learnt much more than soaring . [I]351-ponderevo tilted up [her]6406-her nose at the right moment , levelled again and grounded like a snowflake on a windless day . [I]351-ponderevo lay flat for an instant and then knelt up and got on [my]351-ponderevo feet atremble , but very satisfied with [myself]351-ponderevo . [Cothope]634-cothope was running down [the hill]1314-the hill to [me]351-ponderevo . ... But from that day [I]351-ponderevo went into training , and [I]351-ponderevo kept [myself]351-ponderevo in training for many months . [I]351-ponderevo had delayed [my]351-ponderevo experiments for very nearly six weeks on various excuses because of [my]351-ponderevo dread of this first flight , because of the slackness of body and spirit that had come to [me]351-ponderevo with the business life . The shame of that cowardice spurred [me]351-ponderevo none the less because it was probably altogether [my]351-ponderevo own secret . [I]351-ponderevo felt that [Cothope]634-cothope at any rate might suspect . [Well,-he]6408-well,-he should n't suspect again . It is curious that [I]351-ponderevo remember that shame and self accusation and its consequences far more distinctly than [I]351-ponderevo recall the weeks of vacillation before [I]351-ponderevo soared . For a time [I]351-ponderevo went altogether without alcohol , [I]351-ponderevo stopped smoking altogether and ate very sparingly , and every day [I]351-ponderevo did something that called a little upon [my]351-ponderevo nerves and muscles . [I]351-ponderevo soared as frequently as [I]351-ponderevo could . [I]351-ponderevo substituted [a motor - bicycle]6409-a motor - bicycle for [the London train]6410-the london train and took [my]351-ponderevo chances in the southward traffic , and [I]351-ponderevo even tried what thrills were to be got upon a horse . But [they]6411-they put [me]351-ponderevo on made horses , and [I]351-ponderevo conceived a perhaps unworthy contempt for the certitudes of equestrian exercise in comparison with the adventures of mechanism . Also [I]351-ponderevo walked along the high wall at [the back of [Lady Grove]203-lady grove garden]6412-the back of lady grove garden , and at last brought [myself]351-ponderevo to stride the gap where the gate comes . If [I]351-ponderevo did n't altogether get rid of a certain giddy instinct by such exercises , at least [I]351-ponderevo trained [my]351-ponderevo will until it did n't matter . And soon [I]351-ponderevo no longer dreaded flight , but was eager to go higher into the air , and [I]351-ponderevo came to esteem soaring upon [a glider]2772-a glider , that even over the deepest dip in [the ground]6414-the ground had barely forty feet of fall beneath it , a mere mockery of what flight might be . [I]351-ponderevo began to dream of the keener freshness in the air high above the beechwoods , and it was rather to satisfy that desire than as any legitimate development of [my]351-ponderevo proper work that presently [I]351-ponderevo turned a part of [my]351-ponderevo energies and the bulk of [my]351-ponderevo private income to the problem of the navigable balloon . [I]351-ponderevo had gone far beyond that initial stage ; [I]351-ponderevo had had two smashes and a broken rib which [[my]351-ponderevo aunt]1458-my aunt nursed with great energy , and was getting some reputation in [the aeronautic world]6416-the aeronautic world when , suddenly , as though [she]1458-my aunt had never really left it , [the Honourable Beatrice Normandy]409-beatrice , dark - eyed , and with the old disorderly wave of the hair from [her]1458-my aunt brow , came back into [my]351-ponderevo life . [She]1458-my aunt came riding down a grass path in [the thickets below [Lady Grove]203-lady grove]6417-the thickets below lady grove , perched up on [a huge black horse]6418-a huge black horse , and [the old Earl of [Carnaby]608-carnaby]6419-the old earl of carnaby and [Archie Garvell]363-archie , [[her]1458-my aunt half - brother]822-her half - brother , were with [her]1458-my aunt . [[My]351-ponderevo uncle]731-my uncle had been bothering [me]351-ponderevo about [the Crest Hill hot - water pipes]6422-the crest hill hot - water pipes , and [we]6423-us were returning by a path transverse to [theirs]6422-the crest hill hot - water pipes and came out upon [them]6422-the crest hill hot - water pipes suddenly . And live in [a little house]6488-a little house . "[409-beatrice] [She]409-beatrice nodded [her]409-beatrice head vaguely over [her]409-beatrice shoulder and turned to [me]0-i again . " Well , suppose it was an accident . Here [you]0-i are ! Now [you]0-i 're here , what are [you]0-i going to do ? [You]0-i 're young . Is it to be [Parliament]639-parliament ? heard [some men the other day]6489-some men the other day talking about [you]0-i . Before [I]409-beatrice knew [you]0-i were [you]0-i . [They]6489-some men the other day said that was what [you]0-i ought to do . "[409-beatrice] ... [She]409-beatrice put [me]0-i through [my]0-i intentions with a close and vital curiosity . It was just as [she]409-beatrice had tried to imagine [me]0-i [a soldier]4391-a soldier and place [me]0-i years ago . [She]409-beatrice made [me]0-i feel more planless and incidental than ever . " [You]0-i want to make a flying - machine , "[409-beatrice] [she]409-beatrice pursued , " and when [you]0-i fly ? What then ? Would it be for fighting ? "[409-beatrice] [I]0-i told [her]409-beatrice something of [my]0-i experimental work . [She]409-beatrice had never heard of [the soaring aeroplane]3420-the soaring aeroplane , and was excited by the thought , and keen to hear about it . [She]409-beatrice had thought all the work so far had been a mere projecting of impossible machines . For [her]409-beatrice [Pilcher]552-pilcher and [Lilienthal]551-lilienthal had died in vain . "[609-lady osprey] " Whenever [you]409-beatrice please . Only let [me]409-beatrice know "[409-beatrice] " [I]409-beatrice 'll take [my]409-beatrice chance some day . Some day soon . "[409-beatrice] [She]409-beatrice looked at [me]0-i thoughtfully , smiled , and [our]3423-our talk was at an end . All [my]0-i later work in aeronautics is associated in [my]0-i memory with the quality of [Beatrice]409-beatrice , with [her]409-beatrice incidental presence , with things [she]409-beatrice said and did and things [I]0-i thought of that had reference to [her]409-beatrice . In the spring of that year [I]0-i had got to a flying machine that lacked nothing but longitudinal stability . [My]0-i model flew like a bird for fifty or a hundred yards or so , and then either dived and broke [its]3424-its nose or , what was commoner , reared up , slid back and smashed [its]3424-its propeller . The rhythm of the pitching puzzled [me]0-i . [I]0-i felt it must obey some laws not yet quite clearly stated . [I]0-i became therefore [a student of theory and literature]3425-a student of theory and literature for a time ; [I]0-i hit upon the string of considerations that led [me]0-i to what is called [Ponderevo]351-ponderevo 's Principle and [my]0-i F.R.S. , and [I]0-i worked this out in three long papers . Meanwhile [I]0-i made a lot of turn - table and [glider models]3426-glider models and started in upon an idea of combining gas - bags and gliders . Balloon work was new to [me]0-i . [I]0-i had made one or two ascents in the balloons of [the Aero Club]3427-the aero club before [I]0-i started [my]0-i gasometer and [the balloon shed]3428-the balloon shed and gave [Cothope]634-cothope a couple of months with [Sir Peter Rumchase]640-sir peter rumchase . [[My]0-i uncle]731-my uncle found part of the money for these developments ; [he]731-my uncle was growing interested and competitive in this business because of [Lord Boom]607-boom 's prize and the amount of reclame involved , and it was at [his]731-my uncle request that [I]0-i named [my]0-i first navigable balloon [Lord Roberts Alpha]641-lord roberts alpha . [Lord Roberts A]642-lord roberts a very nearly terminated all [my]0-i investigations . [My]0-i idea both in this and [[its]642-lord roberts a more successful and famous younger brother]3430-its more successful and famous younger brother , [Lord Roberts B]353-lord roberts b , was to utilise the idea of a contractile balloon with a rigid flat base , a balloon shaped rather like an inverted boat that should almost support the apparatus , but not quite . The gas - bag was of the chambered sort used for these long forms , and not with an internal balloonette . The trouble was to make the thing contractile . This [I]0-i sought to do by fixing a long , fine - meshed silk net over it that was fastened to be rolled up on two longitudinal rods . Practically [I]0-i contracted [my]0-i sausage gas - bag by netting it down . The ends were too complex for [me]0-i to describe here , but [I]0-i thought them out elaborately and they were very carefully planned . [Lord Roberts]353-lord roberts b A was furnished with a single big screw forward , and there was a rudder aft . The engine was the first one to be , so to speak , right in the plane of the gas - bag . [I]0-i lay immediately under the balloon on a sort of glider framework , far away from either engine or rudder , controlling them by wire - pulls constructed on the principle of the well - known Bowden brake of the cyclist . But [Lord Roberts A]642-lord roberts a has been pretty exhaustively figured and described in various aeronautical publications . The unforeseen defect was the badness of the work in the silk netting . It tore aft as soon as [I]0-i began to contract the balloon , and the last two segments immediately bulged through the hole , exactly as an inner tube will bulge through the ruptured outer cover of a pneumatic tire , and then the sharp edge of the torn net cut the oiled - silk of the distended last segment along a weak seam and burst it with a loud report . Up to that point the whole thing had been going on extremely well . As a navigable balloon and before [I]0-i contracted it , [the Lord Roberts A]642-lord roberts a was an unqualified success . [It]642-lord roberts a had run out of [the shed]3431-the shed admirably at nine or ten miles an hour or more , and although there was a gentle southwester blowing , it had gone up and turned and faced it as well as any craft of the sort [I]0-i have ever seen . [I]0-i lay in [my]0-i customary glider position , horizontal and face downward , and the invisibility of all the machinery gave an extraordinary effect of independent levitation . Only by looking up , as it were , and turning [my]0-i head back could [I]0-i see the flat aeroplane bottom of [the balloon]3432-the balloon and the rapid successive passages , swish , swish , swish of the vans of the propeller . [I]0-i made a wide circle over [Lady Grove]203-lady grove and [Duffield]614-duffield and out towards [Effingham]263-effingham and came back quite successfully to the starting - point . Down below in the October sunlight were [[my]0-i sheds]3330-my sheds and [the little group that had been summoned to witness the start]3434-the little group that had been summoned to witness the start , [their]3434-the little group that had been summoned to witness the start faces craned upward and most of [them]3434-the little group that had been summoned to witness the start scrutinising [my]0-i expression through field - glasses . [I]0-i could see [Carnaby]608-carnaby and [Beatrice]409-beatrice on horseback , and [two girls]3435-two girls [I]0-i did not know with [them]3434-the little group that had been summoned to witness the start ; [Cothope]634-cothope and [three or four [workmen]1416-workmen [I]0-i employed]3436-three or four workmen i employed ; [[my]0-i aunt]1458-my aunt and [Mrs. Levinstein]643-mrs. levinstein , who was staying with [her]1458-my aunt , on foot , and [Dimmock]644-dimmock , [the veterinary surgeon]3439-the veterinary surgeon , and [one or two others]3440-one or two others . [My]0-i shadow moved a little to the north of [them]3434-the little group that had been summoned to witness the start like the shadow of a fish . At [Lady Grove]203-lady grove [the servants]827-the servants were out on [the lawn]5850-the lawn , and [the Duffield school playground]3443-the duffield school playground swarmed with [children]5395-children too indifferent to aeronautics to cease [their]5395-children playing . But in [the Crest Hill]205-crest hill direction - [the place]877-the place looked extraordinarily squat and ugly from above - there were knots and strings of [staring workmen]3446-staring workmen everywhere - not one of [them]3434-the little group that had been summoned to witness the start working , but all agape . ( But now [I]0-i write it , it occurs to [me]0-i that perhaps it was [their]3434-the little group that had been summoned to witness the start dinner hour ; it was certainly near twelve . ) [I]0-i hung for a moment or so enjoying the soar , then turned about to face a clear stretch of open down , let the engine out to full speed and set [my]0-i rollers at work rolling in the net , and so tightening the gas - bags . Instantly the pace quickened with the diminished resistance ... In that moment before the bang [I]0-i think [I]0-i must have been really flying . Before the net ripped , just in the instant when [my]0-i balloon was at its systole , the whole apparatus was , [I]0-i am convinced , heavier than air . That , however , is a claim that has been disputed , and in any case this sort of priority is a very trivial thing . Then came a sudden retardation , instantly followed by an inexpressibly disconcerting tilt downward of the machine . That [I]0-i still recall with horror . [I]0-i could n't see what was happening at all and [I]0-i could n't imagine . It was a mysterious , inexplicable dive . The thing , it seemed , without rhyme or reason , was kicking up its heels in the air . The bang followed immediately , and [I]0-i perceived [I]0-i was falling rapidly . [I]0-i was too much taken by surprise to think of the proper cause of the report . [I]0-i do n't even know what [I]0-i made of it . [I]0-i was obsessed , [I]0-i suppose , by that perpetual dread of [the modern aeronaut]3447-the modern aeronaut , a flash between engine and balloon . Yet obviously [I]0-i was n't wrapped in flames . [I]0-i ought to have realised instantly it was n't that . [I]0-i did , at any rate , whatever other impressions there were , release the winding of the outer net and let the balloon expand again , and that no doubt did something to break [my]0-i fall . [I]0-i do n't remember doing that . Indeed , all [I]0-i do remember is the giddy effect upon the landscape of falling swiftly upon it down a flat spiral , the hurried rush of [fields]3448-fields and trees and [cottages]3449-cottages on [my]0-i left shoulder and the overhung feeling as if the whole apparatus was pressing down the top of [my]0-i head . [I]0-i did n't stop or attempt to stop the screw . That was going on , swish , swish , swish all the time . [Cothope]634-cothope really knows more about the fall than [I]0-i do . [He]634-cothope describes the easterly start , the tilt , and the appearance and bursting of a sort of bladder aft . Then down [I]0-i swooped , very swiftly , but not nearly so steeply as [I]0-i imagined [I]0-i was doing . " Fifteen or twenty degrees , "[634-cothope] said [Cothope]634-cothope , " to be exact . "[634-cothope] From [him]634-cothope it was that [I]0-i learnt that [I]0-i let the nets loose again , and so arrested [my]0-i fall . [He]634-cothope thinks [I]0-i was more in control of [myself]0-i than [I]0-i remember . But [I]0-i do not see why [I]0-i should have forgotten so excellent a resolution . [His]634-cothope impression is that [I]0-i was really steering and trying to drop into the Farthing Down beeches . " [You]0-i hit the trees , "[634-cothope] [he]634-cothope said , " and the whole affair stood on its nose among them , and then very slowly crumpled up . [I]634-cothope saw [you]0-i 'd been jerked out , as [I]634-cothope thought , and [I]634-cothope did n't stay for more . [I]634-cothope rushed for [my]634-cothope bicycle . "[634-cothope] As a matter of fact , it was purely accidental that [I]0-i came down in [the woods]3450-the woods . [I]0-i am reasonably certain that [I]0-i had no more control then than a thing in a parcel . [I]0-i remember [I]0-i felt a sort of wincing , " Now it comes ! "[0-i] as the trees rushed up to [me]0-i . If [I]0-i remember that , [I]0-i should remember steering . Then the propeller smashed , everything stopped with a jerk , and [I]0-i was falling into a mass of yellowing leaves , and [Lord Roberts A]642-lord roberts a , so it seemed to [me]0-i , was going back into the sky . [I]0-i felt twigs and things hit [me]0-i in the face , but [I]0-i did n't feel injured at the time ; [I]0-i clutched at things that broke , tumbled through a froth of green and yellow into a shadowy world of great bark - covered arms , and there , snatching wildly , got a grip on a fair round branch , and hung . [I]0-i became intensely alert and clear - headed . [I]0-i held by that branch for a moment and then looked about [me]0-i , and caught at another , and then found [myself]0-i holding to a practicable fork . [I]0-i swung forward to that and got a leg around it below its junction , and so was able presently to clamber down , climbing very coolly and deliberately . [I]0-i dropped ten feet or so from the lowest branch and fell on [my]0-i feet . " That 's all right , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and stared up through the tree to see what [I]0-i could of the deflated and crumpled remains that had once been [Lord Roberts]642-lord roberts a A festooned on the branches it had broken . " Gods ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " what a tumble ! "[0-i] [I]0-i wiped something that trickled from [my]0-i face and was shocked to see [my]0-i hand covered with blood . [I]0-i looked at [myself]0-i and saw what seemed to [me]0-i an astonishing quantity of blood running down [my]0-i arm and shoulder . [I]0-i perceived [my]0-i mouth was full of blood . It 's a queer moment when one realises [one]696-one is hurt , and perhaps badly hurt , and has still to discover just how far [one]696-one is hurt . [I]0-i explored [my]0-i face carefully and found unfamiliar contours on the left side . The broken end of a branch had driven right through [my]0-i cheek , damaging [my]0-i cheek and teeth and gums , and left a splinter of itself stuck , like [an explorer]3453-an explorer 's fartherest - point flag , in the upper maxillary . That and a sprained wrist were all [my]0-i damage . But [I]0-i bled as though [I]0-i had been chopped to pieces , and it seemed to [me]0-i that [my]0-i face had been driven in . [I]0-i ca n't describe just the horrible disgust [I]0-i felt at that . " This blood must be stopped , anyhow , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , thickheadedly . " [I]0-i wonder where there 's a spider 's web"-an[0-i] odd twist for [my]0-i mind to take . But it was the only treatment that occurred to [me]0-i . [I]0-i must have conceived some idea of going [home]1390-home unaided , because [I]0-i was thirty yards from the tree before [I]0-i dropped . Then a kind of black disc appeared in the middle of [the world]751-the world and rushed out to the edge of things and blotted them out . [I]0-i do n't remember falling down . [I]0-i fainted from excitement , disgust at [my]0-i injury and loss of blood , and lay there until [Cothope]634-cothope found [me]0-i . [He]634-cothope was the first to find [me]0-i , scorching as [he]634-cothope did over [the downland turf]3456-the downland turf , and making a wide course to get [the Carnaby plantations]3457-the carnaby plantations at their narrowest . Then presently , while [he]634-cothope was trying to apply the methodical teachings of [the St. John 's Ambulance classes]3458-the st. john 's ambulance classes to a rather abnormal case , [Beatrice]409-beatrice came galloping through the trees full - tilt , with [Lord Carnaby]608-carnaby hard behind [her]409-beatrice , and [she]409-beatrice was hatless , muddy from a fall , and white as death . " And cool as a cucumber , too , "[634-cothope] said [Cothope]634-cothope , turning it over in [his]634-cothope mind as [he]634-cothope told [me]0-i . ( " [They]6493-they never seem quite to have [their]6493-they heads , and never seem quite to lose ['em]6494-'em , "[634-cothope] said [Cothope]634-cothope , generalising about the sex . ) Also [he]634-cothope witnessed [she]409-beatrice acted with remarkable decision . The question was whether [I]0-i should be taken to [the house [[her]409-beatrice step - mother]3384-her step - mother occupied at [Bedley Corner]265-bedley corner , [the Carnaby dower house]3461-the carnaby dower house , or down to [[Carnaby]608-carnaby 's place at [Easting]266-easting]3462-carnaby 's place at easting]3459-the house her step - mother occupied at bedley corner , the carnaby dower house , or down to carnaby 's place at easting . [Beatrice]409-beatrice had no doubt in the matter , for [she]409-beatrice meant to nurse [me]0-i . [Carnaby]608-carnaby did n't seem to want that to happen . " [She]409-beatrice WOULD have it was n't half so far , "[634-cothope] said [Cothope]634-cothope . " [She]409-beatrice faced [us]6495-us out .... "[634-cothope] [I]0-i hate to be faced out of [my]0-i opinion , so [I]0-i 've taken a pedometer over it since . It 's exactly forty - three yards further . " [Lord Carnaby]608-carnaby looked at [her]409-beatrice pretty straight , "[634-cothope] said [Cothope]634-cothope , finishing the picture ; " and then [he]634-cothope give in . "[634-cothope] But [my]0-i story has made a jump from June to October , and during that time [my]0-i relations with [Beatrice]409-beatrice and [the countryside that was [her]409-beatrice setting]3463-the countryside that was her setting had developed in many directions . [She]409-beatrice came and went , moving in an orbit for which [I]0-i had no data , going to [London]9-london and [Paris]154-paris , into [Wales]28-wales and [Northampton]267-northampton , while [[her]409-beatrice stepmother]3464-her stepmother , on some independent system of [her]3464-her stepmother own , also vanished and recurred intermittently . At [home]1390-home [they]3466-they obeyed the rule of [an inflexible old maid]3467-an inflexible old maid , [Charlotte]571-charlotte , and [Beatrice]409-beatrice exercised all the rights of proprietorship in [[Carnaby]608-carnaby 's extensive stables]3468-carnaby 's extensive stables . [Her]409-beatrice interest in [me]0-i was from the first undisguised . [She]409-beatrice found [her]409-beatrice way to [[my]0-i worksheds]3131-my worksheds and developed rapidly , in spite of the sincere discouragement of [Cothope]634-cothope , into [a keen amateur of aeronautics]3470-a keen amateur of aeronautics . [She]409-beatrice would come sometimes in the morning , sometimes in the afternoon , sometimes afoot with [an Irish terrier]3471-an irish terrier , sometimes riding . [She]409-beatrice would come for three or four days every day , vanish for a fortnight or three weeks , return . It was not long before [I]0-i came to look for [her]409-beatrice . From the first [I]0-i found [her]409-beatrice immensely interesting . To [me]0-i [she]409-beatrice was a new feminine type altogether - [I]0-i have made it plain , [I]0-i think , how limited was [my]0-i knowledge of [women]1391-women . But [she]409-beatrice made [me]0-i not simply interested in [her]409-beatrice , but in [myself]0-i . [She]409-beatrice became for [me]0-i something that greatly changes [a man]718-a man 's world . How shall [I]0-i put it ? [She]409-beatrice became [an audience]3474-an audience . Since [I]0-i 've emerged from the emotional developments of the affair [I]0-i have thought it out in a hundred aspects , and it does seem to [me]0-i that this way in which [men]1661-men and [women]1391-women make [audiences]3477-audiences for [one another]1140-one another is a curiously influential force in [their]3479-their lives . For some it seems [an audience]3474-an audience is a vital necessity , [they]3481-they seek [audiences]3477-audiences as creatures seek food ; [others]4601-others again , [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle among [them]4601-others , can play to an imaginary audience . [I]0-i , [I]0-i think , have lived and can live without one . In [my]0-i adolescence [I]0-i was [[my]0-i own audience]3485-my own audience and [[my]0-i own court of honour]3486-my own court of honour . And to have [an audience]3474-an audience in [one]696-one 's mind is to play a part , to become self - conscious and dramatic . For many years [I]0-i had been self - forgetful and scientific . [I]0-i had lived for work and impersonal interests until [I]0-i found scrutiny , applause and expectation in [Beatrice]409-beatrice 's eyes . Then [I]0-i began to live for the effect [I]0-i imagined [I]0-i made upon [her]409-beatrice , to make that very soon the principal value in [my]0-i life . [I]0-i played to [her]409-beatrice . [I]0-i did things for the look of them . [I]0-i began to dream more and more of beautiful situations and fine poses and groupings with [her]409-beatrice and for [her]409-beatrice . [I]0-i put these things down because they puzzle [me]0-i . [I]0-i think [I]0-i was in love with [Beatrice]409-beatrice , as being in love is usually understood ; but it was quite a different state altogether from [my]0-i passionate hunger for [Marion]485-marion , or [my]0-i keen , sensuous desire for and pleasure in [Effie]532-effie . These were selfish , sincere things , fundamental and instinctive , as sincere as the leap of a tiger . But until matters drew to a crisis with [Beatrice]409-beatrice , there was an immense imaginative insurgence of a quite different quality . [I]0-i am setting down here very gravely , and perhaps absurdly , what are no doubt elementary commonplaces for [innumerable people]3489-innumerable people . This love that grew up between [Beatrice]409-beatrice and [myself]0-i was , [I]0-i think - [I]0-i put it quite tentatively and rather curiously - romantic love . That unfortunate and truncated affair of [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle and [the Scrymgeour lady]3491-the scrymgeour lady was really of the same stuff , if a little different in quality . [I]0-i have to admit that . The factor of audience was of primary importance in either else . Its effect upon [me]0-i was to make [me]0-i in many respects adolescent again . It made [me]0-i keener upon the point of honour , and anxious and eager to do high and splendid things , and in particular , brave things . So far it ennobled and upheld [me]0-i . But it did also push [me]0-i towards vulgar and showy things . At bottom it was disingenuous ; it gave [my]0-i life the quality of stage scenery , with one side to [the audience]3492-the audience , another side that was n't meant to show , and an economy of substance . It certainly robbed [my]0-i work of high patience and quality . [I]0-i cut down the toil of research in [my]0-i eagerness and [her]409-beatrice eagerness for fine flourishes in the air , flights that would tell . [I]0-i shirked [the longer road]3493-the longer road . And it robbed [me]0-i , too , of any fine perception of absurdity . Yet that was not everything in [our]3494-our relationship . The elemental thing was there also . It came in very suddenly . It was one day in the summer , though [I]0-i do not now recall without reference to [my]0-i experimental memoranda whether it was in July or August . [I]0-i was working with a new and more bird - like aeroplane with wing curvatures studied from [Lilienthal]551-lilienthal , [Pilcher]552-pilcher and [Phillips]645-phillips , that [I]0-i thought would give a different rhythm for the pitching oscillations than anything [I]0-i 'd had before . [I]0-i was soaring [my]0-i long course from the framework on the old barrow by [[my]0-i sheds]3330-my sheds down to [[Tinker]646-tinker 's Corner]3496-tinker 's corner . [It]3497-it is [a clear stretch of downland]3498-a clear stretch of downland , except for two or three thickets of box and thorn to the right of [my]0-i course ; one transverse trough , in which there is bush and [a small rabbit warren]3499-a small rabbit warren , comes in from the east . [I]0-i had started , and was very intent on the peculiar long swoop with which any new arrangement flew . Then , without any sort of notice , right ahead of [me]0-i appeared [Beatrice]409-beatrice , riding towards [Tinker]646-tinker 's Corner to waylay and talk to [me]0-i . [She]409-beatrice looked round over [her]409-beatrice shoulder , saw [me]0-i coming , touched [her]409-beatrice horse to a gallop , and then [the brute]3500-the brute bolted right into the path of [[my]0-i machine]3501-my machine . There was a queer moment of doubt whether [we]3502-we should n't all smash together . [I]0-i had to make up [my]0-i mind very quickly whether [I]0-i would pitch - up and drop backward at once and take [my]0-i chance of falling undamaged - a poor chance it would have been - in order to avoid any risk to [her]409-beatrice , or whether [I]0-i would lift against the wind and soar right over [her]409-beatrice . This latter [I]0-i did . [She]409-beatrice had already got [her]409-beatrice horse in hand when [I]0-i came up to [her]409-beatrice . [[Her]409-beatrice woman]3503-her woman 's body lay along [his]3500-the brute neck , and [she]409-beatrice glanced up as [I]0-i , with wings aspread , and every nerve in a state of tension , swept over [her]409-beatrice . Then [I]0-i had landed , and was going back to where [her]409-beatrice horse stood still and trembling . [We]3504-we exchanged no greetings . [She]409-beatrice slid from [her]409-beatrice saddle into [my]0-i arms , and for one instant [I]0-i held [her]409-beatrice . " Those great wings , "[409-beatrice] [she]409-beatrice said , and that was all . [She]409-beatrice lay in [my]0-i arms , and [I]0-i thought for a moment [she]409-beatrice had fainted . " Very near a nasty accident , "[634-cothope] said [Cothope]634-cothope , coming up and regarding [[our]3504-we grouping]3505-our grouping with disfavour . [He]634-cothope took [her]409-beatrice horse by the bridle . " Very dangerous thing coming across [us]3504-we like that . "[634-cothope] [Beatrice]409-beatrice disengaged [herself]409-beatrice from [me]0-i , stood for a moment trembling , and then sat down on the turf " [I]409-beatrice 'll just sit down for a moment , "[409-beatrice] [she]409-beatrice said . " Oh ! "[409-beatrice] [she]409-beatrice said . [She]409-beatrice covered [her]409-beatrice face with [her]409-beatrice hands , while [Cothope]634-cothope looked at [her]409-beatrice with an expression between suspicion and impatience . For some moments [nobody]1152-nobody moved . Then [Cothope]634-cothope remarked that perhaps [he]634-cothope 'd better get [her]409-beatrice water . As for [me]0-i , [I]0-i was filled with a new outrageous idea , begotten [I]0-i scarcely know how from this incident , with its instant contacts and swift emotions , and that was that [I]0-i must make love to and possess [Beatrice]409-beatrice . [I]0-i see no particular reason why that thought should have come to [me]0-i in that moment , but it did . [I]0-i do not believe that before then [I]0-i had thought of [our]3507-we relations in such terms at all . Suddenly , as [I]0-i remember it , the factor of passion came . [She]409-beatrice crouched there , and [I]0-i stood over [her]409-beatrice , and neither of [us]3507-we said a word . But it was just as though something had been shouted from the sky . [Cothope]634-cothope had gone twenty paces perhaps when [she]409-beatrice uncovered [her]409-beatrice face . " [I]409-beatrice sha n't want any water , "[409-beatrice] [she]409-beatrice said . " Call [him]608-carnaby back . "[409-beatrice] After that the spirit of [our]3507-we relations changed . [The old ease]3508-the old ease had gone . [She]409-beatrice came to [me]0-i less frequently , and when [she]409-beatrice came [she]409-beatrice would have [some one]4434-some one with [her]409-beatrice , usually [old Carnaby]608-carnaby , and [he]608-carnaby would do the bulk of the talking . All through [September]647-september [she]409-beatrice was away . When [we]3507-we were alone together there was a curious constraint . [We]3507-we became clouds of inexpressible feeling towards [one another]1140-one another ; [we]3507-we could think of nothing that was not too momentous for words . Then came the smash of [Lord Roberts A]642-lord roberts a , and [I]0-i found [myself]0-i with a bandaged face in [a bedroom in [the Bedley Corner dower - house]3512-the bedley corner dower - house]3511-a bedroom in the bedley corner dower - house with [Beatrice]409-beatrice presiding over [an inefficient nurse]3513-an inefficient nurse , [Lady Osprey]609-lady osprey very pink and shocked in the background , and [[my]0-i aunt]1458-my aunt jealously intervening . [My]0-i injuries were much more showy than serious , and [I]0-i could have been taken to [Lady Grove]203-lady grove next day , but [Beatrice]409-beatrice would not permit that , and kept [me]0-i at [Bedley Corner]265-bedley corner three clear days . In the afternoon of the second day [she]409-beatrice became extremely solicitous for the proper aeration of [the nurse]3515-the nurse , packed [her]409-beatrice off for an hour in a brisk rain , and sat by [me]0-i alone . [I]0-i asked [her]409-beatrice to marry [me]0-i . All the whole [I]0-i must admit it was not a situation that lent itself to eloquence . [I]0-i lay on [my]0-i back and talked through bandages , and with some little difficulty , for [my]0-i tongue and mouth had swollen . But [I]0-i was feverish and in pain , and the emotional suspense [I]0-i had been in so long with regard to [her]409-beatrice became now an unendurable impatience . " Comfortable ? [The nurse]3515-the nurse found [me]0-i still wearing [my]0-i helmet of bandages , partially dressed , and pottering round [the room]1559-the room to find the rest of [my]0-i clothes . [I]0-i wrote back a love letter - [my]0-i first love letter - and [she]409-beatrice made no reply for eight days . Then came a scrawl : "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't write letters . " [I]3536-i think [the reader]4558-the reader would be amused if [he]4558-the reader could see the papers on [my]3536-i desk as [I]3536-i write all this , the mangled and disfigured pages , the experimental arrangements of notes , the sheets of suggestions balanced in constellations , the blottesque intellectual battlegrounds over which [I]3536-i have been fighting . [I]3536-i find this account of [my]3536-i relations to [Beatrice]409-beatrice quite the most difficult part of [my]3536-i story to write . [I]3536-i happen to be [a very objective - minded person]6508-a very objective - minded person , [I]3536-i forget [my]3536-i moods , and this was so much an affair of moods . And even such moods and emotions as [I]3536-i recall are very difficult to convey . To [me]3536-i it is about as difficult as describing a taste or a scent . Then the objective story is made up of little things that are difficult to set in a proper order . And love in an hysterical passion , now high , now low , now exalted , and now intensely physical . [No one]4418-no one has ever yet dared to tell a love story completely , its alternations , its comings and goings , its debased moments , its hate . The love stories [we]3534-we tell , tell only the net consequence , the ruling effect .... How can [I]3536-i rescue from the past now the mystical quality of [Beatrice]409-beatrice ; [my]3536-i intense longing for [her]409-beatrice ; the overwhelming , irrational , formless desire ? How can [I]3536-i explain how intimately that worship mingled with a high , impatient resolve to make [her]409-beatrice mine , to take [her]409-beatrice by strength and courage , to do [my]3536-i loving in a violent heroic manner ? And then the doubts , the puzzled arrest at the fact of [her]409-beatrice fluctuations , at [her]409-beatrice refusal to marry [me]3536-i , at the fact that even when at last [she]409-beatrice returned to [Bedley Corner]265-bedley corner [she]409-beatrice seemed to evade [me]3536-i ? That exasperated [me]3536-i and perplexed [me]3536-i beyond measure . [I]3536-i felt that it was treachery . [I]3536-i thought of every conceivable explanation , and the most exalted and romantic confidence in [her]409-beatrice did not simply alternate , but mingled with the basest misgivings . And into the tangle of memories comes the figure of [Carnaby]608-carnaby , coming out slowly from the background to a position of significance , as an influence , as a predominant strand in the nets that kept [us]6510-us apart , as [a rival]6511-a rival . What were the forces that pulled [her]409-beatrice away from [me]3536-i when it was so clearly manifest [she]409-beatrice loved [me]3536-i ? Did [she]409-beatrice think of marrying [him]608-carnaby ? Had [I]3536-i invaded some long - planned scheme ? It was evident [he]608-carnaby did not like [me]3536-i , that in some way [I]3536-i spoilt [the world]751-the world for [him]608-carnaby . [She]409-beatrice returned to [Bedley Corner]265-bedley corner , and for some weeks [she]409-beatrice was flitting about [me]3536-i , and never once could [I]3536-i have talk with [her]409-beatrice alone . When [she]409-beatrice came to [[my]3536-i sheds]3330-my sheds [Carnaby]608-carnaby was always with [her]409-beatrice , jealously observant . ( Why the devil could n't [she]409-beatrice send [him]608-carnaby about [his]608-carnaby business ? ) The days slipped by and [my]3536-i anger gathered . All this mingles with the making of [Lord Roberts]642-lord roberts a B. [I]3536-i had resolved upon that one night as [I]3536-i lay awake at [Bedley Corner]265-bedley corner ; [I]3536-i got it planned out before the bandages were off [my]3536-i face . [I]3536-i conceived this second navigable balloon in a grandiose manner . It was to be a second [Lord Roberts A]642-lord roberts a , only more so ; it was to be three times as big , large enough to carry [three men]6514-three men , and it was to be an altogether triumphant vindication of [my]3536-i claims upon the air . The framework was to be hollow like a bird 's bones , airtight , and the air pumped in or out , and the weight of fuel [I]3536-i carried changed . [I]3536-i talked much and boasted to [Cothope]634-cothope - whom [I]3536-i suspected of scepticisms about this new type - of what it would do , and it progressed - slowly . It progressed slowly because [I]3536-i was restless and uncertain . At times [I]3536-i would go away to [London]9-london to snatch some chance of seeing [Beatrice]409-beatrice there , at times nothing but a day of gliding and hard and dangerous exercise would satisfy [me]3536-i . And now in the newspapers , in conversation , in everything about [me]3536-i , arose a new invader of [my]3536-i mental states . Something was happening to the great schemes of [[my]3536-i uncle]731-my uncle 's affairs ; [people]920-people were beginning to doubt , to question . It was the first quiver of [his]731-my uncle tremendous insecurity , the first wobble of that gigantic credit top [he]731-my uncle had kept spinning so long . There were comings and goings , [November]652-november and [December]653-december slipped by . [I]3536-i had two unsatisfactory meetings with [Beatrice]409-beatrice , meetings that had no privacy - in which [we]6517-we said things of the sort that need atmosphere , baldly and furtively . [I]3536-i wrote to [her]409-beatrice several times and [she]409-beatrice wrote back notes that [I]3536-i would sometimes respond to altogether , sometimes condemn as insincere evasions . "[3536-i] [You]3536-i do n't understand . [I]0-i ca n't just now explain . Be patient with [me]0-i . Leave things a little while to [me]0-i . " [She]409-beatrice wrote . [I]3536-i would talk aloud to these notes and wrangle over them in [[my]3536-i workroom]6518-my workroom - while the plans of [Lord Roberts B]353-lord roberts b waited . "[3536-i] [You]3536-i do n't give [me]0-i a chance ! " [I]3536-i would say . "[3536-i] Why do n't [you]3536-i let [me]0-i know the secret ? That 's what [I]0-i 'm for - to settle difficulties ! to tell difficulties to ! " And at last [I]3536-i could hold out no longer against these accumulating pressures . [I]3536-i took an arrogant , outrageous line that left [her]409-beatrice no loopholes ; [I]3536-i behaved as though [we]6519-we were living in a melodrama . "[3536-i] [You]3536-i must come and talk to [me]0-i , " [I]3536-i wrote , "[3536-i] or [I]0-i will come and take [you]3536-i . [I]0-i want [you]3536-i - and the time runs away . [The two ladies]3360-the two ladies were at [home]1390-home and alone beside a big fire that seemed wonderfully cheerful after the winter night . [I]0-i remember the effect of the little parlour in which [they]3360-the two ladies sat as very bright and domestic . [Lady Osprey]609-lady osprey , in a costume of mauve and lace , sat on a chintz sofa and played an elaborately spread - out patience by the light of a tall shaded lamp ; [Beatrice]409-beatrice , in a whiteness that showed [her]409-beatrice throat , smoked a cigarette in an armchair and read with a lamp at [her]409-beatrice elbow . That expedition to [Mordet Island]207-mordet island stands apart from all the rest of [my]0-i life , detached , a piece by itself with an atmosphere of its own . It would , [I]0-i suppose , make a book by itself - it has made a fairly voluminous official report - but so far as this novel of [mine]0-i goes it is merely an episode , a contributory experience , and [I]0-i mean to keep it at that . Vile weather , an impatient fretting against unbearable slowness and delay , sea - sickness , general discomfort and humiliating self - revelation are the master values of these memories . [I]0-i was sick all through the journey out . [I]0-i do n't know why . It was the only time [I]0-i was ever sea - sick , and [I]0-i have seen some pretty bad weather since [I]0-i became [a boat - builder]6590-a boat - builder . But that phantom smell of potatoes was peculiarly vile to [me]0-i . On the way out [most of [the others]2005-the others]6595-most of the others recovered in a few days , but the stuffiness below , the coarse food , [the cramped dirty accommodation]6597-the cramped dirty accommodation kept [me]0-i , if not actually sea - sick , in a state of acute physical wretchedness the whole time . [The ship]6552-the ship abounded in cockroaches and more intimate vermin . [I]0-i was cold all the time until after [we]6592-we passed [Cape Verde]278-cape verde , then [I]0-i became steamily hot ; [I]0-i had been too preoccupied with [Beatrice]409-beatrice and [my]0-i keen desire to get [the Maud Mary]3571-the maud mary under way at once , to consider a proper wardrobe for [myself]0-i , and in particular [I]0-i lacked a coat . [Pollack]568-pollack , after conducting [his]568-pollack illness in a style better adapted to the capacity of [an opera house]6602-an opera house than [a small compartment]6603-a small compartment , suddenly got insupportably well and breezy , and produced a manly pipe in which [he]568-pollack smoked a tobacco as blond as [himself]568-pollack , and divided [his]568-pollack time almost equally between smoking it and trying to clean it . "[0-i] There 's only three things [you]3660-you can clean a pipe with , " [he]568-pollack used to remark with a twist of paper in hand . " [He]568-pollack would sit swaying with the rolling of [the ship]6552-the ship and suck at [his]568-pollack pipe of blond tobacco and look with an inexpressibly sage but somnolent blue eye at [the captain]3580-the captain by the hour together . "[3669-captain] [Captain]3669-captain 's a Card , " [he]568-pollack would say over and over again as the outcome of these meditations . "[3669-captain] [He]3669-captain 'd like to know what [we]3670-we 're up to . [He]3669-captain 'd like to know - no end . " That did seem to be [the captain]3580-the captain 's ruling idea . [He]568-pollack had learnt [the sea]1422-the sea in [the Roumanian navy]6609-the roumanian navy , and English out of a book ; [he]568-pollack would still at times pronounce the e 's at the end of "[3669-captain] there " and "[3669-captain] here " ; [he]568-pollack was [a naturalised Englishman]6610-a naturalised englishman , and [he]568-pollack drove [me]3669-captain into a reluctant and uncongenial patriotism by [his]568-pollack everlasting carping at things English . [Pollack]568-pollack would set [himself]568-pollack to "[3669-captain] draw [him]3669-captain out . " [Heaven]598-heaven alone can tell how near [I]3669-captain came to murder . Fifty - three days [I]3669-captain had outward , cooped up with [these two]1317-these two and [a shy and profoundly depressed mate who read the Bible on Sundays]6612-a shy and profoundly depressed mate who read the bible on sundays and spent the rest of [his]568-pollack leisure in lethargy , three and fifty days of life cooped up in a perpetual smell , in a persistent sick hunger that turned from the sight of food , in darkness , cold and wet , in a lightly ballasted ship that rolled and pitched and swayed . And all the time the sands in the hour - glass of [[my]3669-captain uncle]731-my uncle 's fortunes were streaming out . [Misery]657-misery ! Amidst it all [I]3669-captain remember only one thing brightly , one morning of sunshine in [the Bay of Biscay]281-the bay of biscay and a vision of frothing waves , sapphire green , a bird following [our]6614-our wake and [our]6614-our masts rolling about the sky . Then wind and rain close in on [us]6614-our again . [You]6615-you must not imagine they were ordinary days , days , [I]3669-captain mean , of an average length ; they were not so much days as long damp slabs of time that stretched each one to the horizon , and much of that length was night . [One]696-one paraded [the staggering deck]6617-the staggering deck in [a borrowed sou'-wester]6618-a borrowed sou'-wester hour after hour in the chilly , windy , splashing and spitting darkness , or sat in [the cabin]6619-the cabin , bored and ill , and looked at the faces of [those inseparable companions]6620-those inseparable companions by the help of a lamp that gave smell rather than light . Then [one]696-one would see going up , up , up , and then sinking down , down , down , [Pollack]568-pollack , extinct pipe in mouth , humorously observant , bringing [his]696-one mind slowly to the seventy - seventh decision that [the captain]3580-the captain was [a Card]6623-a card , while the words flowed from the latter in a nimble incessant good . "[3669-captain] Dis [England]1-england eet is not [a country aristocratic]3671-a country aristocratic , no ! [Eet]3672-eet is [a glorified bourgeoisie]3673-a glorified bourgeoisie ! Eet is plutocratic . In [England]1-england dere is [no aristocracy]3674-no aristocracy since [de Wars of Roses]282-de wars of roses . In [the rest of [Europe]23-europe east of [the Latins]3676-the latins]3675-the rest of europe east of the latins , yes ; in [England]1-england , no . " Eet is all middle - class , [[youra]6624-you [England]1-england]6625-youra england . Everything [you]6624-you look at , [middle - class]6626-middle - class . Respectable ! What would [you]6624-you ? "[3677-he] ... [I]0-i knew [he]3677-he would make a thousand objections to all [we]3678-we had before [us]3678-we . [He]3677-he talked like [a drugged man]3682-a drugged man . Forward [the crew]3584-the crew lived lives very much after the fashion of [ours]3703-we , more crowded , more cramped and dirty , wetter , steamier , more verminous . The coarse food [they]3584-the crew had was still not so coarse but that [they]3584-the crew did not think [they]3584-the crew were living " like fighting cocks . "[3584-the crew] So far as [I]0-i could make out [they]3584-the crew were [all nearly destitute men]3705-all nearly destitute men ; hardly any of [them]3584-the crew had a proper sea outfit , and what small possessions [they]3584-the crew had were a source of mutual distrust . And as [we]3703-we pitched and floundered southward [they]3584-the crew gambled and fought , were brutal to [one another]1140-one another , argued and wrangled loudly , until [we]3703-we protested at the uproar . There 's no romance about [the sea]1422-the sea in [a small sailing ship]3708-a small sailing ship as [I]0-i saw it . The romance is in the mind of [the landsman dreamer]3709-the landsman dreamer . [These brigs and schooners and brigantines that still stand out from [every little port]3711-every little port]3710-these brigs and schooners and brigantines that still stand out from every little port are relics from an age of petty trade , as rotten and obsolescent as [a Georgian house that has sunken into a slum]3712-a georgian house that has sunken into a slum . They are indeed just floating fragments of slum , much as icebergs are floating fragments of glacier . But so it was [I]0-i made [my]0-i voyage to [Africa]212-africa , and came at last into [a world of steamy fogs and a hot smell of vegetable decay]3714-a world of steamy fogs and a hot smell of vegetable decay , and into sound and sight of surf and distant intermittent glimpses of [the coast]6544-the coast . [I]0-i lived a strange concentrated life through all that time , such a life as a creature must do that has fallen in a well . All [my]0-i former ways ceased , all [my]0-i old vistas became memories . The situation [I]0-i was saving was very small and distant now ; [I]0-i felt its urgency no more . [Beatrice]409-beatrice and [Lady Grove]203-lady grove , [[my]0-i uncle]731-my uncle and [the Hardingham]204-the hardingham , [my]0-i soaring in the air and [my]0-i habitual wide vision of swift effectual things , became as remote as if they were in some world [I]0-i had left for ever .... All these African memories stand by themselves . It was for [me]0-i an expedition into the realms of undisciplined nature out of [the world]751-the world that is ruled by [men]1661-men , [my]0-i first bout with that hot side of [[our]3719-we mother]3720-our mother that gives [you]3721-you [the jungle]3722-the jungle - that cold side that gives [you]3721-you the air - eddy [I]0-i was beginning to know passing well . They are memories woven upon a fabric of sunshine and heat and a constant warm smell of decay . They end in rain - such rain as [I]0-i had never seen before , a vehement , a frantic downpouring of water , but [our]3719-we first slow passage through the channels behind [[Mordet]563-mordet 's Island]2926-mordet 's island was in incandescent sunshine . There [we]3719-we go in [my]0-i memory still , [a blistered dirty ship with patched sails]3724-a blistered dirty ship with patched sails and a battered mermaid to present [Maud Mary]284-maud mary , sounding and taking thought between [high ranks of forest whose trees come out knee - deep at last in [the water]5257-the water]3725-high ranks of forest whose trees come out knee - deep at last in the water . There [we]3719-we go with a little breeze on [[our]3719-we quarter]3727-our quarter , [Mordet Island]207-mordet island rounded and the quap , it might be within a day of [us]3719-we . Here and there strange blossoms woke the dank intensities of green with a trumpet call of colour . Things crept among [the jungle]3722-the jungle and peeped and dashed back rustling into stillness . Always in the sluggishly drifting , opaque water were eddyings and stirrings ; little rushes of bubbles came chuckling up light - heartedly from this or that submerged conflict and tragedy ; now and again were crocodiles like a stranded fleet of logs basking in the sun . Still it was by day , a dreary stillness broken only by insect sounds and the creaking and flapping of [our]3719-we progress , by the calling of the soundings and [the captain]3580-the captain 's confused shouts ; but in the night as [we]3719-we lay moored to a clump of trees the darkness brought a thousand swampy things to life and out of [the forest]3730-the forest came screaming and howlings , screaming and yells that made [us]3719-we glad to be afloat . And once [we]3719-we saw between the tree stems long blazing fires . [We]3719-we passed [two or three villages]3731-two or three villages landward , and [brown - black women]3732-brown - black women and [children]5395-children came and stared at [us]3719-we and gesticulated , and once [a man]718-a man came out in [a boat]3735-a boat from [a creek]3736-a creek and hailed [us]3719-we in an unknown tongue ; and so at last [we]3719-we came to [a great open place , [a broad lake rimmed]3738-a broad lake rimmed with a desolation of mud and bleached refuse and dead trees , free from crocodiles or water birds or sight or sound of any living thing]3737-a great open place , a broad lake rimmed with a desolation of mud and bleached refuse and dead trees , free from crocodiles or water birds or sight or sound of any living thing , and saw far off , even as [Nasmyth]562-gordon - nasmyth had described , [the ruins of [the deserted station]3740-the deserted station]3739-the ruins of the deserted station , and hard by two little heaps of buff - hued rubbish under a great rib of rock , the quap ! [The forest]3730-the forest receded . Finally [I]0-i went on [deck]3758-deck to cool . The sky was overcast [I]0-i discovered [all the men]3759-all the men were in a knot forward , staring at the faint quivering luminosity that had spread over the heaps of quap , a phosphorescence such as one sees at times on rotting wood . And about [the beach]2925-the beach east and west there were patches and streaks of something like diluted moonshine .... In the small hours [I]0-i was still awake and turning over scheme after scheme in [my]0-i mind whereby [I]0-i might circumvent [the captain]3580-the captain 's opposition . [I]0-i meant to get that quap aboard if [I]0-i had to kill [some one]4434-some one to do it . Never in [my]0-i life had [I]0-i been so thwarted ! After this intolerable voyage ! There came a rap at [[my]0-i cabin]3763-my cabin door and then it opened and [I]0-i made out a bearded face . " Come in , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and a black voluble figure [I]0-i could just see obscurely came in to talk in [my]0-i private ear and fill [[my]0-i cabin]3763-my cabin with its whisperings and gestures . It was [the captain]3580-the captain . [He]3580-the captain , too , had been awake and thinking things over . [He]3580-the captain had come to explain - enormously . [I]0-i lay there hating [him]3580-the captain and wondering if [I]0-i and [Pollack]568-pollack could lock [him]3580-the captain in [[his]3580-the captain cabin]3766-his cabin and run [the ship]6552-the ship without [him]3580-the captain . " [I]3580-the captain do not want to spoil dis expedition , "[3580-the captain] emerged from a cloud of protestations , and then [I]0-i was able to disentangle " a commission - shush a small commission - for special risks ! "[3580-the captain] " Special risks "[3580-the captain] became frequent . [I]0-i let [him]3580-the captain explain [himself]3580-the captain out . It appeared [he]3580-the captain was also demanding an apology for something [I]0-i had said . No doubt [I]0-i had insulted [him]3580-the captain generously . At last came definite offers . [I]0-i broke [my]0-i silence and bargained . " [Pollack]568-pollack ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried and hammered the partition . " What 's up ? "[568-pollack] asked [Pollack]568-pollack . [I]0-i stated the case concisely . There came a silence . " [He]3580-the captain 's a Card , "[568-pollack] said [Pollack]568-pollack .
